loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa, esta en su cuarta secuencia de crédito, con buena referencia crediticia, se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir y los vende en La localidad del Desaguadero, frontera entre Bolivia Y Perú y también en las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz, la Sra. Rosa, confecciona diferentes prendas en su propio taller que esta ubicado en su domicilio de la zona Villa Nuevo Potosí, la Sra. Rosa solicita este crédito para la compra de tela por mayor para la confección de prendas de vestir ya que tiene que entregar un pedido,  por lo que se pudo evidenciar la cliente en el momento de la evaluación, fue muy atento y además cordial. La Sra. Rosa, es una persona muy dinámica y muy trabajadora que tiene mucho entusiasmo en cuanto a su trabajo, para así con el tiempo su deseo es comprarse una casa que este en una avenida o en una calle comercial para poder también ofrecer al publico sus prendas de vestir.
texts.en: Rosa is in her fourth credit cycle, with good credit. She makes clothing and sells them in the town of Desaguadero on the border of Bolivia and Perú. She also sells them in the craft fairs in the city of La Paz. Rosa makes different types of clothing in her own workshop located in her house in the zone of Villa Nuevo Potosí. Rosa is requesting this loan to buy wholesale fabric to make garments, as she has to complete an order for a customer who was very nice and friendly. Rosa is a dynamic person and very hard-working. She is very enthusiastic about her work and with time, wants to buy a house that is on an avenue or commercial street so that she can sell her clothing to the greater public.

loans.use: buy wholesale fabric

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, 52, resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is a widow with three children. She, together with her children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Erlinda operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Erlinda dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ziyoboi

texts.ru: Зиёбой 1969 года рожденья, у него 6 детей.  Раньше он работал на заводе, но после распада СССР, ему пришлось  заниматься разными бизнесами  и  работать на стройке разнорабочим.  По совету отца он начал разводить скот. С утра до вечера он пас скот на пастбище  и по весне у него скот увеличивался, так он ежемесячно подавал и покупал  новый скот.  Сейчас стало все проще,  он передает стадо пастуху и платит ему за работу. В настоящий момент он получает кредит для  покупки коз.
texts.en: Ziyoboi was born in 1969, he has six children. He used to work in a factory, but after the collapse of the USSR he had to try different businesses and work as a handyman in construction. He took his father's advice and started breeding cattle. He shepherded the cattle on the pastures from dusk till dawn and with the coming of spring his cattle multiplied as he sold and bought new cattle monthly. Right now things are more simple. Ziyoboi gives the cattle to the shepherd and pays him for the work. At this time he is taking out the loan to buy goats.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Nourng

texts.en:
Nourng, age 52, is a  humble local farmer who cultivates rice crops for her livelihood. She presently lives together with her husband and 3 single children in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. Besides rice farming, Nourng generates extra income by selling Khmer cakes and grilled bananas from a booth at a side of a national road.

Nourng now is applying for a loan of USD600 to purchase rice seed, fertilizers, and to pay for a plowing fee. She hopes she’ll be able to improve her business through using this loan.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed and fertilizers, and to pay for a plowing fee.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas is 52 years and is a single parent. Her husband passed away a few years ago and left her with 4 children, most of whom are married and have independent living. Recently, Meas engaged in a groceries selling business. She sells beef soup with noodles and fish porridge to the people in her neighborhood, and she is able to earn around $3.50 per day.

With the requested amount from HKL, Meas will use it to purchase a used motorcycle for her two children commuting to their workplaces, where they currently work as seamstresses. This motorcycle will enable her family to improve their living standard by reducing some expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Gbedokpo 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement GBEDOKPO 2 est composé de douze personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupement, du nom de Madeleine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Madeleine est âgée de 43 ans et vit au Bénin. Madeleine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Madeleine est mariée à un certain Edgard et est mère de trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Madeleine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins tout en assurant les diverses charges du ménage, Madeleine mène comme activité depuis une dizaine d'année, la vente de maïs et des légumes à son domicile. Madeleine achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Madeleine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBEDOKPO 2, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Gbedokpo 2 group is made up of 12 people who live in the same area. This is the second time that the group is requesting a loan from ALIDé, in order to be able to raise their level of business activity.

Madeleine, the group's representative, has her hand raised in the picture. She is 43 years old and lives in Benin. She did not get a formal education. She is married to Edgar and is the mother of 3 children, some of whom attend school. Madeleine lives together with her children and husband, and she and her spouse share the various family expenses. In order to be able to to care of her needs and cover the household expenses, she has been selling corn and vegetables from her home for around a decade. She gets her products in a Benin market.

In order to be able to satisfy customer demand and increase her turnover and revenue, Madeleine is requesting, together with the other members of the Gbedokpo 2 group, a second loan from ALIDé. They have properly reimbursed the first one.

loans.use: to restock on bags of corn and vegetables.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long is a 49-year-old married man with one daughter. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Long earns money with the business of repairing motorcycles and selling parts. He has been involved in this business for twenty years. Now, Long would like to take a loan to invest in his business. He plans to use this loan to buy motorcycle parts to stock his store and to serve more customers. 

He hopes that through this loan, he will be able to increase the turnover of his business. This will enable him to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle parts to stock his store

loans.name: Fadhl

texts.en:
Fadhl is a 24-year-old single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has been operating a spice store and has worked a great part of his life with the intention, first of moving his parents ahead, and now of providing a better quality of life for them. Formerly he used to work with his father in the store and thus contributed toward meeting family expenses at that time.  Currently, he continues working in the same store, but now with the objective of contributing to his own household expenses since his father has become an old man and is unable to work.

Fadhl waits on a large number of customers, in great part because of the good service he provides, and thanks to this he can contribute sufficient money to maintain his home.

Currently, his store has a small quantity of products on the shelves, but he does not have sufficient money to purchase more items from his suppliers. He took out a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB that will enable him to buy basic household goods such as sauces, beans, pepper, cumin, seasoning, rice, cooking oil, and sugar as well as other spices and stock his business. He hopes that with the purchase of these products his store will have a larger quantity of items to offer and in this way he will be able to meet his customers’ demands.

In the future, he dreams that his parents will have a better quality of life and make economic progress and in addition he will be able to expand his business which will qualify him to get more profit and get married.

loans.use: to buy basic household goods such as sauces, beans, pepper, cumin, seasoning, rice, cooking oil, sugar and spices to stock his business.

loans.name: Hamoud

texts.en:
Hamoud is a 25-year-old single man who lives in Sana`a. He studies for a bachelor degree and has been operating a shop selling books and clocks. He has three years of experience in this field and has gained the skills and experience necessary to be a successful entrepreneur. 

He has learned both market prices and his customers' needs very well. Hence, he usually buys merchandise for lower prices than his competitors and resells it more profitably. Stationary is in high demand because there are a lot of schools and institutes where these supplies help to facilitate their work. 

Hamoud would like to expand his business in order to buy religious pictures, gifts, perfumes and clocks, and for this purpose he has applied for a youth loan of 150,000 Yemeni Rial (YER) from AMB. 

In the future, he wishes to increase his sales in order to get married and improve the living conditions of his family as well as open a telecommunication shop.

loans.use: to buy religious pictures, gifts,perfumes and o`clockes for his business.

loans.name: Albsatin Group

texts.en:
This group is called ALBSATIN. It is made up of five women, Faezah, Bshara, Barka, Hakima and Mona, who are neighbors from Aden, Yemen. They are hard-working and enterprising women. They took a loan of 250,000 YER.

Mona is the group's leader. She is 22 years old, a married woman who lives in Aden, Yemen. She completed her secondary school only and she sells fabric and various other items, and has over two years of experience. In the photograph, she is on the right side wearing a green scarf. She stocks fabric, robes and dresses to sell to her clients.

Since she has professional experience in this field, she attracted more clients which helped her business to continue successfully running and made the business more profitable. Recently, she took out a youth loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to invest in her business by buying more fabrics, skirts and dresses and reselling them to her customers. This loan will allow her to strengthen her business so that she can increase her revenue.

She hopes to earn large profits so that she can improve her savings in order to obtain a big loan and further expand her business.

loans.use: to invest in her business by buying more fabrics, skirts and dresses.

loans.name: Ebrahim

texts.en:
Ebrahim is 28 years old, a married man and father of two children who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. His educational background is secondary school only. He works hard to provide his family with a good and healthy lifestyle.
 
He has been running a buffet for five years in which he offers his customers all types of products such as hot drinks, fresh juices and sandwiches. He says that his business allows him to help with the economics of the family. Additionally, he has employed two workers in his business.

He is a person who is well-known and highly esteemed by his neighbors and customers, who consider him a responsible man. He has been able to attract clients because of making all types of delicious foods and tasty juices which are produced by him.

Ebrahim wants to acquire more products with which he can grow his business in order to achieve his objective. So, he considered it appropriate to request a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to order to buy his business needs such as vegetables, beans, sugar, and spices, etc.
 
In the future, Ebrahim would like to rent another shop to open an Internet Cafe.

loans.use: to buy  things he needs such as vegetables, beans, sugar, and spices, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a 29-year-old, single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen and has gone through some hardships in his life. However, because of his dedication and desire to get ahead in life, he has been able to overcome these difficulties and make progress, together with his family. For most of his life, he has worked in wholesale and retail stores. With the experience that he acquired over almost eight years, he decided to establish his own grocery store where he offers basic consumer goods for sale. Thanks to his store, Ahmed is able to generate the income he needs to support his household. 

Now, his inventory of merchandise has diminished considerably. With the intention of increasing the quantity of products that he offers, he wants to buy some shelving where he could place more products on display for his customers. He also wants to buy a greater variety of products to offer them. However, he does not have enough capital to make all of these purchases, and so it is for this reason that he requested a youth loan of 300000 YER from AMB. This loan will provide him with the opportunity to buy shelving where he could exhibit the products that he offers to his customers and more grocery items.

In the future, he would like to have a house and buy a car in order to raise his family`s lifestyle.

loans.use: to provide him with the opportunity to buy shelving and a greater variety of products.

loans.name: Nou

texts.en:
From Baray District of Kompong Tom province, Nou, aged 45, is a responsible mother who is involved in a rice-cultivating and fish-selling business to generate income. Most of her fish is caught from the nearby river called Tonle Sap River, the main source of fish for the Cambodian people. Nou has four children, two of whom work as sewing staff in Phnom Penh city.  

Nou is taking out her fourth cycle loan from HKL to purchase bean seeds and fertilizers to put in her soil. Nou is an honest client of HKL; she has never made any late payment with her previous loans.

loans.use: To purchase bean seeds and fertilizers to put in her soil.

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son, 40, is married and has two daughters. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife is a painter. 

He has supported his family by running a business of motorcycle panel welding at his house for twelve years. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying equipment and materials to better satisfy his customers.

He hopes his business will run smoothly, and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions and send his children to school.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle equipment and welding materials to better satisfy his customers.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan, 41, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as an employee for a local company. Lan supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She started this business five years ago. She sells milk, sugar, soft drinks, and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly, and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en: Speciose is 31 years old. She is a mother of two children between 6 and 8 years old. Her husband works as a mechanic and spare parts dealer. Speciose has spent one year in the business of selling clothes. She says that the business has a great impact on her life as well as the family. With the loan, she plans to buy more ladies clothes and shirts for men. She has a plan of using the profits to buy a cow, which will provide milk for the family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sell.

loans.name: Abunzubumwe/sk Group

texts.fr:
Reverien  fait partie du groupe Abunzubumwe/Sk. Il a 48 ans et il est marié, avec 7 enfants de 7 à 21 ans  dont 7 scolarisés. Il a 3 enfants dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire et 3 ans d’artisanat.

Reverien est commerçant. C’est son quatrième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des haricots, soja, des sorghos, des maïs et améliore son commerce des chèvres pour les revendre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’augmenter son capital pour satisfaire les clients et bien rembourser le crédit pour avoir une autre beaucoup plus. Dans les prochaines années, Reverien voudrait être le grand commerçant et construire une maison pour sa famille. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Reverien is a member of the Abunzubumwe/Sk group. He is 48 years old, married, and father of seven children between the ages of 7 to 21, all of whom attend or attended school. He personally attended six years of primary school and three years at a craft/vocational school.

Reverien is a small business owner. This is the fourth loan he is asking for from ACB. He will use the loan to purchase green beans, soy beans, sorghum and maize, thereby improving his business of selling goats.

His strategy to grow his business is to have more capital, which will allow him to satisfy his clients as well as regularly re-pay his current loans, in order to take out more loans in the future. In the coming years, Reverien would like to become the owner of a medium to large sized enterprise as well as build a home for his family. With the profits earned from his business, he plans to continue to education and take care of his children.

loans.use: purchase green beans, soy beans, sorghum and maize, thereby improving his business of selling goats

loans.name: Twisungane/akvg Group

texts.fr:
Laurent  fait partie du groupe Twisungane/Akvg. Il a 36 ans et il est marié, avec 5 enfants de 8 mois à 13 ans  dont 4 scolarisés. Il a 7 personnes dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire.

Laurent est agriculteur. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants pour son agriculture du riz.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de chercher les marchés pour conquérir les beaucoup des clients et cherche d’autre investissement pour faire l’agriculture moderne. Dans les prochaines années, Laurent voudrait avoir sa propre maison. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser ses enfants et soigner sa famille.
texts.en:
Laurent is a member of the Twisungane/Akvg. group.  He is 36 years old, married, and has 5 children ranging from 13 years to 8 months.  Four of his children attend school.  Besides his children, he has 7 other people in his care.  He is educated up to the 6th year of elementary school.
Laurent is a farmer.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He will use his loan to buy fertilizers for rice farming.
To ensure the growth of his business, his strategy is to look for new markets in order to attract a large number of customers, and also to look for other possible investments in order to modernize his farming technique.  In the coming years, he would like to own a house.  With the profits, he is planning to pay for his children's education and ensure the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for rice farming.

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.en:
Suzanne is a 30-year-old, Lebanese, married woman who lives with her husband and three school-aged children. With the cooperation of her husband, she has been able to cover the challenging family expenses in addition to her children’s school fees. Since 1997, Suzanne’s husband has been serving in the Lebanese army.  In 2009, she opened her own bakery. 

Suzanne wants to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renovate her bakery. She notes that this will improve the bakery, which in turn will allow her attract more clients.  In the future, she plans to diversify her food offerings and increase her sales.

loans.use: to renovate her bakery

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 24-year-old Lebanese woman. She is single and lives with her parents and four employed siblings. The whole family contributes to cover their expenses.  In 2009, Amani began work as a hair dresser from her home.  She knows chic and stylish haircuts that help to attract more customers.

Amani is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy new beauty salon supplies.  She notes that this will increase her job productivity by 20%.  In the future, Amani plans to open her own salon and hire people to work with her.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Latifeh

texts.en:
Latifeh is a 29-year-old Lebanese woman. She is married and lives with her husband and one child.  To fulfill her family’s needs, she collaborates with her husband who works in a local company.  In 2009, Latifeh opened her own flower shop and she also sells artificial flowers. 

Latifeh is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy additional flowers for her shop. This loan will help to increase the number of customers requesting her products and in turn her revenues.  In the future, she plans to enlarge her shop by adding diverse kinds of flowers.

loans.use: to buy additional flowers to sell in her shop

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 26-year-old married man and the father of one child. He works in manufacturing glass doors, windows & storefronts, in addition to mirrors. He is a hardworking man, and he is well known in the region with his good reputation and the best quality of his products with special encouraging prices.

Abbas applied for a Youth Loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary updated tools for his business. This is his fourth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with a good standing pay back history. He stated that his previous loans helped a lot in improving his social & financial situations, and encouraged him to dream about a wide future for his family. He hopes to keep on expanding his business more & more in the future.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools for his business.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en: Ngoc is a 33-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two sons. Ngoc and her husband earn a living running a general store, which she has had for 16 years. Ngoc would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to meet the needs of her existing customers better and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery

loans.name: Vu

texts.en:
Vu is a 40-year-old married man living in Ho Chi Minh City. He has one daughter. Vu's spouse works as a trader.

Vu’s has been in the business of making shoes for eleven years. He plans to use this loan to buy more good quality materials to make shoes and better meet the needs of his customers.   

In the future, Vu would like to expand his business to increase his income to enable him to set aside money for his daughter's education.

loans.use: To buy good quality materials to make shoes.

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en:
Quyen is 32 years-old and single. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Quyen has been earning a living by running a food stall from the door of her house for the past five years. She sells noodles and braised beef. 

She would like to borrow money to expand her business by buying furniture and better quality food to sell from her food stall. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy furniture and good quality foods to sell from her stall

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Aya is a 21-year-old, Lebanese, single woman.  She lives with her parents and three employed siblings. Her father takes care of the family and tries his best to cover all of their needs.  In 2009, Aya started to work as hair dresser from her home.  She has loyal customers who believe in her fashionable and stylish hair designs. 

Aya wants to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy new beauty salon tools, such as a hairdryer and other items.  This loan will definitely allow her attract additional customers.  In the future, Aya plans to request more Kiva loans and open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy new beauty salon tools such as a hairdryer for her home-based salon business.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 29-year-old, Lebanese man who lives with his wife. He is working hard to earn money and enhance his family’s way of living. Even with all the challenges he faced, Hussein was brave and didn’t hesitate to open his own business. 

Hussein began working as a blacksmith in 2009. He’s a reputable person and has gained a fair number of customers so far. 

Today, Hussein is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy a new generator for his work. This will facilitate his business operations.  In the future, he plans to renovate his shop.

loans.use: to buy a new generator for his shop.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 28-year-old Lebanese married man who lives with his wife. He really wishes to have his own family and children, and for this reason he’s working nonstop to improve his family’s way of living. He has been working in selling curtains from his home since 2005. In addition, he also works for a local company. 

Today, Ali wants to take out a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional textiles and materials for his business. He notes that this will develop his work and, thus, his productivity. In the future, he plans to open his own curtain shop.

loans.use: To purchase additional textiles and materials for his business

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Esperanza 2 Group

texts.en:
Santa is the group coordinator of Prosperidad y Esperanza (Prosperity and Hope). Her group is based in the city of Santiago, the second biggest city in Dominican Republic, where she makes her home in a simple structure and runs her business. She is a mother of three children, and she lives together with her long-term partner.

Santa is excited to receive her second loan from Esperanza Internacional, after she was invited to be part of this group and started her business. She sells miscellaneous items and will spend this loan on shoes, clothes, and cosmetics to sell. She will reinvest any profits in her business. Santa's dream for her family is to have her kids safe and own a home to raise them. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products (clothes, shoes, cosmetics)

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 51 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Angelita has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.
Angelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Angelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Arnalene

texts.en: Arnalene is 38 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. She has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Arnalene has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Arnalene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Aptcs1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe APTCS1 est composé de six personnes qui appartiennent à une même association des professionnels de couture. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Maoudjro Apollinaire est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Maoudjro Apollinaire est âgé de 45 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Zénabou. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Maoudjro Apollinaire n'a jamais fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la couture, une activité qu'il exerce depuis une vingtaine d'année et qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et de nourrir sa famille. Maoudjro Apollinaire désire acquérir une autre machine à coudre, afin de mieux répondre aux différentes demandes de sa clientèle et d'accroitre son chiffre d'affaire. Pour ce faire, Maoudjro Apollinaire sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe APTCS1. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Aptcs1 group is composed of 6 people who belong to the same association of professional tailors. This is the third time the group requests a loan from ALIDé, so that they can raise their level of business activity.

Maoudjro Apollinaire, the group's representative, has his hand raised in the picture. He is 45 years old and is married to a trader called Zénabou. The couple have 4 children, some of whom attend school. As well as their own children, the couple are also responsible for 2 more, and both adults share the various household expenses.

Maoudjro Apollinaire never went to school but instead learned tailoring, an occupation he has now been exercising for over 20 years and which enables him to take care of his needs and feed his family. He would like to buy another sewing machine, so that he is better able to respond to his customers' various demands and can increase his turnover. In order to be able to do this, Maoudjro Apollinaire is requesting a third loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the Aptcs1 group. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Magni

texts.fr: Magni a 39 ans, mariée et n'a personne à charge. Elle livre à ses clients les sacs de maïs et vend aussi à la maison, pour une meilleur offre vue la demande de sa clientèle elle a fait appel à l'apport de la micro finance pour mieux servir ses clients en qualité mais surtout en quantité.
texts.en: Magni is 39 years old, married, with no dependent.  She delivers bags of maize to her customers and also sells from home.  To meet a high demand from her customers, she would like to increase her offer and is therefore requesting support from micro-finance.  Her goal is to better serve her customers by improving the quality of her goods, but especially by selling more.

loans.use: to buy 30 bags of maize.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Magdalena is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Magdalena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for resale.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is from Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 33 years old, married, and has 2 children. To make a living, she owns & operates a recycled materials business venture. She has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns about 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Eva joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to improve the business.

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Sithorn

texts.en:
Sithorn, 42, is widowed and resides with one child in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (ancient temples: Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey……..). She is a primary school teacher. Additionally, she fattens up pigs to sell to generate extra income for the family. Approximately, Sithorn earns USD 5 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in traveling to school, Sithorn is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike for commuting to school. This purchase would enable her to go to school on time and to use the money saved on her transportation expense to support the family. In the future, she would like to send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting to school.

loans.name: Racma

texts.en: Racma is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. Racma has a weaving shop that sells mats & bed sheets. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy materials needed for making mats & bed sheets. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Racma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for making mats & bed sheets.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en: Rosalia is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. Rosalia has a weaving shop that makes & sells mats & bed sheets. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy materials needed for making mats & bed sheets. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosalia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for making mats & bed sheets.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom, 31, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (ancient temples: Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey……..). She has been selling Khmer noodle for over ten years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver and earns approximately USD 7 per day.

Due to the lack of funds, Mom is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a plot of land for building a house. By doing so, she would have her own house to live in and not rent a house any more. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land for building a house.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. Lydia has pigpen and she sells grown & matured pigs. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy animal feeds for the pigs. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Lydia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Hoeurt

texts.en:
Hoeurt, 59, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (ancient temples: Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey……..). She and her husband have been involved growing agricultural crops and vegetables, and in fattening up cattle to sell, for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 8 per day. 

Her two children are employed. One is a chef in a guest house and another one is a staff member in the hotel. They earn approximately USD 7 per day. Due to the difficulty in traveling, Hoeurt is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work, as well as to use in the family. This purchase would enable her children to go to work on time and use the money saved on their transportation expense to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and rebuild her house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 4 children. Julius has a shop that sells a variety of beverages like soft drinks. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy a stock of beverages to sell. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Julius hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of beverages to sell.

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en: Mercidita is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Mercidita has a shop that sells fish like trout, sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy stocks of fish for resale. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Piedras Blancas Group

texts.es: La señora Leticia tiene 40 años de edad, ella es casada con 2 hijos varones mayores de edad ya trabajan, ella vende mojarra tilapia, el resto de las integrantes siguen en su actividad que vienen desarrollando, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar redes y macas para pescar, ella inicio su negocio hace 20 años, a ella la invitaron a formar parte de la sociedad de pesca, su esposo pesca y ella los vende en su comunidad, si no termina el pescado elabora tamales de pescado y anuncia por microfono para que las amas de casa vayan a comprar los tamales, su negocio es importante porque de ahí comen y puede cubrir todos los gastos de su casa, a ella le gusta este negocio por las ganancias que obtiene y pueden comer pescado todos los días, sus sueños y esperanzas son que su negocio crezca y que a sus hijos les guste este negocio para que también tengan su propio negocio. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad "gracias por sus préstamos y que sigan  apoyando a las personas que lo necesitan, gracias a ustedes podemos crecer en los negocio y en las familias
texts.en: Leticia is 40 years old. She's married and has two grown sons who work. She sells mojarra and tilapia. The other members continue in the activities they are developing. She asked for her loan to buy nets for fishing. She started her business 20 years ago. She was invited to join the fishing group. Her husband fishes and she she sells them in the community. If she doesn't finish selling the fish she makes fish tamales and announces it with a microphone so that the housewives will go and buy the tamales. Her business is important because they get their food from it and cover all of the household expenses. She likes this business because of the earnings she gets and because they can eat fish every day. Her hopes and dreams are for her business to grow and for her children to like this business so that they can have their own business as well. The members of the group want to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad "thank you for the loans and keep supporting people who need it. Thanks to you, we can grow in our businesses and in our families.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Citlali Group

texts.es: La señora Hortencia tiene 39 años de edad ella estudio hasta el 3er. año de secundaria, ella es casada con 4 hijos, 1 varón y 3 mujeres, estudian las 3 mujeres 1 en bachilleres y 2 en el kínder, el varón ya es mayor de edad, ya trabaja, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar dulces, jabón, aceite, azúcar, galletas para surtir su negocio, ella inicio su negocio hace 4 años, ella empezó comprando poca mercancía como dulces y refrescos con lo que le daba su esposo para el gasto ya después con prestamos, su negocio es importante porque tiene ingresos para los gastos de la escuela de sus hijas, a ella le gusta vender, atender a sus clientes amablemente  para que regresen a la tienda a comprar sus productos, sus sueños y esperanza son que crezca su negocio, que sus hijos estudien y tengan su propio negocio. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por prestarnos y darnos la oportunidad de pagarlo es varios pagos, gracias a ustedes podemos salir adelante”.
texts.en:
Hortencia is 39 years old and studied up to the third year of her secondary education.  She is married and has four children, 1 son and 3 daughters.  Her three daughters are in school: one is in high school and two are in kindergarten.  Her son is already an adult and working. 

Hortencia has a grocery store.  She requested this loan to buy candies, soap, oil, sugar and cookies with which to stock her business.  She started her business four years ago.  She started out buying just a small amount of merchandise such as sweets and soft drinks with money her husband gave her then later she used loans.  Her business is important because it makes her income which she uses to cover her daughters' educational expenses.  Also, she likes selling and enjoys serving her customers in a kind manner so that they return to her store to buy their products.  Hortencia's dreams and hopes are to grow her business, for her children to study and for them to have their own businesses. 

The members of this group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad: "Thank you for the loans and for giving us the opportunity to pay them off over a number of repayments.  Thanks to you we are able to get ahead in life".

loans.use: to buy candies, soap, oil, sugar, cookies, soft drinks and eggs

loans.name: Mahudjlo 4 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUDJLO 4 est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Yémalin Françoise est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Yémalin Françoise est âgée de 31 ans et vit au Bénin. Yémalin Françoise n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Yémalin Françoise est mariée à un certain Jules. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé. Les deux enfants sont à leur charge. Yémalin Françoise vit avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Yémalin Françoise vend depuis six ans environs, des produits cosmétiques de façon ambulante. Yémalin Françoise s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Yémalin Françoise sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUDJLO 4, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois crédits reçus précédemment ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The MAHUDJLO 4 group consists of three people from the same neighborhood. This is the fourth time that the group has sought financial assistance from ALIDé, to raise the level of its activity. The representative of the group, Yémalin Francoise, is the one raising her hand in the picture.

Yémalin Françoise is 31 years old and lives in Benin. She has not attended school, and is married to Jules. The couple has two children, of whom one is in school. The two children are under their care. Yémalin Françoise lives with her children and husband. The couple shares responsibility for all the various family expenses.

To support herself and her children over the past six years, Yémalin Françoise has been selling cosmetics as an itinerant vendor. She resupplies in one of Benin's markets.

In her quest for customer satisfaction and to increase her turnover and income, Françoise Yémalin, together with the other MAHUDJLO 4 group members, is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé. The three previously received loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: buy cosmetics

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: El dia a dia de Kelly es atender su hogar, conformado por su esposo y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 8 a 15 años, responder a las actividades que de su familia  se derivan  y simultáneamente  a su negocio,  a través del cual vende mercancía variada,  como sabanas camisas, bermudas y medias    desde hace 10 años, cuando lo inició invirtiendo la liquidación recibida,  después de terminar su contrato como empleada en una empresa. Inicialmente empezó con un mercado doméstico, conformado por familiares y amigos, gradualmente su negocio ha ido creciendo, como producto de su trabajo persistente y disciplinado. En la actualidad se prepara para la temporada carnavalera y planea invertir en camisetas, bermudas entre otras mercancías, para responder a su clientela, pero su capital de trabajo es insuficiente, porque sus pedidos son superiores a sus posibilidades de ventas  a crédito y a nuevos clientes. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará todas esas mercancías que mantienen a sus clientes siempre fieles y que incrementan su cartera y así mismo sus utilidades..
texts.en: Kelly's daily life consists of looking after her household (her husband and three children who are between 8 and 15 years old), dealing with activities arising from her family and working in her business.  Kelly sells a variety of merchandise such as sheets, t-shirts, Bermuda shorts and socks.  She has been in this business for 10 years.  She started her business investing severance pay that she received when she ended her contract as an employee working for a company.  She started off selling to a market of family members and friends but her business has gradually grown as a result of her persistent and disciplined work.  She is currently preparing for the Carnival season and plans to invest in t-shirts, Bermuda shorts and other merchandise so that she can respond to her customers' requests.  However, she does not have enough working capital because her orders are high which prevents her from making extra sales on credit and to new customers.  This is why she is requesting a Kiva loan (her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo).  She will use the loan to buy all these items so that she can retain the loyalty of her customers, increase her sales and also her profits.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, Bermuda shorts and other merchandise

loans.name: Mahougbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUGBE est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Félicité est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Félicité est âgée de 36 ans et vit au Bénin. Félicité n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Félicité est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Norbert. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Félicité vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Félicité vend depuis cinq ans du charbon de bois et du maïs dans son quartier. Félicité s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Félicité  sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUGBE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Mahougbe group consists of four persons from the same neighborhood. The group is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé for the first time, to raise the level of its activities. The representative of the group, named Félicité, is the one raising her hand in the picture.

Félicité is 36 years old and lives in Benin. She has never attended school, and is married to a retail merchant named Norbert. The couple has two children, both in school and who are their dependents. Félicité lives with her ​​husband and children. The couple provides for all of the various household expenses.

To contribute towards various family expenses, Félicité has been selling charcoal and corn in her neighborhood for the past five years. She resupplies from a market in Benin.

In her quest for customer satisfaction and to increase her turnover and income, Félicité is seeking a first loan from ALIDé, together with other Mahougbe group members.

loans.use: Buy bags of charcoal and corn

loans.name: Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Bertha cuenta con 49 años es madre soltera tiene dos hijos los cuales los ha sacado adelante María Eugenia la mayor esta en 1° de CBTA y Margarito se encuentra en 2° de secundaria, Bertha es muy trabajadora ya que trabaja para sacar adelante a sus hijos ella es la que mantiene su casa.

Ella es comerciante tiene la venta de maíz ya tiene 10 años vendiendo lo compra y lo revende Berta dice que le va muy bien ya que de ese negocio saca para mantener su familia, lo cual invertirá su préstamo en la compra del maíz para vender  a doña Berta le gustaría surtir mucho maíz pero dice que por ahora nadamas para lo que le alcance pero que le esta echando muchas ganas para sacar adelante su negocio y su familia.

Bertha pertenece al grupo las luchadoras el cual esta integrado por 11 personas 10 mujeres y un hombre, que están trabajando para mejorar su posición económica a continuación serán mencionadas: Obdulia, Celia, Julia, Alejandra, Teresa, Aurelia, Gloria, Merced, Diocelina, Inés, todos cuentan con una actividad comercial como son: productos de abarrotes, maíz, venta de animales, pan, fríjol, verduras, etc.
texts.en:
Bertha is 49 years old.  She is a single mother and has two children who she provides for.  Her eldest, María Eugenia, is in her first year of CBTA (an upper-middle level agricultural educational institution) and Margarito is in his second year of high school.  Bertha is very hard-working because she works to provide for her children.  She is the only one who supports her household.

Bertha has been buying and re-selling corn for 10 years.  She says that her business is doing very well because, thanks to her business, she is able to support her family.  She will invest her loan in buying corn to re-sell.  Bertha would like to stock up with a lot of corn but she says that for now she is content with doing what she is able to.  However, she is really keen to make progress in her business and get her family ahead in life.

Bertha belongs to 'Las Luchadoras' community bank which has eleven members (ten women and one man).  They are all working to improve their financial positions and their names are: Obdulia, Celia, Julia, Alejandra, Teresa, Aurelia, Gloria, Merced, Diocelina and Inés.  They each have their own commercial activity including: selling groceries, corn, animals, bread, beans, vegetables, etc.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Azonnagnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AZONNAGNON est composé de sept personnes qui appartiennent à une même association d'artisans. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Emmanuel est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Emmanuel est âgée de 63 ans ans et vit au Bénin. Emmanuel est mariée à une marchande du nom de Lydia. Le couple a six enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Emmanuel a deux autres enfants à charge, en dehors de ses enfants. Emmanuel vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Emmanuel a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire, et a appris ensuite la maçonnerie. Emmanuel exerce cette activité depuis près de vingt cinq ans ; ce qui lui permet d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille. Emmanuel désire acquérir des matériels performants qui lui permettraient de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. C'est la raison pour laquelle Emmanuel sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AZONNAGNON. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Azonnagnon group is made up of 7 people who all belong to the same association of tradesmen. This is the third time the group requests a loan from ALIDé in order to increase their business levels.

Emmanuel, the group's representative, has his hand raised in the picture. He is 63 years old and lives in Benin. He is married to a trader called Lydia. The couple are raising 6 children of their own, who all go to school. They are also responsible for 2 other children. Emmanuel lives together with his wife and children and the couple share the family expenses.

Emmanuel left school at the primary level and learnt masonry. He has been in this line of work for nearly 20 years now, and his income enables him to pay the family's various expenses. Emmanuel would likes to buy some high performance equipment which would help him to better meet the demands of his customers; this is why he is requesting a third loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the Azonnagnon group. The first 2 loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy wheelbarrows, hammers, etc.

loans.name: Amonlakè Marthe

texts.fr: Femme mariée, Marthe est âgée de 51 ans et a quatre enfants. Marchande de produits de beauté et bijoux, pour attirer plus de clientèle elle fait recours à Finadev pour un prêt afin de mieux s'approvisionner.
texts.en:
A married woman, Marthe is 51 years old and has four children. She is a retail merchant selling cosmetics and jewelry.

Wishing to attract more customers, she is requesting a loan from Finadev to improve her stock supply.

loans.use: Buy 4 dozen nail varnishes of different colors, 2 dozen combs, six dozen pencils, 2 packages of pearls, 3 dozen jewelry items.

loans.name: La Guadalupana Group

texts.es:
La señora Adela es uno de los mienbros de un grupo llamado La Guadalupana el cual esta integrado por 10 mujeres luchadoras, trabajadora y amables, cada una de ellas tiene una actividad economica. Doña adela tiene la edad de 49 años, ella estudio hasta el tercero de primaria, se encuentra casada con el señor Erasmo quien trabaja de obrero, ellos tiene 7 hijos los cuales ya se encuentra casado, ella y su esposo viven en una region donde la actividad principal es la elaboracion de azucar. Ella nos platica que dese hace un años decidio iniciar con su propio negocio de venta de refrescos y venta de antojitos mexicanos (empanadas, tostadas, tacos dorados, picadas) porque queria apoyar a sus esposo con los gasto de sus hogar y tengar una mejor calidad de vida. Doña Adela nos platica que ha rentado un pequeño local junto a la primaria donde realiza sus venta de refrescos y dulces, tambien vende antojitos mexicanos(empanadas, tostadas, 
tacos dorados, picadas) en la hora del recreo pone sus puesto de sus alimentos sobre una mesa, dice que le va bien pues los niños compran su desayuno alli y ya tiene popularidad entre los alumnos de la escuela primaria. Ella necesita este credito para la compra de masa, tortillas, aceite, queso, carne, refrescos, jugos, crema, platos desechables, refrescos y dulces para su posterior venta de productos. Doña Adela espera que con esta inversion su negocio postere ya que desea dar unama mejor calidad de vida a su 
familia

este grupo agradece a la fundacion por la confianza y apoyo que se le ha dado.

los demas integrantes del grupo son:

perla venta de zapatos
elvira venta de ganado
bernarda venta de abarrotes 
cruz maria venta de pollo 
rosa elvira venta de ropa
rodolfa venta de ropa
yessenia venta de ropa
Nicolasa venta de longaniza 
Maclovia venta de cosmeticos
texts.en:
Adela is a member of a group called 'La Guadalupana'.  This group has ten members who are all tenacious, hard-working and kind women.  Each of the women has her own business activity.

Adela is 49 years old and studied up to the third year of elementary school.  She is married to Erasmo who is a manual worker.  They have seven children who are all married.  Adela and her husband live in a region whose main business activity is sugar production.  She tells us that, some years ago, she decided to start her own business selling soft drinks and Mexican snacks (empanadas, tostadas, fried tacos and picadas) because she wanted to support her husband with their household expenses and enjoy a better quality of life.  Adela tells us that she rented a small sales location next to the elementary school and this is where she sells her soft drinks and sweet treats.  She also sells Mexican snacks (empanadas, tostadas, fried tacos and picadas).  During recess she puts her food on a table to sell.  She says that her business is doing well because the children buy their breakfast there and she is already popular with the students.  

Adela needs this loan to buy corn dough, tortillas, oil, cheese, meat, soft drinks, juice, cream, disposable plates and candies.  She hopes that this investment will boost her business because she would like to provide her family with a better quality of life.  The group's members are grateful to Fundación Realidad for the trust that they have placed in them and the support that they have given them.  The other members of the group are:
Perla - shoe sales
Elvira - livestock sales
Bernarda - grocery sales
Cruz Maria - chicken sales
Rosa Elvira - clothes sales
Rodolfa - clothes sales
Yessenia - clothes sales
Nicolasa - 'longaniza' (spicy pork sausage) sales
Maclovia - cosmetics sales

loans.use: to buy corn dough, tortillas, oil, cheese, meat, soft drinks, juice, cream and disposable plates

loans.name: Guerrero Oaxaca Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Guerrero Oaxaca  esta conformado por  diez mujeres trabajadoras con deseos de superarse y hacer crecer sus negocios.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Teresa Emilia una señora de cincuenta y cinco años de edad.
Ella se dedica a la venta de tamales y mole para  la elaboración de enchiladas  para la venta por mayoreo y menudeo.
Ella nos cuenta que desde hace veinte cinco años se ha dedicado a la venta de tamales ya que le deja buenas ganancias y así le da una mejor vida a su familia.
Tiene la cantidad   de cinco hijos Laura, Maraina, Emili, Zamari  y Ángel  quienes también le ayudan a comprar  lo que necesite  para la elaboración de tamales y mole.
Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es limpiar las hojas de plátano y moler el chile seco para  la elaboración del mole.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra   de ingredientes para la elaboración del  mole y tamales como es: hojas de plátano, Chile seco, jitomate, cebolla, ajos, clavo y pimienta, pan molido y aceite.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Maria – quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Modesta Edilberta-quien se dedica  a la venta de chiles y semillas.
Abigail-quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Araceli-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Alma-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Guadalupe-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Nancy-quien se dedica a la venta de teléfonos.
Evodia-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos.
Gabriela  Patricia -quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion por el poyo que les ha dado para que puedan hacer  crecer sus negocios y darle una mejor vida  a sus familias.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Guerrero Oaxaca'.  It is made up of ten hard-working women who have a desire to do well and grow their businesses.

One of the members of this group is Teresa Emilia who is 55 years old.  Her business is selling tamales and mole sauce which is used for making enchiladas.  She sells wholesale and retail.  She tells us that she has been selling tamales for 25 years and the business makes her good profits which enables her to provide her family with a better quality of life.  She has five children: Laura, Maraina, Emili, Zamari and Ángel.  They also help her to buy what she needs for making her tamales and mole sauce.  What Teresa Emilia most enjoys about her business is cleaning the plantain leaves and grinding the dried chili for making her mole sauce.  She requested this loan to buy ingredients for making her mole sauce and tamales: plantain leaves, dried chilis, tomatoes, onion, garlic, cloves, pepper, breadcrumbs and oil.

The other members of this group are:
Maria - who sells perfumes
Modesta Edilberta - who sells chilis and seeds
Abigail - who sells perfume
Araceli - who sells clothing
Alma - who sells clothing
Guadalupe - who sells clothing
Nancy - who sells telephones
Evodia - who sells Mexican snacks
Gabriela Patricia - who sells perfume

All of the women are grateful to Fundación Realidad for the support that they have given them as it enables them to grow their businesses and provide their families with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making tamales and mole sauce

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Say, 53, is widowed and resides with her daughter, son in-law and a grandchild in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area that is well known for its historical tourism sites such as the ancient temples Angkor Wat, Bayon and Banteay Srey. She has been involved in growing rice and vegetables, and in fattening cattle to sell for more than 20 years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. 

Her daughter is a staffer in a local organization and her son in-law is a staffer in a tour company. They earn approximately USD 9 per day. In order to get electricity to use, Say is requesting a loan of USD 500 to pay for the electricity connection service. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it stronger and to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to pay for the electricity connection service

loans.name: Sepura

texts.en:
Sepura lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for seven years. She is 45 years old, married, and has six children; two of them are still in school. 

Sepura heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Riza Mae

texts.en:
Riza Mae is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 1 child. Riza Mae has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of Natasha and Avon products to sell.

Riza Mae has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Riza Mae hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of Natasha and Avon products to sell

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is married with 5 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marlyn is 38 years old and has 1 child who is in school. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment. In the future, Marlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Shannel

texts.en:
Shannel is married with two children. Shannel is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community member to earn a living. She's been doing this for two years and every month she earns 2,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional vehicle spare parts. 

In 2009, Shannel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Shannel hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Chantal

texts.fr: Agée de 37ans, Chantal est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Coiffeuse de formation, elle y associe la vente des mêches et produits défrisants. Dans le but d'étendre son activité et de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle, elle sollicite et obtient un micro-crédit à Finadev. Le gain dégagé lui permettra de contribuer activement aux charges du foyer .
texts.en:
Age 37, Chantal is married and the mother of one child. A trained hairdresser, she also sells hair extensions and hair relaxing products. 

In order to be able to extend her business and meet her customers' needs, Chantal has requested and obtained a micro-credit loan from Finadev. Her subsequent earnings will allow her to actively contribute to the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy 50 hair extensions and 30 mixed hair relaxing products.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a widow with four children. She is 63 years old and resides in Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte: Philippines. Remedios owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living, and she's been 2 years in this business. Each month, she earns about PHP 3,000 doing this type of business.

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2009, Remedios joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to build a house and to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is from Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. She is 58 years old. Pacita is married and has 4 children. To make a living, she is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community. She has been in her business for 2 years and earns about 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Pacita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Mey

texts.en:
Mey, 50, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (ancient temples: Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey……..). She and her husband have been involved in growing rice, vegetables, and fattening up pigs to sell for over ten years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. 

Her two children are employed. One is a staff member in a restaurant, and another one is a staff member in a hotel. They earn approximately USD 8 per day. 

In order to get electricity to use, Mey is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to pay for the electricity connection service. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and build a new house.

loans.use: to pay for the electricity connection service.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface has operated his restaurant business in Nakuru town for the last six years.  He is 28 years old, married to Roseline and they have three school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy cooking ingredients and seats to add to his restaurant.

In future, Boniface hopes to expand his business and open another restaurant.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients and buy seats.

loans.name: Sejerina

texts.en:
Sejerina lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal and has been in business for five years. She is 38 years old, married, and has six children; two of them are still in school. 

Sejerina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Amalia has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from raising livestock.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her motorcycle's maintenance

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 10 children. She has a shop that sells green & yellow bananas. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of bananas to sell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Norma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Chanrey

texts.en:
Chanrey, 24, is married, resides with her husband and one child in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (ancient temples: Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey, etc.) She has been involved in breeding pigs and raising fish to sell for over ten years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is an electrician who approximately earns USD 10 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s economy, Chanrey is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase groceries and gasoline to sell at home to generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and gasoline to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 34 years old, married, and a mother of a son aged three years old. She has been running her retail shop for a period of about three years with an income of KES.14,500.


This is her second loan through KADET LTD, after successfully repaying the previous one. She wants to use the loan to buy more stock of maize flour, sugar and rice for sale. She hopes to be a wholesaler and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is 56 years old and married with 10 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice grain retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of rice grains to sell.

Eleonor has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice grain retailing business for six years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Eleonor aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Ida

texts.fr: Couturière de formation et mère de quatre enfants, Ida vit avec son mari en location. Parallèllement à son activité, elle vend des pagnes, chaussures et sacs. En vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, elle bénéficie d'un concours à Finadev afin de renforcer son commerce pour le bien-être de sa famille.
texts.en:
A trained seamstress and mother of 4 children, Ida lives in rented accommodation with her husband. She has a sideline business selling pagnes (highly decorative and colourful West African fabric), shoes and bags. 

In order to satisfy her customer demand, Ida has received funds from Finadev. This will allow her to strengthen her business and ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy 20 mixed pagnes.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is from Tangub city, Mialamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Gemma is married and has three school children. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a cosmetics sales business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP a month from these activities.


In 2009, Gemma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional cosmetics for her inventory

loans.name: Diougou Somprin Group

texts.fr:
Mme OROKIA est la représentante du groupe  DIOUGOU SOMPRIN. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans le moins âgé a 12ans. Tous 02 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 04 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend des oignons, des pagnes et des chaussures. Elle exerce ce métier depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Gounra frontière  de Tiébélé  (Pô) au BURKINA. Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes.

Mme veut  s’acheter  10 sacs d’oignons, 20 complets pagnes et 06 douzaines de chaussures.

Elle épargne un peu  ses bénéfices et contribue à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Mme ambitionne ouvrir un magasin pour son commerce.
texts.en:
Orokia is the Diougou Somprin group's representative. She is married and mother to 2 children aged 15 and 12, both of whom attend school. She is responsible for 4 people.

Orokia has been selling onions, pagnes (highly decorative and colourful West African fabric) and shoes for 10 years. She gets her supplies at Gounra market in the border village of Tiébélé (department of Pô) in Burkina Faso. She sells her merchandise to women and men. She would like to buy 10 bags of onions, 20 pagnes and 6 dozen pairs of shoes.

Orokia manages to save some of her profits, and spends some contributing to her children's educational expenses. One day, she would like to open a shop for her business.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of onions, 20 pagnes and six dozen pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Arame

texts.fr:
Madame Arame est jeune marchande qui habite à environ 17 km de la ville principale. Elle est divorcée et mère d’un enfant. Actuellement, elle vit chez  ses parents. Arame s’active depuis plus de 10 ans dans l’achat et la vente de produits cosmétiques .Sa  journée de travail  commence à 09 h du matin pour finir à19 h le soir.
Avec le crédit, elle va acheter des mèches, des greffages et divers autres accessoires qui interviennent dans la coiffure.
Arame aide ses parents dans la dépense quotidienne et paie aussi les frais de scolarité de son enfant.
Avec l’appui de la caisse elle voudrait augmenter son fond de roulement et ouvrir une boutique de produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
Mrs. Arame is a young merchant who lives about 17 km from the main city. She is divorced with one child, and currently lives with her parents. Arame has been buying and selling cosmetic products for over 10 years. Her workdays run from 9 AM until 7 PM. 

She will use the loan to buy hair extensions and other items used in hairstyling.

She helps her parents with the daily expenses and pays for her child’s tuition. With the support of the credit union, she would like to bolster her working capital and open a shop to sell beauty products.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Aleli Group

texts.es:
Verónica cuenta con 30 años de edad, es casada tiene 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando ángel esta cursando 1° de secundaria y Magali esta en 3° de secundaria, su esposo se llama Joaquín es campesino.

Ella se dedica al comercio tiene una tienda de abarrotes tiene 4 meses con si tienda dice que le esta funcionando muy bien, e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de los productos de abarrotes como son: leche, aceite, refrescos, galletas, huevos, etc. A doña verónica le gustaría que su tienda fuera un poco mas grande pero también esta muy contenta que lo esta sacando adelante y mas adelante tal vez lo incremente mas.

Verónica pertenece al grupo  alelí el cual esta integrado por  10 personas las cuales todas son mujeres a continuación serán mencionadas: Victorina, María, Guadalupe, Zoila, Reina, Julita, Yolanda, Esther y Rufina, todas realizan una actividad comercial como son: venta de productos de abarrotes, dulces, frutas y verduras, carne, pan, comida, etc.
texts.en:
Verónica is 30 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.  Ángel is in his first year of high school and Magali is in her third year.  Verónica's husband is called Joaquín and he is an agricultural worker.

Verónica owns a grocery store which she has had for four months.  She says that it is doing very well and she will invest her loan in buying groceries such as milk, oil, soft drinks, cookies, eggs, etc.  Verónica would like her store to be a little larger but she is also very happy to be doing well and perhaps in the future she will expand it some more.

Verónica belongs to the 'Aleli' group.  This group has 10 members who are all women.  They are: Victorina, María, Guadalupe, Zoila, Reina, Julita, Yolanda, Esther and Rufina.  They all have their own sales businesses including: selling groceries, sweet treats, fruit and vegetables, meat, bread, food, etc.

loans.use: to buy products such as milk, oil, soft drinks, cookies, eggs, etc.
