One of his great achievements has been to construct and continue improving their house with all the appropriate conveniences. They have their own vehicle. All this has been thanks to the profits that his business generates.

Now this young man needs support from Ceprodel for the first time, since his main objective in applying for this loan is to invest it and stock his business more. To do this he wants to buy rice, sugar, oil, soap, chicken, and soft drinks.

He puts his hope in this institution that they will help him with his request so that he can satisfy the demands of his customers, and he trusts in God that he will advance.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, soap, chicken, and soft drinks

loans.name: Juvencio Misael

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Leónidas Proaño se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive don Juvencio, tiene 49 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen dos hijos, uno es mayor de edad y el menor tiene 17 años el mismo que  estudian en universidad y es el que  aun vive con ellos. Su esposa es ama de casa.

Él para ganarse el sustento diario de su familia se dedica a conducir un  taxi de su propiedad, dia a dia sale a recorrer por toda la ciudad realizando los fletes que a la vez le dan para ganarse la vida, trabaja todos los días desde las 07h00 hasta las 20h00,  solo trabaja hasta esa hora para evitar los robos y riesgos que tiene su profesión. Lleva más de 24 años en esta profesión gracias a Dios siempre le ha ido bien.

Solicita el crédito para comprar ciertas refacciones y repuestos para su taxi y así dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la forma como se trabaja en la institución.
 
Su sueño es tener otro taxi para así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Leónidas Proaño Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the neighborhood of the same name in the city of Manta, known for its pretty beaches that are visited frequently in every season of the year and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Juvencio lives here.  He is 49 years old and married, and from this relationship has two children.  One is independent and the younger one is 17 and studies in the university, and he is the one who still lives with them.  His wife is a housewife.

To support his family he works driving his own taxi.  Every day he goes out to drive around the entire city providing freight service that at the same time allows him to earn a living.  He works every day from 7:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.  He works only until that time to avoid the robberies and risks of his profession.  He has worked in this profession for more than 24 years; he thanks God it always has gone well for him.

He is requesting the loan to buy certain spare parts for his taxi, and so give his customers better service.  This is his second cycle in the communal bank and he likes it because of how they work in the institution.

His dream is to have another taxi to have better income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Atila Magdalena

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 7 De Septiembre se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Atila, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y la ultima de 17 años, todos sus hijos  aun viven con ella y  estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo es taxista.

Ella tiene un local en su casa en la cual vende ropa, zapatos, carteras, bisutería, entre otros productos, trabaja todos los días y su hija es quien le ayuda en su negocio cuando ella está desocupada, para traer su mercadería ella viaja cada cuatro meses hasta Panamá y aprovecha para traer lo que más pueda, también viaja hasta Guayaquil cada fin de mes o cuando necesita más mercadería,  lleva 17 años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para ir a Guayaquil a comprar ropa, zapatos y carteras. Lleva más de 12 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "7th of September" meets every two weeks in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches, which are well visited in every season of the year, and for being a city with unequaled beauty and many tourist attractions.

In this place we meet Señora Atila. She is 46 years old, is married, and has three children; two are adults and the youngest is 17. All her children still live with her and study at the university and in secondary school. Her husband is a taxi driver.

She has a shop in her house in which she sells clothing, shoes, handbags, costume jewelry, and other items. She works every day, and her daughter is the one who helps her when she is not busy. To get her merchandise, she travels to Panama every four months and takes advantage of this to bring as much as she can. She also travels to Guayaquil at the end of every month or when she needs more merchandise. She has been in this business for 17 years, and it is going very well for her.

She will use this loan to go to Guayaquil to buy clothing, shoes, and handbags. She has been in her communal bank for 12 years, and she likes it because the interest rates are lower than at other lending institutions.

Her goals are to continue advancing and to have good health.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and handbags

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
This is Amalia, 50, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is a mother to three children and married to Paciano, also her business partner. She and her husband manage their own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Amalia operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Aside from this she sells dried fish for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Amalia hopes her business grows and she dreams to be able to give her children a good future through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God they study.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Teresa Guadalupe

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Leónidas Proaño se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

Aquí conocimos a la señora  Teresa, tiene 38 años  de edad, es madre soltera de  dos hijos de 15 y 9 años de edad, los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Lleva dos años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le están dando para seguir adelante.

Ella trabaja en sociedad con un hermano en un almacén de artículos para niños, allí venden pañales, cunas, juguetes y muchos otros productos infantiles, trabajan todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 19h00 y son 6 años que tienen con su local, al principio como todo negocio tuvo sus días malos pero con el paso del tiempo esto cambio y ahora son reconocidos en toda la ciudad y tienen muchos clientes.
   
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pañales, juguetes, biberones, coches y otros artículos que venden en su local.
 
Su sueño es tener un local propio y sola ya que el que tienen es en sociedad y es arrendado.
texts.en:
The "Leónidas Proaño" communal bank gathers every 15 days in the neighborhood of the same name, in the town of Manta. The town is known for its beautiful beaches which attract a lot of visitors all year round, and also for being a town of unmatched beauty with many tourist attractions.
Here we find 38-year-old Teresa. She's a single mother of two children aged 15 and 9 who attend school and high school. She has been in the communal bank for two years and she likes it because they help her get ahead.
She works in partnership with her brother in a baby apparel store. There they sell diapers, cradles, toys and many other baby products. They work every day from 8a.m. to 7p.m. and they've had their store for six years. In the beginning they had their bad days, as any business does, but in time this changed and now they are well-known all over town and they attract a lot of customers.
This loan will be used to purchase diapers, toys, bottles, strollers and other items they sell in their store.
Her dream is to own her own store by herself, because the one they have now is a partnership and it's a lease.

loans.use: to purchase diapers, toys, bottles, strollers, etc.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
This is Geraldine, 36, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is a mother of 3 and married to Samuel, a car technician. She, with the help of her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Geraldine operates a rug making business. Her products are small rugs and larger doormats. She makes round rugs out of excess textile cloth she buys from the factory. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. She sells her products directly to her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more raw materials. Geraldine expects a boost in her income as she expands her business, which she hopes to do in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God they study.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her rug making business.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila, de 42 años es una mujer alegre. Enviudó hace 8 años, desde entonces cuidó de sus 7 hijos de los cuales solo vive con 3 de ellos: Rocío, Junior y Jack en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Daniel Hernández. 
Trabaja sin descanso y aprovecha cada oportunidad que se le presente. Su principal actividad agrícola es la siembra de maíz y papa en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, como tiene pocas parcelas, siembra en baja escala. Pero eso no la desanimó, sabe que tiene salir adelante por sus hijos. Por eso en campañas agrícolas trabaja como peón en otros sembríos, donde le pagan un monto de dinero diario. Pero como es una mujer ingeniosa, compra animales como ovejas y cerdos, los que engorda y vende en la feria que se realiza en su ciudad los días domingos, como también sus cosechas, de esta manera obtiene un mayor ingreso. “No puedo estar sin hacer nada, tengo que trabajar en cualquier cosa”, menciona. Por eso también teje chompas de lana con sus propias manos, le va muy bien y varias personas le hacen pedidos, además trabaja en las obras que realiza la gobernación de su distrito, donde le pagan un sueldo mensual, de está manera puede brindar todo lo necesario a sus hijos. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  tener un apoyo financiero, ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Domitila de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más animales para bastecer el capital de su negocio.
texts.en:
Domitila, who is 42 years old, is a happy woman. She was widowed 8 years ago. Since that time she has taken care of her seven children, of whom only three live with her: Rocio, Junior, and Jack. They live in their own house, located in the town of Daniel Hernández.

She works tirelessly and takes advantage of every opportunity that is presented to her. Her principal agricultural activity is planting corn and potatoes on her own agricultural land. As she has few parcels, she plants on a small scale. But this does not discourage her. She knows that she has to advance for her children. For this reason, during the agricultural season she works as a laborer on other plantings, where they pay her a daily amount of money. But, as she is an ingenious woman, she buys animals such as sheep and pigs, which she fattens and sells in the market that takes place in her city on Sundays. She also sells her harvests, and in this way she obtains a larger income. "I can't be without doing anything, I have to work on something," she mentions. For this reason she also knits wool sweaters with her own hands. This is going very well, and a number of people have placed orders with her. In addition, she works on government projects in her district, where they pay her a monthly salary. In this way she can offer everything necessary to her children. 

This is her first loan with MFP. She is very happy to have financial support, since she has always shown that she is responsible with her payments. In addition, she is pleased to be part of her association (communal bank), since all the members are responsible and united people.

On receiving her support, Domitila will invest the money she has applied for in the purchase of more animals to provide capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy more animals

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.ru: Фирдавс более шести лет занимается торговлей. Ему 25 лет. Он у себя дома занимается торговлей продуктов питания оптом. Кредит берет для приобретения машины, чтобы привозить товар на своей автомашине.
texts.en: Firdavs has been working  in sales for over six years. He is 25 years old. He sells groceries wholesale out of his home. He is taking out a loan in order to buy a car so that he could transport goods.

loans.use: to buy a car [for delivering goods]

loans.name: Por

texts.en:
Mrs Por is 47 years old and from Dongkor commune, a suburban area of Phnom Penh city. She is a responsible housewife who manages all household things and looks after her children. She has been blessed with five children. Two of whom are already married and live independently. 

The family income completely depends on her husband, who works as a construction foreman. 
The purpose of this loan is to buy construction supplies, which will be used to fix her house partially. With the remainder, she will pay for the household preparation to improve her house’s condition.This fund will help better her living situation. For the future plan, she wishes to open a construction supplies store in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies.

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en:
Ouch is 50 and lives in Pouk District. She has a business making bamboo baskets, which is a very popular business among local villagers. Ouch has been involved in this business since 2005 and earns approximately USD 3.00 per day. She has been blessed with five children. 

Ouch has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) to fix and decorate some parts of her kitchen, as of now, it's not comfortable for the family. She hopes to provide the whole family a good living condition and pursue a healthy life. She would like to say thanks to our lenders.

loans.use: to fix and decorate some parts of her kitchen.

loans.name: Khon

texts.en:
Khon, age forty-four, is a responsible mother of a lovely kid, residing in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Khon helps her husband to earn income by working in different places as a cleaner. She is able to earn a low income from this business.

With the loan she requested from HKL and Kiva, she will buy a cow to keep for farming and purchase a pig to raise. In the future, Khon wants to expand her pig-raising business and generate a good income from it.

loans.use: to buy a cow to keep for farming and purchase a pig to raise.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica has operated her clothing sales business in Nakuru town for the last 10 years. She is 28 years old and a single mother of two children. She also makes dresses and men's clothes for sale, enabling her to increase her income.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the field officers. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to open up a boutique and buy more stock of clothes as well as sell shoes, handbags, and beauty accessories.

In the future, Monica hopes to expand her business and open up more boutiques thereby becoming one of the leading business ladies in the region as well as improving her family's living standards.

loans.use: To open up a boutique and buy more stock of clothes as well as sell shoes, handbags, and beauty accessories.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
This is Estrella, 33, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Randy, a painter, and is the mother to their four children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Estrella operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell it with a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Estrella hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of merchandise needed in her business

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a fish monger at Krofofodo. She buys fresh fish and smokes them for sale. Ama has been in this business for 10 years now. She is married to a mason and has one child. Ama uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase large quanties of fresh fish to smoke and sell. With the new profit Ama wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase large quantities of fresh fish to smoke and sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is a petty trader. She sells cassava and plantains. Patricia has been into this business for 10 years now. She is married to a farmer and has 5 children. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees.  Patricia needs this loan to purchase more cassava and plantains for sale. With the new profit, Patricia will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase more cassava and plantains for sale

loans.name: Faustina Adjoa

texts.en: Faustina Adjoa is married to a teacher and has four children.  Faustina produces fanti kenkey for sale. In the picture you see that around her and in her hands are the leaves which she uses to cover the maize dough in the kenkey production.  Faustina has been in this business for seven years now. Faustina will use her loan to purchase maize in large quantities to enable her to produce more kenkey for sale.  With the new profit from the expanded business, Faustina will use it to produce kenkey in large quantities for distribution.

loans.use: purchase maize in large quantities to enable her to produce more kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Marisa Jesus

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Marisa; ella tiene 42 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia es docente del nivel inicial en un jardín en el distrito de Yucay ella lleva años trabajando en este lugar, le gusta mucho su carrera ya que tiene que estar con niños aunque a veces le hacen perder la paciencia pero al final los trata siempre con mucho cariño esta es la única actividad que realiza por el momento y desea poder seguir adelante ya que este es el único medio que tiene ella para sacar a su familia adelante y mediante su trabajo y los ahorros con su esposo pudo construir su casita pero aun le falta terminar. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para terminar de construir el segundo piso de su casa ya que mediante su sueldo de profesora no le permite construir. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to Señor Pasión Communal Bank, located in the district of Urubamba, in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.

The member is Marisa.  She is 42 years old and married with three children.  She is a teacher in the beginning level in a kindergarten in the district of Yucay.  She has been working in this place for years.  She likes it a lot because she has to be with children, although sometimes she loses patience but in the end she treats them all with a lot of affection.  This is the only work she does for the moment, and she wants to be able to carry on because this is the only means she has to get her family ahead.  Through her work and her savings with her husband she managed to build her little house, but she still has more to finish.

She is requesting the loan to finish building the second floor of her house, because her salary as a teacher does not allow her to build.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to finish building the second floor of her house.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba  produce kenkey* for sale. She is the lady siting with maize dough infront of her. Around her are the leaves she uses to cover the maize dough. She is single and has 3 children. Araba has been in this business for 10 years now.  As a single parent she uses her income to feed and clothe her children and to pay their school fees.  Araba will use her loan to purchase maize in large quantities to enable her to produce more kenkey for sale. With the new profit  Araba wishes to expand her business 

*Fermented maize meal traditionally prepared by boiling balls of mixed portions of fermented cooked maize meal and raw maize dough wrapped in plantain/banana leaves

loans.use: to purchase maize in large quantities to enable her to produce more kenkey for sale

loans.name: Daya Pertiwi Group

texts.en:
Dewa Ayu lives in the village of Tegal Cangkring with two of her children who are still in school. Dewa Ayu is helping her husband who is a farmer with the income she earns by running a pig business in her home.

In order to expand her business, Dewa Ayu is raising capital by joining the group Daya Pertiwi where she was chosen by the other members as the head of the group. They work together with MUK to get business loans for pig farmers.

With the loan of 2M IDR per person, Dewa Ayu plans to buy four piglets at a price of Rp 500.000 each. Although the price of feed is currently very expensive, Dewa Ayu expects the sale of four pigs at a later time will earn a profit, increase the income of her husband to support her family and help pay her children's school fees. Dewa Ayu is sitting in front, second from the right wearing a chocolate shirt. Two of the members couldn't attend the meeting and are represented by their husbands.

loans.use: To buy four piglets

loans.name: Elman

texts.en: Elman is engaged in agriculture. He keeps cattle and sells meat and milk products at the bazaar and at the village where he lives. Elman is 52 years old and lives with his wife & son who help him to keep the farm. His plan includes the increase of farms and livestock. Now he wants to obtain the loan of 500 AZN to buy two calves to raise.

loans.use: To buy two calves to raise

loans.name: Rebecca Esi

texts.en: Rebecca Esi is a baker. She also sells a local soft drink popularly known as Awusa beer. She serves it with bread at Krofofodo near Abura. She has been in this business for some years now.  She is married and has 3 children.  Her husband is a driver. Rebecca uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees. She will use the loan to purchase bags of flour for her bakery and ingredients needed to produce the drink for sale. She plans to expand her business with the new profit

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour for her bakery and ingredients needed to produce the drink for sale

loans.name: Kutuma

texts.en: Kutuma sells second hand clothes at Krofofodo, which she has done for four years. She is married to a businessman and has three children. She uses her income to support her husband in paying the utility bills. Kutuma needs this loan to purchase more second hand clothing to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Kutuma will acquire a shop for the sale of her secondhand clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a petty trader. She sells plantain. Ama has been in this business for seven years now. She is married to a driver and has three children. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees. Ama needs this loan to purchase more cassava and plantain for sale. With the new profit, Ama will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava and plantain to sell

loans.name: Zouheir

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 63 years old, married and has four children.

Zouheir has been an owner of a shop selling spare parts for cars since 1992. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop and to add more to his inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop and to add more to his inventory.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 46 years old. He is married to Jennifer and together they have three children. He owns a matatu and has been in the business for the past two years.

He was brought to KADET LTD, by a field officer. This is his second loan. He paid the previous loan well. He will use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school  fees

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 38 years old. He is married to Teresiah and together they have three children. He operates a barber shop and has been in the business for the past 20 years.

He was brought to KADET LTD by a field officer. This is his first loan. He will use the amount to purchase chairs for his business.

In the future, he hopes to own the best barber shop in the area.

loans.use: to buy chairs for his business

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 63 years old, married and has four children.

Hamza is an owner of a workshop since 1990, making and selling cement, tiles and bricks. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to purchase a tile-cleaning machine. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a tile-cleaning machine.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has been in the clothing sales business in Nakuru town for the last six years. She is 39 years old and a widow with four children. Besides clothing sales as her primary activity, she also sells handbags.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of her friends and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy more stock of clothes to sell in her business.

In the future, Jane hopes to grow her business and open a boutique as well as import clothes for sale, thereby becoming one the leading business people in the area.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a student applying for a loan to purchase a laptop to assist in her studies at Strathmore University and this is her story:

My name is Jane. I am a second year Bachelor of Business Information Technology (BBIT) student at Strathmore University. I am the first born in a family of four children consisting my single mother, three siblings and me. We all live in my grandparents’ place. They own a small piece of land which sustains our large family. My mother has limited funds and is also supporting my younger sibling in high school. 

The main challenge I have faced is lack of funds to continue with my education. I am applying for this loan to buy a laptop after facing a challenging time during my first two years of studies without a personal machine. I am a victim of submitting my projects after the deadline, since I have been depending on my friends' laptops even though they also have projects to work on. 

Strathmore has a great and appealing reputation countrywide. It was my dream university. I plan to use my laptop to do my projects and carry out research and class work. I will use it to do my assignments and I will also watch beneficial documentaries using it. It is also a good thing to assist others as I have been assisted. 

I would like to work with a renowned firm that works in the interest of people along different dimensions after I graduate. I would also like to venture into leadership and serve the community. Founding an organization to help the needy in my society is also my future dream. Let’s help uplift the lives of humanity by uplifting individuals!

loans.use: to purchase a laptop to assist her in carrying out her research, accessing coursework and doing her project work.

loans.name: Hountin Joel

texts.fr: Hountin Joel est âgé de 48 ans et vit au Bénin. Hountin Joel n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Hountin Joel est un veuf et père de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Hountin Joel vit seul avec ses enfants et assure seul leurs diverses charges. Hountin Joel fait de la médecine traditionnelle ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir sans grande difficulté aux besoins de ses enfants. Hountin Joel exerce son activité depuis une dizaine d’année dans sa région. Hountin Joel achète ses produits au Bénin et au Nigéria. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Hountin Joel sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt reçu par Hountin Joel a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Hountin Joel is 48 years old and lives in Benin.  He never attended school.  He is a widower and the father of five children, all in school and all his dependents. He lives alone with his children and provides for them alone.  

Hountin Joel practices traditional medicine, which allows him to take care of his children's needs without any major difficulty.  He has been practicing his activity, locally, for about ten years.  He buys his products in Benin and Nigeria.  

In order to better meet the needs of an increasing number of customers, he is requesting a second loan from ALIDé.  The loan he previously received was duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy medicinal roots.

loans.name: Baktykan

texts.ru:
Бактыкан 53 года, замужем, имеет пятерых детей,  младшие - школьники. На протяжении 20 лет Бактыкан занимается  сельским хозяйством – разведением и откормом скота, ежегодно обрабатывает земельный участок с хлопком,  занимается этим бизнесом вместе с семьей. На сегодняшний день, в хозяйстве Бактыкан  имеется 2 коровы и трактор, на котором в сезон старший сын оказывает сельскохозяйственные услуги. 
В целях увеличения поголовья скота, Бактыкан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы и семян хлопка. Доходы от кредита семья планирует вложить частично - в умножение поголовья, и частично - сделать сбережения для оплаты обучения для своих детей.
texts.en: Baktykan is 53 years old, married and has five children, the youngest are schoolchildren. During twenty years Baktykan has been doing farming – breeding and fattening cattle, annually cultivating the land with cotton and doing this business together with her family. Today Baktykan has two cows and a tractor which her son uses during the season to provide agricultural services.  With the purpose of increasing the headcount of cattle Baktykan has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 110,000 son (KGS) to buy a milk cow and cotton seeds. The family plans to invest the profit from the loan partially into additional cattle and partially save to pay for the tuition of their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and seeds.

loans.name: Namoyon

texts.ru: Намоён проживает в городе Куляб. Ей 46 лет. Она вдова. У нее двое детей. Намоён занимается торговлей на рынке. Она продает детскую одежду. Этим видом бизнеса занимается 9 лет. Кредит берет для покупки весенней детской одежды.
texts.en: Nayomon lives in the town of Kulob. She is 46 years old. She is a widow and has two children. Namoyon sells on the market. She sells children's clothing. She has been in this business for nine years. She is taking out the loan to buy children's clothing for the spring.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise.

loans.name: Burul

texts.ru: Бурул  35 лет, замужем, воспитывает четверых детей. В 2000 году, в поисках источника финансирования своей семьи, Бурул начала свой бизнес в  в полеводстве и разведении скота .Использовав стартовую сумму в 10,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, Бурул сумела развить свое хозяйство, с ежемесячной прибылью в сумме около 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, в ее хозяйстве имеется три головы дойных коров, 10 овец и одна лошадь, а также – 1,04 га орошаемой земли с клевером, служащим кормовой базой для ее скота.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бурул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец на откорм. В ближайшее время, при помощи доходов от кредита, Бурул планирует увеличивать поголовье  скота.
texts.en: Burul is 35 years old, she is married and is raising four children. In 2000 while looking for a source of financial support for her family Burul started her business in field work and animal husbandry. She used a starting capital amount of 10,000 som (KGS) to buy cattle. Burul was able to develop her business with a monthly income of around 10,000 som. At this time her business has three milk cows, ten sheep and one horse as well as 1,04 hectares of arable land with clover which is used as a fodder for her livestock. With the goal to further develop her business Burul has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep for fattening. In the nearest future Burul plans to increase the headcount of cattle with the help of the income from the loan.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Robert Akambi

texts.fr: Robert Akambi est âgée de 37 ans et vit au Bénin. Robert Akambi n’a pas fréquenté l’école, mais a appris le métier de mécanicien. Robert Akambi est marié à un certain Blandine. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. En dehors de leurs enfants, le couple a trois autres enfants à leur charge. Robert Akambi vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Il y a près de dix huit ans que Robert Akambi exerce le métier de mécanicien dans sa région. Parallèlement, Robert Akambi vend des pièces détachées dans son atelier. Robert Akambi s’approvisionne au Nigeria. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Robert Akambi sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux crédits reçus antérieurement par Robert Akambi ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Robert Akambi is 37 years old and lives in Benin.  He has never attended school, but learned the job of a mechanic.  He is married to a woman named Blandine.  The couple has four children, some of whom are in school.  Besides their own children, the couple has three other children in their care.  Robert Akambi lives with his wife and children and takes care of the various household expenses with his wife.

Robert Akambi has been working as a mechanic, in his region, for about eighteen years.  He also sells spare parts in his workshop, and buys his merchandise in Nigeria.

In order to meet the needs of an increasing number of customers, Robert Akambi is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.  The two previous loans he received were duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es:
Saturnino, se dedica a la producción de leche junto a toda su familia y la reparten a diferentes empresas de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de dos vacas para producir leche en mayor cantidad y obtener más ingresos ya que es la única fuente de trabajo que tiene para ayudar a su familia.
Saturnino, es casado y tiene tres hijos con los cuales vive en la zona Los Andes, localidad Caluyo del departamento de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Saturnino and his entire family engage in milk production. They distribute their product to different companies in the city of La Paz. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy two dairy cows so that he can produce milk in greater quantity and generate more income. This is the only source of work by which he is able to help his family. Saturnino is married and has three children. They live in the District of Los Andes in the town of Caluyo, Department of La Paz.

This is the second time he has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Besi Mabel

texts.es:
Besi  Mabel, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 11 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando, vive en la aldea Campana de Puerto Cortes.
Besi es una persona muy trabajadora, en busca de obtener otros ingresos ella se ha dedicado a vender ropa interior, short etc. para niños, damas, caballeros, sandalias y ropa de cama. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace seis años, que su esposo le ayudo para que iniciara y por su buena administración ha podido incrementar sus ventas. Ella realiza ventas de manera ambulante o a domicilio y por medio de pedidos hechos.
Esta solicitando un cuarto préstamo a ODEF, para invertirlo en su negocio, con el cual va comprar ropa y sandalias para vender y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
Su meta es establecer este negocio en un local para darse a conocer y que sus hijos lo puedan administrar  y lograr también un crecimiento personal.
texts.en:
Besi Mabel is 35 years old, married, and has two children (ages 15 and 11) who are studying. She lives in the neighborhood of Campana in Puerto Cortes.

Besi is a hardworking individual who looks for ways to earn income. She decided to sell undergarments, shorts (for children, women, and men), sandals, and bedding. Besi has been in business for six years and her husband helped her to get started. As a result of good management, she has been able to increase her sales. Besi sells as a traveling merchant and out of her home by accepting orders.

She is requesting her fourth loan from ODEF so that she can invest in her business. Besi will buy clothing and sandals to sell so that she can fulfill her customers' orders. Her goal is to establish her business in a location where she is familiar so that her children can manage it. She also wants to achieve personal growth.

loans.use: to buy clothing and sandals.

loans.name: Roxana Patricia

texts.es:
Roxana es madre soltera de un hijo, tiene 29 años y cuenta con casa propia en la que vive junto a su menor hijo, su casa esta ubicada en un caserío rural de nombre “Pedregal Bajo “el cual pertenece al distrito de Tambogrande y el mismo que es dependiente de la provincia de Piura. Pues por ser un caserío pequeño en vía de desarrollo por ahora solo cuenta con un servicio básico que la energía eléctrica

Desde muy pequeña Roxana se ha dedicado a la crianza de ganado, para lo que recorre los caseríos aledaños al suyo con el fin de ofrecerlos al mejor precio, adicionalmente a ello se ayuda económicamente dedicándose a la agricultura para lo que cuenta con 3 has de terreno agrícola en la que tiene plantaciones de limón y de mango, los cuales les da el mantenimiento debido y cosecha una vez por semana.

Roxana a pesar de su juventud tiene muy claros sus objetivos trazados, ahora quiere mejorar la calidad de sus cosechas de frutas y a la vez dar una mejor alimentación a su ganado para obtener mayores utilidades para lo que desea comprar fertilizantes y alimentos balanceados con los que podrá cumplir sus objetivos y así de esa manera mejorarle las condiciones de vida de su hijo, específicamente buscarle mejores oportunidades académicas. Por lo que solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles con lo que podrá adquirir sus requerimientos.

Roxana es muy considerada y respetada por ser un apersona muy trabajadora y dedicada a su familia.
texts.en:
Roxana a single mother with one son. She is 29 years old and has her own house where she lives with her young son. Her house is located in a rural hamlet called Pedregal Bajo, which belongs to Tambogrande district in the province of Piura. Because it is a small hamlet still on the road to development, it only has basic services (electricity) for now.

Since she was very small, Roxana has been raising sheep. She travels through the surrounding hamlets in order to sell them at the best price. She also helps her economic situation by working in agriculture. She has three hectares of farmland where she grows lemons and mangoes. She gives them proper maintenance and harvests the fruit once per week.

Despite her young age, Roxana has clearly defined goals. Currently, she would like to increase her profitability by improving both the quality of her fruit harvests and the diet of her sheep. She wants to purchase fertilizers and balanced animal feed in order to meet her goals and thereby improve her son's quality of life. In particular, she wants to find better educational opportunities for him. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2,000 nuevos soles, with which she can obtain what she needs.

Roxana is highly regarded and respected as a hard working woman who is dedicated to her family.

loans.use: to buy a balanced diet for her sheep and fertilizer for her fields

loans.name: Marli

texts.es:
Marli, de 59 años, es una mujer amable y buena, siempre trabajó mucho para poder criar y educar a sus cuatro hijos quienes brindó una buena educación y hábitos positivos, lamentablemente quedo viuda hace mucho tiempo y sola tuvo que sacar adelante a su familia, ahora que todos sus hijos son mayores, ella continua con su trabajo ya que desea tener una vejez tranquila y sin problemas económicos. Marli, tiene como trabajo el de la venta de ropa, siempre vende prendas de buena calidad y diseño innovador, sus clientes son muy exigente y le hacen pedidos de ropa exclusiva y diseños siempre a la vanguardia de la moda, ella en sus 3 años con éste negocio aprendió a que tiene que darle siempre la razón al cliente y no duda en hacerles sus gustos ya que mientras mas compren ella tiene mejores ganancias. Su trabajo lo desarrolla muchas veces en su casa o cuando alguien desea que vaya a su casa a visitarlos, ella no duda en ir.
Le esté yendo muy bien en su trabajo, además le gusta mucho ya que se divierte al mismo tiempo que gana dinero, ahora aumento su variedad y vende también ropa de segunda yendo a las comunidades cerca de la ciudad, demuestra en su día a día que es una mujer que no le teme al trabajo y desea progresar de a pocos ya que tiene como planes poner algún momento un local en donde atender a sus clientes mas cómodos. Este será el séptimo préstamo con MFP, esté muy contenta por que le brindaran un respaldo financiero y así podrá aumentar su capital de trabajo, sabe que tendrá que ser muy responsable y sobre todo muy puntual, esté contenta de pertenecer su banco comunal ya que ve que son muy solidarios. Con el mono solicitado 1200 soles, comprará mas mercadería para poder ofrecer mas modelos y diseños innovadores a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marli, 59, is a good, kind woman. She has always worked hard to raise and educate her four children, whom she gave a good education and positive attitute. Unfortunately Marli was widowed long ago and had to raise her family alone. Now that her children are grown up, she continues with her work because she wants to have a peaceful retirement without financial problems. Marli sells clothing, which is always good quality and innovative designs, since her customers are very demanding and place orders for clothing and exclusive designs at the cutting edge of fashion. In her 3 years running this business, she has learned to always give the customer what they want, and does not hesitate to provide for any taste - that way she sells more and has better profits. She often works from home, or when a customer wants her to go to their home, she does not hesitate to go.

She is doing very well in her work, and she likes it because she is having fun while making money. She has now increased her range and sells secondhand clothing as well, in different communities around the city. Every day Marli demonstrates that she is a woman who is not afraid of hard work and wants to progress. She has plans that in time she will have a place where she can serve her customers in comfort. This will be her seventh loan with MFP, and she is very happy at being offered this financial support to increase her working capital. She knows she must be very responsible, and above all very punctual. She is happy to belong to the communal bank, and sees them as very supportive. With the 1200 Soles requested, she will buy more merchandise to offer a greater range of innovative designs to customers.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia, es una señora que esta enferma y perdió la pierna por la diabetes, ella tiene ingresos con el apoyo de su esposo ya que trabajan elaborando ropa deportiva.
El crédito lo necesita para continuar su fisioterapia, y de esta forma aliviar su dolor para seguir apoyando a su familia.
Silvia, es casada y tiene dos hijos viven en casa propia en la zona Obispo Bosque de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y  la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Silvia is a woman who suffers from health problems and lost the use of her leg as a result of diabetes. She has income that comes from the support of her husband, who earns a living making sportswear. Silvia needs a loan so that she can continue physical therapy, which will help alleviate her pain and enable her to continue supporting her family. She is married, has two children, and lives in her own home in the District of Obispo Bosque in the city of La Paz.

This is the second time that Silvia has worked with both IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of physical therapy.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto, de 33 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de Vilma, su esposa desde hace 33 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Yeny y Brian a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Daniel Hernández. Sus manos reflejan el esfuerzo y trabajo de un hombre comprometido por el desarrollo de su familia. La actividad que realiza es la siembra de toda variedad de verdura, alverjas y menestras. Los cuales realiza en sus propios terrenos agrícolas ubicados en la zona alta de un anexo cercano a su casa. En temporadas de escasez, siembra en sociedad con otras personas, con las que comparten los gastos de fertilización y mantenimiento. Ya tiene 8 años de experiencia vendiendo sus cosechas en la capital del país y otras ciudades reconocidas. Pero la actividad que le apasiona es la construcción de casa, se desempaña como albañil y es muy bueno en su trabajo, obtiene buenos ingresos semanales, “todo depende de los contratos que adquiera”, menciona con la alegría que lo caracteriza. Ahora desea ser reconocido en su trabajo como albañil. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  tener un apoyo financiero, ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Edilberto de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de un terreno de 200 metros, donde piensa construir él mismo su propia casa.
texts.en:
Edilberto, age 33, is a responsible man. He lives with Vilma, his wife, and their 2 children, Brian and Yeny, in their own house in the Daniel Hernandez neighbourhood. In the picture, Edilberto's hands reflect the effort and work of a man committed to the development of his family. His activity is growing all kinds of vegetables, peas and beans. He does this on his own plot of agricultural land, located on the high ground near his home. In times of scarcity, he works in partnership with others, sharing the costs of fertilization and maintenance. He has 8 years experience, selling his crops in the capital and other major cities. But the activity he is passionate about is building houses. He works as a bricklayer and is very good at his job, which brings in a good weekly income. "It all depends on acquiring contracts," Edilberto says, with the happiness that characterizes him. Now he wants to be well known for his work as a bricklayer. This is his first loan with MFP, and he is very pleased to have this financial support. He has always proven to be responsible with any payments, and he is pleased to be part of the association because all the members are responsible and show solidarity.
On receiving your support, Edilberto will invest the money requested in the purchase of a 200 meters plot of land, where he plans to build his own home.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: Maria Del Rosario es una emprendedora que ha buscado como salir adelante con su  negocio va creciendo cada día. Esta emprendedora toda su vida sea propuesto objetivos y metas para salir adelante y las cumplidos ya que tiene su propia herramienta de trabajo, ya tiene clientes fijos y eventuales que la visitan para comprar su producto. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de mercadería como blusas, camisas para niños, faldas, shorts, pantalones, cosméticos que son productos que más demandan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Del Rosario is an entrepreneur who looks to move forward in her business and grow each day. This enterprising woman has spent her entire life setting goals for herself and fulfilling them. She has supplies for her work and established customers who visit her in order to buy her product.

Maria is currently requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as blouses, children's shirts, skirts, shorts, trousers, cosmetics, and other products that are in great demand among her customers.

loans.use: to buy blouses, children's shirts, skirts, shorts, trousers, cosmetics, and other products.

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es: Mayela , de 57 años es una mujer luchadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo, con quien cuida de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de El Tambo. Tiene 9 años de experiencia en la venta de productos de primera necesidad en un puesto en el mercado cerca a su casa, atiende todas las mañanas hasta el atardecer a su más exigente  clientela que conocen de la calidad de sus productos, su atención al publico es muy cálido y amable; procurando siempre dar un peso exacto y justo a sus productos por lo que ha logrado que sus clientes siempre acudan a consumir de los productos que comercializa. Su hija mayor y en algunas ocasiones su esposo, la ayudan pero generalmente ella es la única responsable del negocio, afirma que le agrada atender su negocio  ya que le agrada conversar con otras personas. Además que esta actividad  le ha resultado  beneficiosa en las rentas que le genera. Por ello desea continuar por muchos años más en este negocio, con miras a crecer y tener una tienda mayorista de productos de primera necesidad en su misma casa. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Mujeres Victorianas” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  tener un apoyo financiero, ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Mayela de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero en la compra de arroz, azúcar, menestras y fideos que le servirá para  aumentar la mercadería disponible en su negocio.
texts.en: Mayela, 57 is a determined woman. She lives with her husband, with whom she takes care of their 3 children in her own house, located in the El Tambo neighbourhood. She has 9 years experience in selling staples at a market stall near their home. Every day from morning until evening, she serves her demanding customers, who know the quality of her products. Her attitude to customers is very warm and friendly, always trying to give an accurate weight in her products so that customers always come back. Her eldest daughter and her husband help out sometimes, but generally she has sole charge of the business. She says she likes running her business and likes to talk to people. As well as this, her work has proven beneficial in the income it generates. So she wants to continue for many years in this business, in order to grow and eventually have a wholesale store selling staples from her home. She belongs to the "Victorious Women" communal bank, and this is her seventh loan with MFP. She is very happy to have this financial support, and has always proven to be responsible on her payments. She also likes being part of the community bank, as all the members are responsible and show solidarity. With your support, Mayela will invest the money to buy rice, sugar, beans and noodles, to increase the goods available in her business.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and noodles

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
Las reparaciones efectuadas en su casa han servido de mucho. Ahora Eloy, trabaja desde su casa realizando armado de computadoras y arreglo en general de las mismas en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de una habitación en la casa de sus familiares para dar más comodidad a su familia.
Eloy, es casado y tiene una hija con las cuales vive en la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la cuarta vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la tercera vez que trabaja junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
The repairs that were made to Eloy's house have been a great benefit. He now works from home assembling computers, as well as performing general computer repair services around the city of La Paz. The loan he is requesting will be used to remodel a room in the family home so that they will be more comfortable. Eloy is married and has a daughter. They live in the District of Llojeta in the city of La Paz.

This is the fourth time he has worked with IMPRO and the third time with Kiva.

loans.use: to remodel a room in his home.

loans.name: Zuurakan

texts.ru:
Зууракан 39 лет, замужем, имеет четверых детей. Муж работает таксистом. В поисках источника финансирования, в 2009 году Зууракан начала свой бизнес в животноводстве, стартовав с покупки одной дойной коровы. Благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Зууракан имеется три дойной коровы и двенадцать овец, приносящее около 4,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов.
В целях увеличения поголовья скота, Зууракан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и овец. Доходы от кредита семья планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение поголовья.
texts.en:
Zuurakan is thirty-nine years old, married and has four children. Her husband works as a taxi driver. In search of some additional income, in 2009 Zuurakan began raising and breeding cattle. She initially owned one cow; now, thanks to hard work and diligence, her business consists of three milking cows and twelve goats. On average, she makes 4,000 soms a month via the sale of milk and meat products.
Focused on increasing her herd's head count, Zuurakan approached "Bai Tushum & Partners," requesting a loan of 70,000 soms aimed at purchasing calves and goats. She plans to reinvest the income generated from the loan back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Manzurakhan

texts.ru: Манзурахан 43 года, воспитывает двух дочерей-школьниц.  С 2000 года Манзурахан занимается животноводством и полеводством.  Начатое с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство, где на данный момент есть две дойные коровы,  приносит около 6,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов. Также Манзурахан занимается полеводством, возделывая 0,86 га земли с хлопком и арбузами. В целях дальнейшего увеличения бизнеса, Манзурахан обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от кредита Манзурахан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Manzurakhan is forty-three years old and the mother of two girls. From the year 2000, Manzurakhan began a farming and cattle raising business. Her entrepreneurial initiative, which began with 5,000 soms, now consists of two milking cows, which bring, on average, 6,000 soms a month from the sale of milk products. Manzurakhan's farm holds 0.86 hectares of land which are seeded with watermelons and cotton. 
In order to expand her business, Manzurakhan approached "Bai Tushum & Partners," requesting a loan of 50,000 soms. She plans to reinvest money generated from the loan back into the business, allowing her to increase her livestock head count.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and fertilizers

loans.name: Marcia Del Socorro

texts.es: Marcia Del Socorro su actividad a la que se dedica  es una pulpería que la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación donde atiende a sus clientes con variedad de productos. Esta emprendedora se le ha apoyado en el financiamiento para invertir en el negocio de la compra de productos para la pulpería, nos expresa la emprendedora que gracias al apoyo se ha podido aumentar mercadería para ofrecerle a sus clientes. Actualmente la emprendedora esta solicitando financiamiento para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes y granos básicos, carne y otros productos.
texts.en: Marcia Del Socorro runs a general store out of her home where she receives customers offering them a variety of products.  This entrepreneur has received financial support for her business enabling her to buy products for her store.  She is very grateful for this help because she has increased the range of merchandise she can offer her customers.  The current loan she is requesting is to buy sweets, soft drinks, bread, detergents, basic grains and other products.

loans.use: To buy sweets, soft drinks, bread, detergents, basic grains, meat and other products.

loans.name: Silvia Patricia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 7 De Septiembre se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar conocimos a Silvia, tiene 27 años  de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal, es la fiscal de reglamentos del grupo y le gusta porque gracias  a los créditos ha podido aumentar su negocio.

Ella es una joven muy trabajadora  que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto  ayudar a sus padres y hermanos  se dedica a la venta de ropa todo tipo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale a recorrer tres o cuatro días a la semana unas  tres horas diarias, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. La ropa la compra en Guayaquil ya que allá consigue más barato y hay más variedad. Tiene 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo en especial ropa de temporada. 

Sus sueños son aumentar su negocio y tener un local.
texts.en:
The communal bank "7 de Septiembre" meets every two weeks in the city of Manta which is known for its beautiful beaches, visited throughout the year, and for being a city with unequalled beauty and many tourist attractions.

Here is where we met Silvia, 27, who is single and lives with her parents.  She has been a member of the communal bank for three loan cycles and acts as the group treasurer.  She is happy because the loans have allowed her to expand her business.

She is a very hard-working young woman who, in order to make her own income and help her parents and siblings, sells clothing and all kinds of Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories).  She sells door to door, three or four days a week, three hours a day, and delivers goods on a credit basis then collects payment every eight days.  Her clothing purchases are made in Guayaquil where they are less expensive and more variety can be found.  She has been doing business successfully for three years.  

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and all kinds of seasonal clothing.

Her dream is to increase business and open a shop.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Edjromede Group

texts.fr: EDJROMEDE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Odette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 56 ans. Odette est une veuve et mère de quatre enfants. Aucun des enfants n’est encore à la charge de Odette. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Odette vend depuis près de sept ans, des liqueurs, des céréales et des condiments dans son quartier. Odette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité pour être plus compétitive sur le marché, Odette désire augmenter le stock de ses produits ; ce qui lui permettra d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu. Pour cette raison, Odette sollicite un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe EDJROMEDE.
texts.en: EDJROMEDE is a group of three people, whose members live in the same area. The representative of the group, Odette (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 56 years old. Odette is a widow and mother of four children. None of the children are still in Odette's care. To meet her needs, Odette has been selling liqueurs, grains, and seasonings in her area. Odette stocks up in a market in Benin. With the goal of growing her business so that it is more competitive in the market, Odette wants to increase her product stock; this will allow her to increase her turnover and revenue. For this reason, Odette is asking for a sixth loan from Alidé, together with the other members of the EDJROMEDE group.

loans.use: to buy liqueurs, grains, and seasonings.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca, de 40 años es una mujer trabajadora. Es natural de Huancavelica pero, radica desde hace 12 años en la ciudad  de Huancayo con su esposo, Edilberto y su pequeño hijo en casa de sus suegros, ubicado en la localidad de El Tambo. Es docente de profesión  y desempeña su trabajo como profesora de personas adultas, enseñándoles a leer y escribir y también de manera paralela tiene otras actividades, principalmente la crianza de cuyes, venta de gelatinas de diversos sabores y tamaños. Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la generación de sus negocios, en su granja de cuyes cuida  con mucho empeño para después vender  todos los fines de semana, selecciona a los cuyes que ha de vender y después los beneficia y entrega a  los comerciantes de carne de su localidad. Ha visto que todos estos negocios la ayudan y benefician en la economía de su hogar y le permite disponer de su propio tiempo es por esta razón que desea seguir trabajando con esa mismo empeño para  crecer económicamente. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Mujeres Victorianas” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  tener un apoyo financiero, ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Rebeca de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de cuyes productores, para  aumentar la cantidad de animales.
texts.en:
Rebeca, 40, is a hard-working woman who is originally from Huancavelica but has lived in the city of Huancayo for 12 years.  She and her husband, Edilberto, and their small son live with her parents-in-law in the town of El Tambo.  She is a teacher by profession and works teaching adults how to read and write.  Also, she is involved in other activities, mainly raising guinea pigs and selling different flavored gelatin.  For six years she has been in business and on her farm provides good care for the guinea pigs which she sells every weekend.  She selects the ones she will sell and delivers them to the meat merchants in her town.

All of her jobs benefit the home economy and allow her to manage her own time.  This is why she wants to continue working to grow economically.  She belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Victorianas" and this is her sixth loan through MFP.  She is very happy with the financial support and has always be responsible in her payments.  She enjoys being a part of the communal bank because all the members are responsible and supportive.  If she receives your help, Rebeca plans to use the loan to buy productive guinea pigs to increase the quantity of animals she has.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Alohadogbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ALOHADOGBE est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Estelle, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Estelle est âgée de 40 ans et est  mariée à un revendeur du nom de Gilbert. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Estelle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Estelle n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a quinze ans que Estelle mène comme activité, la vente d’igname frit, de beignets de haricot et de macaroni dans une ville du Bénin. Estelle s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Estelle sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ALOHADOGBE, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The ALOHADOGBE group is made up of three people who live in the same area. The group's representative, named Estelle, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. Estelle is 40 years old and is married to a retailer named Gilbert. The couple has three children, all in school and in their care. Estelle lives together with her husband and her children and sees to the family's various expenses together with her husband. Estelle did not attend school. Over fifteen years Estelle has run her business selling fried yams, bean fritters, and macaroni in a city in Benin. Estelle stocks up in a market in Benin. With the goal of satisfying her customers and increasing her turnover and revenue, Estelle is asking, together with the other members of the ALOHADOGBE group, for a fifth loan from Alidé. The loans received in the past were have been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy yams, beans, pasta, and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Angela Mariana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 7 De Septiembre se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una niña de un año de edad. El marido se dedica a la albañilería.

Ella  para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos  Esika (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta,  trabaja todos los días más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, le encanta vender y tiene bastante clientela a pesar de que recién tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Este es su segundo ciclo  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le  han sacado de muchas situaciones difíciles en su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
The communal bank "7 de Septiembre" meets every two weeks in the city of Manta which is known for its beautiful beaches, visited throughout the year, and for being a city with unequalled beauty and many tourist attractions.

Here lives Mrs. Ángela, 23, who has a common-law husband and a one-year-old daughter.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

To help her husband cover household expenses she sells Esika products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories).  She sells door-to-door and works every day, mainly in the morning hours since that is when it is easier to make her rounds.  She delivers the goods on credit and collects payment weekly.  She loves to sell and has a fair number of customers despite the fact that she only has been in business for a year.  Her best selling products are cosmetics and perfumes.

She plans to use the loan to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics and creams.  This is her second loan cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because it has helped her business out of many difficult situations.

Her dream is to have her own house, since the one he lives in is rental property.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics and creams.

loans.name: Mededjigbe Group

texts.fr: MEDEDJIGBE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Anasthasie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 45 ans. Anasthasie est mariée à un certain Evariste. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Anasthasie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Anasthasie a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Anasthasie vend depuis une dizaine d’année, des produits vivriers (riz, conserves) et des liqueurs dans son quartier. Anasthasie s’approvisionne au Togo et au Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Anasthasie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MEDEDJIGBE, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé en vue d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire. Les deux crédits passés dont Anasthasie avait bénéficié ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
MEDEDJIGBE Group is made up of three persons, who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, Anasthasie, is the one raising her hand in the photograph.

Anasthasie, age 45, is married to one Evariste, and they have three children, who all attend school and whom they have to support. Anasthasie lives together with her husband and children.

The couple ensures together that the various household expenses are covered. Anasthasie dropped out of elementary school.

In order to cover her various expenses, she's been selling food products (rice, canned food) and liquors in her neighborhood for about ten years. She gets her supplies in Togo and Benin.

In order to bolster her business, Anasthasie, together with the other members of the group, is seeking a third loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to increase her revenue. Her previous two loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and canned food

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, de 45 años es una mujer valiente. Vive en una casa que ha heredado de sus padres en compañía de sus 3 hijas, a las que cuida en la ciudad de El Tambo. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a realizar bordados artesanales, se inicio por invitación de una de sus amigas que la enseño, ahora ella realiza trabajos de bordados en la comodidad de su casa para poder atender su hogar y sus hijos, también cultiva la alfalfa para poder venderla al por mayor una vez que los arbustos estén maduros. Es por ello que no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo, pero es muy constante en la realización de sus bordados  ya que  por la complejidad del trabajo y el grosor del bordado en la tela, dura hasta un mes de realizado como resultado se da una bella prenda  típica  que causa admiración en sus clientes y finalmente son los que compran al contado. La época más rentable  en su negocio es cuando  están en plena época de festividades típicas llamadas la fiesta del Santiago que se celebra mucho por su zona. Desea crecer en su producción de faldas bordadas y contratar a personas apara ayudarla  en esta  producción. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Mujeres Victorianas” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  tener un apoyo financiero, ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Victoria de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero en la compra de hilos y telas para sus bordados y si el dinero le alcanza fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos entre sus cultivos de alfalfa.
texts.en:
Victoria, 45, is a courageous woman.  She lives in the house she inherited from her parents in the city of El Tambo, where she takes care of her three daughters.  For five years she has been active in the art of embroidery which she started after a friend taught her.  Now she embroiders at home where she can comfortably take care of the house and attend to her children.  She also grows alfalfa which she sells wholesale.  She has no fixed work schedule but is constantly embroidering because the complexity of the work and thickness of the design on the fabric means it takes up to a month to make a typical garment admired by her customers which they buy and pay for in cash.  The most profitable season for business is during the local holiday season called the festival of Saint James which is widely celebrated in the region.  

She wants to increase her production of embroidered skirts and hire people to help with production.  She belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Victorianas" and this is her sixth loan through MFP.  She is very happy with the financial support and always has been responsible in her payments.  She enjoys being part of the communal bank because all the members are responsible, supportive people.  

If Victoria receives your support she will use the loan to buy thread and fabric for her embroidery products.  If there is enough money left over she will buy natural fertilizer for her alfalfa crop.

loans.use: To buy thread and fabric, as well as natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Lome Group

texts.fr: MARIA LOME est un groupe composé de trois personnes, et dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Aïhonsi Catherine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 43 ans. Aïhonsi Catherine est  mariée  à un carreleur du nom de Albert. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Aïhonsi Catherine a un autre enfant à charge, en dehors de ses enfants. Aïhonsi Catherine vit ensemble avec  son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Aïhonsi Catherine a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Aïhonsi Catherine vend depuis quinze ans, des céréales et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques de façon secondaire à son domicile. Aïhonsi Catherine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité pour être plus compétitive sur le marché, Aïhonsi Catherine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MARIA LOME, un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: MARIE LOME is a group made up of three people whose members live in the same area. The group's representative, Aïhonsi Catherine (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 43 years old. Aïhonsi Catherine is married to a tiler named Albert. The couple has four children, all in school and in their care. Aïhonsi Catherine has another child in her care besides her children. Aïhonsi Catherine lives together with her husband and children. Together, the couple sees to the various household expenses. Aïhonsi Catherine stopped school at the secondary level. To cope with her various expenses, Aïhonsi Catherine has sold grains and phone recharge cards secondarily at her house for fifteen years. Aïhonsi Catherine stocks up in a market in Benin. With the goal of growing her business in order to be more competitive on the market, Aïhonsi Catherine is asking, together with the other members of the MARIA LOME group, for a sixth loan from Alidé. The past credits were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn and rice, and phone recharge cards.

loans.name: Reyna Amparo
