texts.es: La emprendedora Amparo el negocio al que se dedica es a la venta de productos de prenda de oro y plata, ella ya tiene sus clientes fijos y eventuales a quienes les ofrece sus productos esta actividad la realiza de forma ambulante buscando a sus clientes. Ampara ya ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, con crédito en el cual la emprendedora nos expresa que el financiamiento le ha ayudado para invertir más en el negocio. Actualmente la emprendedora está solicitando financiamiento para comprar productos como cadenas, anillos, aretes, pulseras, entre otros productos.
texts.en: Entrepreneurial Amparo runs a business selling gold and silver costume jewellery. She sells her products to both her regular and casual client base when she goes out on foot in search of customers. Amparo is already involved with Fundación León 2000, having previously borrowed money which she says has helped her to make further investments in her business. Today, she is applying for a loan to buy products such as necklaces, rings, earrings, bracelets among other products.

loans.use: to buy necklaces, rings, earrings and bracelets among other products.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam, de 32 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Ever, su esposo desde hace 15 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Saúl y Vanesa a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Paltarumi. Junto a su esposo trabajan sin descanso, pues ellos son personas luchadoras. Durante las mañanas se dedica al cuidado de su tienda de comestibles, donde vende productos de primera necesidad a los pobladores de su localidad. Mientras su esposo se dedica al cuidado de sus terrenos agrícolas, donde siembra maíz, papa, cebada y trigo. Según cuenta en está temporada tuvieron que alquilar más parcelas para abastecer su producción, espera obtener buenos ingresos en la cosecha. Ya los comerciantes de papa de la ciudad de Huancayo, le están ofreciendo buen precio. Asimismo tiene animales como: vacas, ovejas y cerdos, que cuida con mucha dedicación, pues el objetivo es engordarlos y comercializarlos a un mayor precio entre los carniceros que llegan a su misma casa a llevárselos.  Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  tener un apoyo financiero, ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Miriam de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Hard-working Miriam is 32 years old. She lives with her husband of 15 years, Ever, and they have 2 children, Saul and Vanesa, who they care for in their own home located in Paltarumi. Both her and her husband work tirelessly as they are strong-spirited people. In the mornings, Miriam serves in her grocery store where she sells basic essentials to the members of her community. Meanwhile her husband tends his cultivable lands, planting corn, potatoes, barley and wheat. Miriam tells us that this season they have had to rent more land to satisfy their level of production; she hopes that they will receive a good income from this harvest. At the moment, the potato merchants in Huancayo city are offering a good price. The family also shows dedication in raising their animals, such as cows, sheep and pigs as the aim is to fatten them up and sell them for a good price to the butchers who come to her home to buy them.
This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she is very happy to have the financial support. She has always proved herself to be a responsible person with regards to meeting her repayments, and she is also grateful to be part of her association because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. On receipt of this financial support, Miriam intends to invest it in more basic essentials to sell in her store.

loans.use: To buy basic essentials.

loans.name: Mahukpego Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUKPEGO est formé de cinq personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Rébeca, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Rébeca est âgée de 49 ans. Rébeca est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de Pierre et est mère de six enfants. Aucun des enfants n’est scolarisé. Parmi les enfants, seulement deux sont à la charge de Rébeca et de son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins du ménage. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Rébeca vend des poissons et des crevettes à son domicile et de façon ambulante depuis une vingtaine d'année. Rébeca s’approvisionne dans son quartier. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Rébeca désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Rébeca sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUKPEGO, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les quatre crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Mahukpego group is made up of 5 people who all live in the same district. The group's representative, Rébeca, has her hand raised in the picture. The is the 5th time that the group is requesting ALIDé's financial help, so that they can raise the level of their business activity.

Rébeca is 49 years old. She is married to a fisherman called Pierre and is the mother of 6 children. None of the children attend school. Of the 6 children, Rébeca and her husband are only responsible for two. The couple both contribute to the household's different needs. Rébeca has been selling fish and prawns from her home and on the street for around 20 years, in order to be able to cover her various expenses. She gets her supplies locally.

Rébeca would like to increase her inventory, so that she can strengthen her business further and is better able to respond to customer demand. To be able to do that, she is requesting a 5th loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the Mahukpego group. The 4 previous loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy fish and prawns.

loans.name: Mayra Katherine

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 7 De Septiembre se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar conocimos a Mayra, tiene 20 años de edad y es soltera, este año está por ingresar a  la Universidad y seguir sus estudios universitarios. Vive en casa de sus padres.
 
Ella es una joven muy trabajadora  que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder seguir adelante en sus estudios se dedica a la venta de ropa todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale a recorrer de tres a cuatro días de la semana unas  tres horas diarias, la mayor parte de sus ventas son bajo pedido que le hacen sus clientes, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. La ropa la compra en Guayaquil ya que allá consigue más barato y hay más variedad. Tiene 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar bermudas, trajes de baño, camisetas entre otras prendas en especial ropa de temporada. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son muy importantes para seguir adelante.

Su sueño es seguir sus estudios y tener una profesión que le sirva para su futuro.
texts.en:
The 7th of September Communal Bank meets every fortnight in the city of Manta, which is well-known for its beautiful beaches that are busy throughout the year and for being a city of unrivalled beauty with many tourist attractions.
 
Here we met 20 year old Mayra, who is single. This year she intends to enrol and follow a course at University. She lives at home with her parents.

She is a young woman who works hard to provide for herself and she uses these resources to progress with her studies. She goes door-to-door selling all kinds of clothing three or four days each week for about three hours each day. The majority of her sales are to satisfy orders placed by her customers. She offers her products on credit and returns for payment eight days later. She buys her stock in Guayaquil as she can buy products for cheaper and there is more variety to choose from. She has been engaging in this activity for three years and it is going well for her.

This loan will be used to buy bermuda shorts, swimsuits and t-shirts among other seasonal garments. She has been through 2 loan cycles with the Communal Bank and she likes it because the loans are very important for her to make progress.

Her dream is to continue her studies and find a profession which will serve her well for the future.

loans.use: To buy bermuda shorts, swim suits and t-shirts etc.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 32 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Apolonio, su esposo desde hace 10 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Yacuraquina. Comenzó siendo una agricultora muy buena, siempre soñó con ser una comerciante y tener su propio negocio, Pues el trabajo en el campo le resultaba cansado y por veces obtenía muchas perdidas, ya que las inclemencias del tiempo hacían que pierda la siembra. Es así que ahorro todo lo necesario para abrir su negocio de compra y venta de ropa de diferente tamaño, color y costo, los que comercializa en su propio anexo. Durante la semana viaja a una ciudad cercana, donde compra la ropa de moda, lo traslada a su pueblo, que por la lejanía no pueden trasladarse con facilidad y ahí no existe una tienda que comercialice ropa. Por ello le va muy bien en su negocio, mientras su esposo se dedica al trasporte público con un motocarro que adquirió hace poco. Durante todo el día traslada a los pobladores de Pampas a diferentes lugares de la zona. Ahora ella desea incrementar su capital y traer nuevas prendas de vestir. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  tener un apoyo financiero, ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Julia de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de chompas, pantalones y demás productos de vestir para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
32-year-old Julia is a hard-working woman who lives together with Apolonio, her husband of 10 years.  The couple have three children who they care for in their own home in the town of Yacuraquina.

Julia started working as a very good farmer but she always dreamed of being a saleswoman and having her own business.  The farm work was tiring and sometimes she suffered many losses as the bad weather would make her lose crops.  For this reason, she saved up the money she needed to open a business buying and selling clothing in different sizes, colors and price-ranges.  She sells these products in her own village.  During the week, she travels to a nearby city where she buys fashionable clothing and takes it back to her village.  Owing to the distance, this is not an easy journey to make and there are no clothing stores in her village.  This means that her business does very well.  Julia's husband works providing a public transport service in a motorcycle taxi that he acquired a short time ago.  During the day he transports local people from Pampas to different places in the area.

Now Julia would like to increase her capital and buy new clothing for her business. This will her first loan from MFP and she is very happy to have financial support.  She has always shown herself to be responsible in making her payments.  She enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible and supportive people.  With your support, Julia will invest the money she has requested in buying sweaters, pants (trousers) and other clothes with which to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy sweaters and pants

loans.name: Jenny Janina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 7 De Septiembre se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jenny, tiene 36 años  de edad, es madre soltera de  un hijo de 19 años que estudia en universidad. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos.

Ella para ganarse la vida y así ayudar  su hijo en sus estudios se dedica al comercio, ella tiene un local en su casa en la cual vende ropa americana, zapatos, carteras, entre otros productos que le envían de los Estados Unidos, trabaja todos los días en su negocio. También prepara comida y bocadillos para un centro de eventos de la ciudad, actividad que realiza dos veces a la semana y con lo cual se gana una buena cantidad por la venta de estos platos, lleva  más de 9 años con su negocio y  es así como ha podido sacar adelante sola a su hijo para que este sea una persona de bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, carteras y víveres para preparar sus deliciosos platos. 

Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante en la ciudad.
texts.en:
The 7 De Septiembre communal bank meets every 2 weeks in the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited frequently all year long, and for being a city with unequaled beautiful with many tourist attractions.   

Here we meet Jenny. She is 36 years old and a single mother of a 19 year old son who goes to college. She has been in the communal bank for 3 cycles and she likes it because the loans are quick and don't have so many requirements.

To make a living and help her son in his studies, she is a merchant. She has a locale in her house where she sells American clothes, shoes, and purses, among other products that are sent to her from the United States. She works at her business every day. She also prepares food and appetizers for an events center in the city. She does that activity twice a week and she earns good money selling these dishes. She has had her business for more than 9 years and with it she has been able to get her son ahead by herself so that he can be a good person.

This loan is to buy clothes, shoes, purses and food item to prepare her delicious dishes.  

Her dream is to have a great restaurant in the city.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, purses and food items.

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es: Juana Paula la actividad a la que se dedica es a la venta de comida, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación donde sus clientes la visitan para consumir su comida. Ella ya ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, en el cual se le apoyo en el financiamiento en la compra de productos para realización de los platillo, nos expresa la emprendedora que con financiamiento ha salido adelante ya que da abasto para ofrecerle variedad  a su clientes. Actualmente la emprendedora está solicitando financiamiento para la comprar frutas, verduras, aceite, carnes, gaseosas, jugos, entre  productos.
texts.en: Juana Paula's business is selling food.  Her business is located in her home and this is where her customers come to eat.  She is an existing client of Fundación León 2000 who have previously supported her with a loan to buy products she needs for making her dishes.  The borrower tells us that, with loans, she has managed to make progress as they enable her to offer her customers variety.  She is currently requesting a loan to buy fruit, vegetables, oil, meat, soda, juice and other products.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, oil, meat, soda, juice, etc.

loans.name: Lilia Egdi

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 7 De Septiembre se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lilia, tiene 49 años  de edad, es madre soltera de  cuatro hijos, los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, con ella viven dos de sus hijos el menor y la mayor ya que ella es una niña especial y requiere de muchos cuidados.

Ella es una mujer muy luchadora y abnegada madre que ha tenido que luchar muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos y mucho más desde que quedo sola con ellos, se dedica a vender muchos productos, en las mañanas se desplaza hasta la playa y compra pescado el mismo que después de limpiarlo lo vende en su casa a los clientes que dia a dia llegan a comprar sus productos, allí mismo también vende ropa de todo tipo y productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos días y lleva 10 año que se dedica a esta actividad y es gracias  a esto que ha podido salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado, ropa y cosméticos Yanbal. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho.

Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the 7 de Septiembre community bank meet in the city of Manta.  This city is known for its beautiful beaches which are very popular year round.  It is also known as a city with many tourist attractions whose beauty is second to none.

Here we meet 49-year-old Lilia who is a single mother and has four children who are already adults.  She lives with two of her children, her youngest and her eldest.  Her eldest [daughter] is a special-needs child who needs a lot of care.

Lilia is a very tenacious and selfless mother who has had to work very hard to provide for her children, even more so since she was left on her own with them.  Her business is selling lots of products.  In the mornings she goes to the beach and buys fish which she takes home, cleans and then sells from her home to customers who come to her each day to buy her products.  She also sells all kinds of clothing and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and ladies' accessories).  She works every day and has been in this business for 10 years.  Thanks to her business, she has been able to get ahead in life.

This loan will be used to buy fish, clothing and Yanbal cosmetics.  Lilia has been a member of her community bank since it was formed and she likes it because the loans help her a lot.

Lilia's dream is to make progress in her business.

loans.use: to buy fish, clothing and Yanbal cosmetics

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.es: Teodocia, de 42 años es una mujer luchadora. Vive en compañía de Félix, su esposo desde hace 22 años. Ambos tiene 7 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos, que son menores de edad y a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Atocc. Gracias a su esfuerzo y constancia, pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos, los que ya mayores siguieron su camino. Ahora sigue trabajando para el futuro de los menores, por ello trabaja con ahínco y esmero. Su actividad económica es la agricultura, siembra alverja, maíz y papa en sus propios terrenos, según cuenta, tiene un promedio de 2 parcelas, que en cada cosecha vende al menudeo en el mercado de la ciudad de Pampas, donde trabaja una vez a la semana. Pues en el resto de los días, viaja a la selva, donde tiene plantaciones de plátanos; que cuida su hijo, quien vive ahí. Pero como es una mujer con iniciativa, también cría gallina y ovejas, los cuales enseba para después venderlos a un mayor precio, asimismo comenzó con la venta de golosinas en la plaza de su localidad, ya que así obtiene un ingreso adicional para el hogar. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  tener un apoyo financiero, ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Teodocia de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de animales como ovejas y gallinas de buena calidad para engordarlos.
texts.en: Teodocia is 42 years old and a fighter. She lives with Félix, her husband of 22 years. They both have 7 children, but they only live with 3 of them who are minors. They take care of them in their own home, located in the Atocc. annex. Thanks to her hard work and effort, she was able to get her children ahead, and the oldest already went their own ways. Now she continues to work for the future of the younger children, and that's why she works eagerly and with great care. Her economic activity is farming. She plants peas, corn, and potatoes on her own land. She says that she has 2 parcels of land and at every harvest, she sells retail at the market in the city of Pampas, where she works once a week. The other days, she travels to the jungle, where she has plantain crops that her son takes care of, since he lives there. But since she a woman with initiative, she also raises chickens and sheep to fatten up and sell a a higher price. She also started to sell candies in the town plaza where she lives, since that brings additional income to her home. This is her third loan with MFP. She is very happy to have the financial support, since she has always shown herself to be responsible with her payments. She also likes being a part of the association because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. If Teodocia receives your support, she will invest the money she has asked for in buying animals such as good quality sheep and chicken to fatten up.

loans.use: to buy sheep and chickens.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 7 De Septiembre se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Julia, tiene 73 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tuvo siete hijos, los mismos que ya son  mayores de edad seis aun vive en su casa con sus familias.
 
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos naturales. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta aunque la mayoría de sus productos los vende bajo pedido, Trabaja tres días a la semana en las entregas y cobros ya que deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 12  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende es el Vita toro, hepalive, los purgantes, el PH, entre otros ya que según dice son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar productos naturales. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le ha brindado la institución.

Su sueño es tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The members of the 7 de Septiembre community bank meet every two weeks in the city of Manta.  This city is known for its beautiful beaches which are very popular year round.  It is also a city with lots of tourist attractions and a beauty which is second to none.

Here we meet Julia who is 73 years old.  Several years ago her husband passed away.  She had seven children from her marriage and they are all now adults.  Six of them still live at home with their families.

Julia's business is selling natural products.  She makes her sales door to door though she sells most of her products to order.  She works three days a week delivering goods and collecting payment because she leaves her products on credit and collects payment once a week.  She has been in this business for more than 12 years and it is doing very well.  What she sells most of are Vita Toro, Hepalive, laxatives, PH, etc.  She says that they are very good.

This loan will be used to buy natural products.  This is Julia's second loan cycle as a member of her community bank and she likes it because of the help that she has been given by the institution.

Julia's dream is to enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy natural products

loans.name: Aliou

texts.fr: Aliou vit seul à 2 kilomètres, au nord de la ville, dans une exploitation agricole qui lui a été légué par son père.Depuis le décès de ce dernier, il a hérité de ses terres.Il y a creusé un puits et installé une pompe pour avoir assez d'eau et pratiquer ainsi le maraîchage.Il est célibataire, sans enfants.Il a toutefois la charge de ses petits frères et sœurs et de sa maman.Les revenus tirés de la vente des légumes produits,lui permettent de prendre en charge les dépenses d'alimentation,  de santé ainsi que d'autres besoins divers.Aujourd'hui, il sollicite un pret de 100000f pour s'approvisionner en essence qui est utilisé pour faire fonctionner son activité de maraichage  et en produits alimentaire pour les besoins de nourriture de la famille. Son voeu futur consiste a agrandir considérablement la surface qu'il cultive.
texts.en:
Aliou lives alone, around 2 kilometers north of town, on a farm left to him by his father. Since the latter died, Aliou inherited some of his land. He dug a well and installed a pump to make sure he had enough water, and now he manages a market garden. 

Aliou is single and has no children. He is, however, responsible for the care of his little brothers and sisters, and of his mother. The income he earns from selling his produce allows him to pay for food and medical expenses, as well as other various needs.

Today, Aliou is requesting a loan of 100 000 francs so that he can get supplies of petrol and foodstuffs. His ambition is to considerably increase the size of the plot of land he cultivates.

loans.use: to buy petrol and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Idilio

texts.es: Idilio, de 38 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su hermana y sus sobrinos en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la localidad de El Tambo. Es un hombre soltero y dedicado a su familia. En todo este tiempo de trabajo logró adquirir un auto con el cual realiza transporte público, cubriendo las rutas de Hualahoyo hacia el centro de la ciudad. Su trabajo lo realiza de lunes a sábados, mientras los domingos descanza después de una semana llena de arduo trabajo. Cuenta que en época escolar obtiene mayor ganancia, pues sus clientes son en su mayoría escolares, ahora que se encuentran de vacaciones, no tiene muchas ganancias, por eso espera con ansias el inicio de las labores educativas. “Me gusta cuidar de mis sobrinos, son como mis hijos”, afirma. Por ello desea para su futuro tener un trabajo estable, con todos los beneficios sociales y poder más adelante gozar de una pensión. Con esa seguridad quiere comenzar a construir su casa propia y a pensar en formar una familia. Ya dará el primer paso para ello, pues tiene que sacar una licencia de conducir nueva para poder trabajar en una reconocida mina de la localidad. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  tener un apoyo financiero, ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Idilio de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago de los trámites para la revalidación de su licencia de conducir a otra categoría más y así pueda cumplir con su objetivo.
texts.en:
38-year-old Idilio is a hard-working man who lives with his sister, nieces and nephews in a rented house in the town of El Tambo.  He is a single man who is devoted to his family.  Over the years he managed to acquire a car which he uses to provide a public transport service, covering the routes between Hualahoyo and the city center.  He carries out his work from Monday to Saturday.  On Sundays he rests after a week of hard work.  He says that he makes more profits during the school term because his customers are mainly school children.  Now that they are on vacation, he doesn't make so much profit.  He is keenly waiting for the school year to start again.  "I like to care for my nieces and nephews as if they were my own children", he says.  For this reason, he would like to have a stable job in the future with social benefits and also a pension later down the line.  With this security, he would like to start building his own home and form a family.  He will take the first step by acquiring a new driver's license which he needs to work for a well-known mine in his town.

This is Idilio's first loan from MFP.  He is very happy to have financial support and he has always shown himself to be responsible in meeting his payments.  He enjoys being a member of his community bank because all the members are responsible and supportive people.  With your support, Idilio will invest the money he has requested in paying to re-new his driver's license and add an additional category.  This will enable him to achieve his goal.

loans.use: to update his driver's license

loans.name: Liseth Geanina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 7 De Septiembre se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Lisseth tiene 19 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 4 años y un bebé de 3 meses de nacido. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella junto al esposo se dedican a la  venta de pescado, de tres a cuatro veces por semana se desplazan hasta las playas de la ciudad donde llegan las embarcaciones pesqueras para comprar el pescado y llevarlo a entregar a las diferentes fabricas de la ciudad a quienes les venden al por mayor. Ella por su parte también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, ventas que realiza por las tardes cuando está desocupada y en los días que no acompaña a sus esposo en la venta del pescado, ellos llevan ya más de 5 años y es una actividad que la aprendió de su papá ya que él también se dedica al comercio.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado y ropa. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le ha brindado la institución. 

Sus sueños son tener un camión y un local para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the 7 de Septiembre community bank meet in the city of Manta.  This city is well known for its beautiful beaches which are popular year round.  It is also a city with many tourist attractions and a beauty which is second to none.

Here we meet Liseth who is 19 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and the couple have two children.  One is 4 years old and the other is a baby of 3 months.  Her husband is a salesman.

Liseth and her husband sell fish.  Three to four times a week they travel to the city's beaches, where the fishing boats come in, to buy fish.  They take the fish and deliver it to different factories in the city.  They sell it to them wholesale.  Liseth also sells all kinds of clothing.  She makes her sales in the afternoons when she has time free and on days when she doesn't accompany her husband to sell fish.  They have been in this business for more than five years and it is a business that Liseth learned from her dad who is also in this line of work.

This loan will be used to buy fish and clothing.  This is Liseth's third loan cycle with her community bank and she likes it because of the help that she has been given by the institution.

Liseth's dreams are to own a truck and premises she can sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy fish and clothing

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah  is 50-years-old and lives in Buchanan, Liberia. She is married and has six children aged 30 to 6 years-old. Five of them are attending school and live at home, while the oldest one is working  and living on their own. 

For the past fifteen years Sarah has been selling oil and rice in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil and rice for her business. She plans to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase  more  oil and rice for her business.

loans.name: Mashkal

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 46-years-old, married and has two children.

Mashkal is a farmer; she has been an owner of a calves’ farm since 1999. She sells many types of dairy products. She has a sufficient experience in this field, a good reputation and she is well known in her area.

She decided to apply for $2400 loan in order to buy a Friesian cow. She hopes to earn more profits which gives her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy a Friesian cow.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen has been in the carpentry business in Nakuru town for the last two years.  He is 44-years-old, married to Pamela and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of timber for use in his business.

In the future Stephen hopes to expand his business and supply furniture to other parts of Naivasha.

loans.use: to  buy timber for carpentry work.

loans.name: Edwinar

texts.en:
Edwinar is 39-years-old and is married with two children. She has had her retail clothing shop for a period of about three years with an income of 5,000 kenya shillings a month.

This is her fourth loan from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying the previous ones. She wants to use the loan to buy school uniforms for sale. She hopes to be a school uniform distributer and give her children a quality education.

loans.use: to buy uniforms for sale.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John, a 47-year-old father of five children, is married to Winny and operates a beauty salon. In business for the past 18 years, he earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. John was introduced to KADET LTD. by a KADET customer and is now requesting his first loan to purchase beauty products, hair relaxers and hair weaves.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of beauty products, hair relaxers and hair weaves.

loans.name: Kushanda Hakutyisi Grp Group

texts.en:
This is Constance, a 44-year-old married lady from Masvingo with four children, one of whom is still attending school. She has been raising poultry for more than three years, and faces the business challenge of not receiving timely payment from some debtors.

Now requesting a loan of $300.00 to buy more day-old chicks and stock feeds, Constance will use the resulting extra income to improve her family's standard of living. Within the next five years, she would like to open a bigger outlet in the central business district.

loans.use: to buys chicks and stock feeds.

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, single and lives with four family members one of whom works.

Salah is the owner of stationery shop, selling books, toys for kids and stationery and doing copying and typing. He has sufficient experience in this field, a good reputation and he is becoming well-known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his stationery shop and to purchase a photocopier machine. He is aiming to earn more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his stationery shop and to purchase a photocopier machine.

loans.name: Roi

texts.en:
Roi lives in Yambio. She sells fish and has been in business for one year. She is 45 years old, married, and has three children; one of them is still in school. 

Roi heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando, de 36 años es un hombre soltero y trabajador. Vive en compañía de su papá en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Acraquia.  En la localidad de Uchcupuchar un anexo, cuida de sus vacas las cuales le brinda leche con lo que elabora diversos productos lácteos y sus derivados. Le va muy bien en su negocio tanto así que desea incrementar los ganados que tiene y obtener unos de rasa. Es muy conocido en su localidad, ya que su familia se dedica a ese mismo rubro, por ello los compradores llegan a su casa a comercializar la leche fresca que produce su ganado, esto le permite obtener un poco más de ganancia. Además confiesa que le gusta vivir en el campo y aunque no tiene una familia gusta mucho de cuidar a su padre, a quien ama. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde tiene muchas esperanzas, pues espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Rolando de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de comida balanceada para sus animales.
texts.en:
36-year-old Rolando is a hard-working, single man.  He lives together with his dad in his own home in the town of Acraquia.  In a small village of Uchcupuchar, he cares for his cows who provide him with milk which he uses to make dairy products.  His business is doing very well, so much so that he would like to increase his number of cattle and buy some thoroughbreds.  He is very well known in his town because his family are in the same line of work.  Buyers come to his house to buy the fresh milk that his cattle produce.  This allows him to make a little more profit.  Rolando says that he enjoys living in the countryside and, although he does not have a family, he really enjoys caring for his father who he loves. 

This will be Rolando's third loan from MFP and he is very hopeful that he will receive your cooperation which will help him to continue achieving his goals.  For his part, he pledges once again to make his repayments on time.  He enjoys being a member of his community bank because all the members are responsible and supportive people.  With your support, Rolando will invest the money he has requested in buying nutritionally-balanced feed for his animals.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for his animals

loans.name: Khalig

texts.en: Khaliq is engaged in agriculture. He is 38 years old, married and has three children aged to 4 to 11. He sales milk products, meat and  wool at the local bazaar. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. He also works as a home repair specialist. He wants to obtain the loan to do some repairs at his house. He needs the 600 AZN to buy the construction materials to build a bathroom. He doesn't want to sell the cattle for this, as he plans to increase his business.

loans.use: To buy the construction materials to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 41 years old, a single mother with three children aged 13, 11 and nine years old. She sells cabbages wholesale, a business she started 11 years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000.

 
She has requested a loan worth KES.30,000 to purchase more cabbages to meet her customers' demand. The anticipated profit will aid her in repaying the loan and fulfilling other needs. 

She hopes to live happily; this is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase more cabbages to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Alberto, de 60 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de María, su esposa desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 7 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos: Norma y José a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de El Tambo. Siempre trabajó con sus hijos a los que quiere mucho. El trabajo al que se dedica por más de 8 años es la elaboración de ladrillos, en una fábrica que acondicionó en la zona alta de su vivienda. Cuenta que realiza un promedio de 14 millares al mes, con la ayuda de sus peones que contrata, pero si está solo, realiza un promedio de 7 mil. Los cuales vende a los clientes que constantemente visitan su fábrica. Pero existen temporadas en los que le falta ladrillos, ahí aprovecha para comprar a otros fabricantes más millares con los que abastece a sus clientes. Pero como es un hombre trabajador, 3 veces por semana lo llaman de una empresa fabricadora de chompas para que elabore cuellos, es experto en la elaboración del acabado de las chompas de lana, “trabajo para obtener un ingreso extra”, afirma. Ahora su proyecto es establecer su negocio en la selva central del país, donde el millar de ladrillos, cuesta más y hay escasa competencia. Ya dio el primer paso, contrató un terreno y su hijo se ocupa del trabajo. Espera en los próximos meses consolidarse más. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde tiene muchas esperanzas, pues espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Alberto de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de aserrín para realizar los ladrillos y el pago del salario a los peones que lo ayudan.
texts.en:
Alberto, age 60, is a hard-working man.  He lives with María, his wife of 20 years.  They have seven children, but only two of them, Norma and José, live with Alberto and Maria.  They take care of of Norma and José in their own house in El Tambo.  Alberto has always worked with his children, and he loves them very much.

For eight years he has been making bricks in a factory that he equipped in the upper area of his house.  He makes an average of 14,000 a month with the help of the day workers that he contracts.  However, if he is alone he makes an average of 7,000.  He sells the bricks to the customers who always visit his factory.

However, there are times when he does not have bricks.  Then he buys thousands more from other manufacturers in order to stock his customers.  As he is a hard-working man, three times a week a company that manufactures sweaters calls him to make collars.  He is an expert at making the finishings on the wool sweaters.  “I work to get an extra income,” he says.

Now his project is to establish his business in the central forest in his country.  That is where a thousand bricks cost more and the competition is scarce.  He has already taken the first step.  He contracted a piece of land, and his son handles the work.  In the coming months he hopes to consolidate more.

This is his first loan with MFP.  He has a lot of wishes, and he hopes for your collaboration in order to continue with his objectives.  He pledges to make his payments.  He is pleased to be part of his communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.

Upon receiving your support, Albert will buy sawdust to make the bricks, and he will pay the salary of the day workers who help him.

loans.use: to buy sawdust and to pay the salary of the day workers who help him.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol, de 32 años es una mujer saludable. Vive en compañía de su esposo Samuel y sus hijos, a quienes cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Daniel Hernández. Desde las primeras horas del día, se dirige a sus terrenos de cultivo. Los cuales quedan en una zona alejada. Como tiene que cuidar de sus sembríos y de los animales que cría, se queda varios días en una casa que acondicionó. Pero su principal actividad económica se centra en el trasporte público, con el auto que adquirió hace poco, su esposo le ayuda en este trabajo. Cuenta que le va muy bien pues el auto es propio y ya no tiene que contratar chofer. Más le molesta cuando se malogra y se queda días sin trabajar a la espera de ser arreglada. Por ello cada tiempo realiza un mantenimiento de esta manera cuida su vehículo y no tiene perdidas. Ahora desea incrementar su ganado, pues quiere avanzar en su negocio y generar otros medios de adquirir más ganancias. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde tiene muchas esperanzas, pues espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Marisol de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago de mantenimiento de su auto, de esa manera trabajará con tranquilidad.
texts.en:
32-year-old Marisol is a healthy woman who lives together with her husband Samuel and her children who she cares for in her own home in the town of Daniel Hernández. Very early in the morning she heads to her farmland which is located in a remote area.  As she must care for her crops and the animals she raises, she stays for several days in a house that she equipped for this purpose.  However, her main business activity is providing a public transport service with a car that she acquired not long ago.  Her husband helps her in this work.  Marisol says that her business is doing very well because she owns her own car and doesn't have to hire a driver.  Her biggest annoyance is when the car breaks down and she has to spend days unable to work, waiting for it to be repaired.  For this reason, every so often she has the car serviced.  By looking after her vehicle in this way, she does not experience losses.  Marisol would like to increase her number of livestock as she would like to make progress in her business and have more ways of making money.

This is Marisol's second loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can continue achieving her goals.  For her part, she pledges once again to make her loan repayments on time.  She enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive people.  With your support, Marisol will invest the money she has requested in having her car serviced so that she can work more peacefully.

loans.use: to pay to have her vehicle serviced

loans.name: Lili

texts.es: Lili, de 60 años, es una mujer que vivió mucho tiempo realizando diversos trabajos para poder mantener y educar a sus seis hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes. Está casada con Carlos quien siempre esta a su lado para poder trabajar juntos y tener una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Lili consiste en la venta de comida, desde muy temprano se dirige al mercado mas cercano a su domicilio, en algunos casos se va directo al mercado mayorista en donde compra las verduras mas frescas y las carnes mas saludables para poder hacer su trabajo. Una vez en su casa, comienza a limpiar las verduras y a picar las carnes, los sazona y espera mientras que el exquisito sabor e ingrediente secreto que tiene penetre hasta que este en su punto y poder cocinarlo, una vez que tiene todo listo pone en su letrero los nombres de los diversos platos de comida que tendrá para ofrecer durante el día. Lleva realizando su trabajo por 12 años y lo hace a lado de su esposo aunque él está un poco mal y no le ayuda como ella quisiera. Le gusta mucho lo que hace, pues le permite tener mejoras en su economía y además le da tiempo para poder hacer diversas actividades en su hogar, espera seguir creciendo con su negocio ya que le gustaría tener un mejor local en donde atender a sus clientes de manera mas cómodos. Este será el crédito número 6 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por su parte se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual como en el anterior crédito que tuvo, además se siente muy a gusto de poder trabajar con su banco comunal ya que son buenos y muy responsables. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos para asi poder continuar con su trabajo, además de refaccionar algunas partes de su local, como mesas y sillas.
texts.en:
Lili, aged 60, is a woman who spent many years of her life doing various jobs to support and educate her six children, who in the meantime have become adults and live on their own. She is married to Carlos who is always at her side to work with her and get a better quality of life.

Lili sells meals. Early in the morning she goes to the nearest market—and sometimes straight to the wholesale market—and buys the freshest vegetables and the healthiest meat for her dishes. Once at home, she cleans the vegetables and grinds the meat, seasons the ingredients and keeps an eye on the food, while her secret condiments penetrate the meat and give it its delicious taste, until the plates are ready to cook. As soon as the cooking is under way, Lili writes small notices with the name of the dishes she is about to offer during the day. She has been in this business for the past twelve years and is working with her husband, although he suffers a bit from declining health and cannot support his wife as much as she would like him to do. Lili really likes what she does, because it gives her a better financial situation and allows her to do the various household chores. She expects her business to continue its growth and would like to have better premises, where she could serve her customers more comfortably.

This will be her sixth loan with the microfinance institution Microfinanzas Prisma. She expects to continue their collaboration to pursue her goals, and for her part she promises to pay the installments on time, just as she did with her previous loan. In addition, she likes working with her communal bank, because they are good and responsible people. She will use the 2000 new soles of the loan to buy ingredients and supplies in order to continue her work, as well as refurbish parts of her restaurant; in particular, the tables and chairs need repairs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and meat, refurbish her premises, and repair the tables and chairs.

loans.name: Veronica Teresa

texts.es: Verónica es un mujer de 44 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de ropa empezó con una heladería con su mama pero cuando compro un terreno propio decidió vender ropa, calzados, artículos de bazar a crédito porque la venta de helados en su sector no resulto, su trabajo lo hace sola, no tiene dificultades, si está casada su esposo es taxista, si tiene 4 hijos, su sueño más importante es construir vivienda de concreto, incrementar negocio poner un bazar. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para comprar ropa como blusas, camisas, pantalones de hombres y mujeres etc.
texts.en: Verónica is a 44 year old woman with many aspirations for getting ahead.  She started out by selling ice cream with her mother, but then when she bought her own plot of land she decided to sell clothing, shoes, and paper goods on credit because selling ice cream in her area was not successful.  She works alone and has no difficulties.  She’s married and her husband is a taxi driver.  They have four children.  Her most important dream is to grow her business and open her own shop.  She wants the loan to buy clothing, such as blouses, shirts, men’s and women’s pants, etc.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita, de 56 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Esta casada con Manuel quien es jubilado y padre de sus 6 hijos por quienes se ha esforzado en salir adelante. Juntos habitan en su propia casa en compañía de su hijo Winy de 37 años de edad y su nieto Cesar de 15 años de edad. La actividad que realiza Juanita es la venta de comidas rápidas como salchipapas, pollos broster y papas fritas. También vende ropas para todos los géneros que trae desde la capital y los oferta entre sus clientes de la comidas. Ambos negocios los viene realizando desde su casa, donde atiende muy dablemente a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus propios vecinos. Se inició hace más de 5 años contando con el apoyo de su hijo quien le compró su carrito freidor y le dio el capital para los ingredientes necesarios, y hasta el momento le ayuda su esposo en sus ratos libres.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias  que le deja, ya que cuenta con una regular clientela que se ha sabido ganar a base de su esfuerzo y buen trato.
Se decidió a empezar con su negocio por la necesidad de contar un ingreso propio para apoyar a su pareja ya que con la pensión de jubilación muchas veces no les alcanzaba. Ahora viendo los buenos resultados desea continuar con su negocio y abrir una fuente de soda en su casa. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de mercadería como ropas que desea traer de la ciudad de Lima a precios más cómodos, para así tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Juanita, 56, is a hard-working, diligent woman who wants to get ahead. She’s married to Manuel, who is retired and is the father of their 6 children for whom he’s made great efforts to get ahead. Together they live in their own house with their son Winy, 37, and Juanita’s nephew, Cesar, who is 15. Juanita sells fast food like hotdogs and potatoes, roasted chicken and French fries. She also sells all kinds of clothing that she brings back from the capital city to sell to her food customers. Both businesses are executed from her house where she attends to her clients who are mostly her neighbors. She began her businesses more than 5 years ago with the help of her son, who bought her the cart with fryer and gave her the money to buy the ingredients she needed, and her husband who helps her when he has time. 

She considers her businesses to be quite profitable considering the income she receives from it and she counts on the regular clientele she’s built by her efforts and good service.

She decided to start her business in order to have her own income and be able to support the household as sometimes her husband’s pension wasn’t enough. Now, as she sees the good results, she’s like to continue with her business and open a snack bar in her house. This will be her 3rd loan with MFP and hopes for its support so she can realize her plans. With the loan of 1500 soles, she’ll invest in merchandise like low-priced clothing that she’ll buy in Lima so she can make more money.

loans.use: buy more clothing.

loans.name: Kaydee

texts.en: Kaydee is 38 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has 7 children, ages 25 to 10, all of them are in school and live at home. For the past 18 years she has been selling rubber dishes in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes for her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has operated her retail shop in Nakuru town for the last three years. She is 60 years old, married to Michael, and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more goods to sell in her retail shop.

In the future, Mary hopes to grow her retail shop to wholesale, thereby improving the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods like washing detergents, wheat flour, and sweets for sale

loans.name: Macelina

texts.en:
Macelina lives in Yambio. She sells charcoal and has been in business for 3 years. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children, two of them are still in school. 

Macelina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has been a practicing blacksmith in Naivasha town for the last 7 years. He is 31 years old and single.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy pieces of metal for use in his business.

In the future, Daniel hopes to grow and own a hardware store in the area.

loans.use: to buy pieces of metal for use in his business.

loans.name: Veronica Yesenia

texts.es:
Verónica es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, que vive en la ciudad de Camaná, Camaná es una ciudad que se caracteriza por sus hermosas playas, por su clima cálido y por la generosidad de sus pobladores, ella estudio hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar cosmetología, como buena peruana a Verónica le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país, por ello uno de los platos que más le gusta es la Parrillada; verónica también es madre de 2 hijos los cuales cursan educación primaria y cuyas edades comprenden 10y 12 años, ella los quiere muchísimo y son su razón de ser y su motor para seguir adelante.

Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logro ahorrar un dinerito y ahora tiene su negocio de venta de tamales y humitas, las cuales se elaboran con maíz molido y aderezo a base de especias, carne de cerdo entre otros, tiene tan buena sazón que la mayoría de sus clientes siempre regresan por mas, por ello ella cree que le va bien en su negocio, porque sus clientes siempre regresan por mas y eso la motiva mucho.

Verónica agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una cocina nueva y también comprar útiles escolares para ofrecer en su negocio, con ello podrá preparar sus platillos sin contratiempos y tener un ingreso extra con la venta de los útiles escolares y así seguir luchando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Ver que sus hijos sean profesionales y crecer como microempresaria”.
texts.en:
Veronica is a hard-working, enthusiastic woman who lives in the city of Camaná. Camaná is known for its beautiful beaches, warm temperature and the generosity of its inhabitants. She finished high school and wanted to study cosmetology, but didn’t. Like all good Peruvians, she likes typical Peruvian food; one of her favorites is Parrillada (barbecued meat). Veronica is the mother of 2 children, aged 10 and 12, who are in school. She loves them very much and they are her reason to be and to continue getting ahead.    

With much effort and dedication, she was able to save some money and she now has a business selling tamales and humitas, both made with milled corn, seasoning made from spices, and pork, among other ingredients. Her seasoning is so good that the majority of her clients come back for more. She thinks her business is doing very well because her clients come back for more and that motivates her.

Veronica is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help they will give her. With this loan, she’ll be able to buy a new stove and school supplies she can sell at her business. She’ll be able to prepare more food in less time and have extra income from the school supplies she sells and that way she can continue with her big dream: to see her children become professionals and to see herself grow as a businesswoman.

loans.use: buy a stove and school supplies.

loans.name: Maina

texts.en:
Maina is 41 years old and married to Catherine. Together they have one child. Maina operates a fish vending business and has been in the business for the past two years. He gets a monthly income of 20,000 KES from the business.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a customer. This is his first loan and he will use the loan to purchase more stocks of fish for sale in his business.

He hopes to be a renowned fish seller.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of fish for sale

loans.name: Soredola Group

texts.fr: SOREDOLA est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres ont la même affinité parentale. La représentante du groupe, Nadjibath Kikè (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 29 ans. Nadjibath Kikè est mariée à un certain Rachidi. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés. Nadjibath Kikè vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Nadjibath Kikè n'a pas été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Nadjibath Kikè vend depuis sept ans, des sacs de sortie et des chaussures dans un marché du Bénin. Nadjibath Kikè achète ses produits à Lomé au Togo. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire aux exigences de sa clientèle, Nadjibath Kikè sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SOREDOLA, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: SOREDOLA is a group of three people who share family ties.  The leader of the group,  Nadjibath Kikè (who has her hand raised in the photo), is 29 years old.  Nadjibath Kikè is married to Rachidi.  The couple has two children, both of whom attend school. Together, the couple is able to meet the needs of the household. Nadjibath Kikè did not attend school.  In order to meet her different responsibilities, she has been selling shopping bags and shoes in a market in Bénin for seven years.   She  buys her products in Lomé, in Togo.   In order to build up her business and to satisfy her customers’ demand, Nadjibath Kikè is requesting, together with the other members of the group, a fourth loan through ALIDé.  The previous loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy shoes and shopping bags.

loans.name: Ramiro Bernabe

texts.es: El señor Ramiro es una persona  que brinda el servicio de confección de trajes para damas, el señor trabaja con las boutiques mas importantes y conocidas de la ciudad de La Paz, el hace trabajos bien acabados debido a que aprendió diseñar y confeccionaren los países de Argentina y Brasil donde anteriormente trabajaba, El Sr.  Ramiro vive con su esposa en la casa de sus padres tiene cuatro hijos dos de ellos ya son independientes y solo mantiene a dos hijas, su esposa y sus hijas le colaboran con la costura, su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de Alto Tacagua, el crédito solicitado es para la compra de material de construcción que esta destinado para la conclusión de la obra fina de su taller ya que hizo una ampliación en los ambientes del taller, el Sr. Ramiro es una persona muy trabajadora se siente muy feliz por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Ramiro makes women’s outfits and works with the most important and best known boutiques in La Paz.  He does very good work and he learned to design and manufacture in Argentina and Brazil, where he used to work.  Ramiro lives with his wife in his parent’s home.  He has four children.  Two of them are already on their own and he only supports two daughters.  His wife and daughters help with the sewing.  Their home is located in the Alto Tacagua zone.

He will use the money from this loan to buy supplies that he will use to make fine works in his shop, now that he has expanded his shop.  Ramiro is very hard working and is happy about the support  he has received.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Wangnina 4 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNINA 4 est formé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et mènent toutes des activités génératrices de revenus. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Julienne, est celle  dont la main est levée sur la photo. Julienne est âgée de 39 ans et est  mariée à un cultivateur du nom de  Barthélémy. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés, dont un reste à leur charge. Julienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Julienne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de vingt cinq ans que Julienne mène comme activité, la vente de divers produits (condiments, huile végétale, farine de manioc, « akassa : aliment local fait à base d’amidon de maïs» accompagné de poissons frits). Julienne s'approvisionne dans une ville du  Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Julienne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNINA 4, un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The WANGNINA 4 group consists of five people who live in the same neighbourhood and who all pursue money making activities. The representative of the group, by the name of Julienne, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Julienne is 39 years old and married to a farmer named Barthélémy.The couple have three children who all go to school, one of whom remains dependent on them. Julienne lives with her husband and her children and helps her husband to support the family. Julienne did not go to school. She has been selling various products (condiments, vegetable oil, cassava, « akassa: a local product made up from cornstarch » accompanied by fried fish) for nearly twenty five years. Julienne buys her stock in a town in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers demand and to increase her turnover, with the other members of the WANGNINA 4 group, Julienne requests a sixth loan from ALIDé.The previous loans have been reimbursed correctly

loans.use: Purchase bags of corn and cassava,vegetable oil and fish.

loans.name: Alodoalomin Group

texts.fr: ALODOALOMIN est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres appartiennent à une même association de menuisiers dans une région du Bénin. Le représentant du groupe, Louis (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgé de 40 ans. Louis est marié à une coiffeuse du nom de Rissikatou. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. En dehors de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants à leur charge. Louis vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Louis a très peu fréquenté l’école, mais a appris la menuiserie. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Louis mène cette activité depuis dix sept ans ; ce qui lui permet de satisfaire aux besoins de ses enfants. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse, Louis sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ALODOALOMIN. Louis a bien remboursé les crédits reçus antérieurement.
texts.en:
ALODOALOMIN is a group of three people who belong to a carpenters’ association in a region of Benin. The group’s representative is Louis, whose hand is raised in the photo. Louis is 40 years old. He is married to a hairdresser named Rissikatou and the couple have three children, some of whom attend school. The couple also has two other dependent children. Louis lives with his family, and the couple handle together the various household responsibilities. 

Louis did not spend much time in school, but instead learned the trade of carpentry.  He has been practicing this profession for 17 years, and this has enabled him to provide for his children’s needs. 

In order to better meet the needs of a growing customer base, Louis is seeking a third loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the ALODOALOMIN group. Louis correctly repaid all previous loans.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin en la ciudad de Nazca, Perú. La ciudad es famosa por la legendaria Líneas de Nazca, una serie de antiguos geoglifos grabados en el desierto que rodea la ciudad, generalmente atribuidos a la cultura Nazca, que habitaron en la región de 300 a 800 AD. Como tal, la ciudad atrae a una cantidad considerable de turismo. Pero Nazca también es conocida por su gente trabajadora, que han conservado a pesar de los frecuentes terremotos, tsunamis, y un alto nivel de pobreza en la región. En su tiempo libre disfruta reparar motores;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a edwin  le gusta mucho es el “Arroz con pato”.
				
"Edwin trabaja como chofer de taxi, se dedica alrededor de 9 horas diarias, en un día puede atender hasta 25 en el día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy empeñoso y sobre todo educado con los clientes. 

Edwin agradece a los prestatarios Kiva por la ayuda que le han brindado ya que gracias a ello el podrá comprar un terreno, para que pueda construir su vivienda, lo que le permitirá en algunos meses ya no tener la necesidad de pagar alquiler y seguirá trabajando para ver su sueño de la casa propia hecho realidad.
texts.en:
Edwin is from Nazca, Peru. This city is famous for the legendary Nazca Lines, a series of old geoglyphs etched in the desert that surrounds the city. The Nazca Lines are attributed to the Nazca culture that inhabited the region from 300 BC to 800 AD. The city attracts a considerable amount of tourism. But Nazca is also known for its hard-working people who have overcome earthquakes, tsunamis and a high level of poverty.
In his spare time, Edwin repairs motors. It’s well-known that Peru has the most delicious food in the world and one of Edwin’s favorite dishes is rice with duck.

Edwin works as a taxi driver and works about 9 hours a day. In one day he can get up to 25 customers. He thinks his business is going well because he’s diligent and well-mannered with his clients.

Edwin is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their support. With this loan, he’ll invest in a parcel of land so he can build his own house. This will mean that in a few months he won’t have to pay rent anymore and he can keep working toward his goal of owning his own house.

loans.use: buy land.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La señora Rosa se dedica al tejido de mantas para señoras de pollera, ella empieza el trabajo a las 7:00 am y termina a las 20:00 pm aproximadamente, esta actividad la realiza en el domicilio que es en alquiler ya que cuenta con una vivienda que esta en construcción y cuando este terminada se ira a vivir ahí, el conyugue se dedica al servicio de transporte publico (taxi), quien cuenta con su vehículo propio y trabaja todo los días para llevar los ingresos a la casa y entregarlo a la señora Rosa, la familia cuenta con 2 hijos en edad escolar. El sueño de la señora rosa es irse a vivir a su casa propia y que un día sus hijos sean profesionales y sentirse mas orgullosa de ellos, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en el mantenimiento del vehículo de su esposo ya que esta presentando algunas fallas y esto no le permite llevar las mantas que la Sra. Rosa teje a entregar a sus distintas clientes, la Sra. Rosa es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Rosa weaves blankets for the women who wear traditional skirts.  She starts work at 7:00 a.m. and she finishes at approximately 8:00 p.m.  She does this work at the house that she rents.  She has a house that is under construction, and when it is finished she will live there.  

Her husband is a taxi driver with his own vehicle.  He works every day in order to bring income home and give it to Rosa.  They have two school-age children.  

Rosa’s dream is to live in her own house and that her children will one day become professionals of whom she will be very proud.

She will use the loan for maintenance on her husband’s vehicle.  It is having some problems, and this does not allow Rosa to take the blankets that she weaves to her different customers.

Rosa is a very hard-working person.  She is happy and very grateful to the institution for the support that has been given to her.

loans.use: to perform vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Paix Du Christ Group

texts.fr: PAIX DU CHRIST est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Sènami Clémentine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 32 ans. Sènami Clémentine est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Valentin et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge.Sènami Clémentine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple participe ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et apporter une aide à son mari dans les charges du ménage, Sènami Clémentine vend depuis une dizaine d'année, du riz et des ustensiles de cuisine par le système de distribution. Sènami Clémentine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité pour être plus compétitive sur le marché, Sènami Clémentine désire augmenter le stock de ses produits ; ce qui lui permettra d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu. Pour cette raison, Sènami Clémentine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe PAIX DU CHRIST. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: PAIX DU CHRIST is a group of four people who live in the same district.  The leader of the group, Sènami Clémentine (who has her hand raised in the photo), is 32 years old. Sènami Clémentine is married to a welder named of Valentin and is the mother of four children, all of whom attend school and are in their care.   Sènami Clémentine lives with her husband and children.  Together, the couple meets the various needs of the family.  To meet her own needs and to support her husband in household responsibilities, she has been selling rice and kitchenware through the distribution system for about 10 years.  Sènami Clémentine gets her supplies at the market in Bénin.  In order to build up her business and to be more competitive in the market, Sènami Clémentine would like to stock up on her supplies which will allow her to increase her cash flow and revenue.  For this reason, Sènami Clémentine is requesting a third loan through ALIDé, together with the other members of the group PAIX DU CHRIST. The first two loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy kitchenware (coolers, etc.) and sacks of rice.

loans.name: Gladys	Laura

texts.es: La señora Gladys es un cliente antiguo de la institución, trabajo varios años en la agencia de la ciudad de el  Alto ahora ella esta trabajando en la agencia de  Villa Fátima, se dedica  a la venta de mantas y polleras, para mujeres de pollera, la mujer de pollera viste una ropa muy particular que solo se ve en el occidente del país, ella vende esta ropa en la ciudad de el  Alto en una zona muy estratégica para la venta de estos productos,  el esposo de la señora esta de viaje tiene contratos en el interior del país pero le manda dinero, los hijos de la señora son mayores y tienen una vida muy aparte de la señora, el crédito será invertido en la compra de polleras y mantas para la venta, la Sra. Gladys se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Gladys is a former client of this institution. She worked for several years in the town of El Alto, and now is working in the town of Villa Fátima. She sells ponchos and skirts to local women. If a woman sees a particular item of clothing only available in the west of the country, then Gladys sells it in El Alto, a town well-placed for the sale of these items.

Gladys’ husband is away from home. He has work in the interior of the country but sends her money. Her children are grown up and live separate lives. The loan money is to be used to buy ponchos and skirts. Sra. Gladys is pleased and grateful to the institution for the support they have provided.

loans.use: to buy ponchos and skirts

loans.name: Djiwonou

texts.fr:
Adjo est une femme âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur de pièces auto. Elle a trois enfants
Adjo travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2006. Elle vend du bois et des produits génériques dans une boutique. Elle achète les produits au port et au grand marché. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir pas satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Adjo a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du bois et des produits génériques. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Adjo voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adjo is a 36 year old woman. She is married to an auto spare parts salesman. She has three children.Adjo has been working as a saleswoman since 2006. She sells wood and generic products in a shop. She buys her stock in the port and at the big market. She works alone. At the present time her main  problem is not being able to satisfy the demand.
Adjo has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to purchase wood and generic products. She wishes to reinvest in her business.
Over the next few years, Adjo would like to expand her business. She says that with the profits, she will take care of her family.

loans.use: Buy wood and generic products.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Kokou est un homme âgé de 26 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a deux enfants.
Kokou travaille comme déclarant en douane depuis 2003.   
Kokou a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter une moto à usage personnel.
texts.en:
Kokou is a 26-year old man. His wife is a vendor. He has two children.
Kokou  has been working as a customs  broker since 2003. Kokou has requested his second loan from WAGES in order to buy a motorcycle for personal use.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for personal use.

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr:
Akoua est une femme âgée de 43 ans. Elle est célibataire et a  un enfant. 
Akoua travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2000. Elle vend des chaussures et des pagnes pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les marchadises à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Akoua a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des chaussures et des pagnes. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Akoua voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akoua is 43 years old. She is single and the mother of one child. She has been working as a small retailer since 2000. She sells shoes and pagnes (highly decorative and colourful West African fabric) to all types of customers at the market. She gets her supplies in Lomé and works alone. Currently, her biggest problem is her lack of inventory.

Akoua has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy shoes and pagnes. She would like to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Akoua would like to increase the size of her business. She plans to use her profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy shoes and pagnes.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
A decade is the length of time this happily married mother of 3, going by the name of Rebecca has been going about her shoe sales business in Mpigi.
Prior to this, she was mostly engaged in secretarial work.

On the side, Rebecca also ekes out more income from her modest clothes sales trade.  Rebecca anticipates improved prospects for her business in the aftermath of getting this Kiva Loan.  She reckons her sales returns will rise as she will have more pairs of shoes to sell.  She says she will use her loan to purchase more pairs of shoes, principally casual sport shoes to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more pairs of shoes, principally casual sport shoes to resell.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée à un chauffeur. Elle a trois enfants.
Afi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1992. Elle vend du charbon de bois, des tubercules d’ignames et des céréales pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Gléi. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Afi a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon de bois, des tubercules d’ignames et des céréales. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Afi voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
