Afi is 47 years old. She is married to a driver and has 3 children. She has been working as a small retailer since 1992. She sells charcoal, yam tubers and cereals door to door to all sorts of customers. She works alone and buys her merchandise in Gléi. Right now, her main difficulty is that she is unable to meet customer demand.

Afi has requested her 2nd loan from WAGES so that she can buy charcoal, yam tubers and cereals. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Afi would like to expand her business. She plans to use her profits to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal, yam tubers and corn.

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es:
Daysi, de 37 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora con muchas ganas de salir adelante, además de ser alegre y amable. Es conviviente con Wilder quien es docente y padre de sus 3 hijos Wendy de 18, Neyer de 16 y Gary de 2 años de edad a quienes quiere mucho. Junto están cómodamente instalados en su propia casa que compraron con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Daysi es  la venta de comida por las mañanas como juanes, caldos de gallinas, refrescos y otros. Para eso cuenta con cuna mesa que instala en el frontis de una entidad que es muy concurrida por los docente de la ciudad, brindándoles  una buena atención desde muy temprano. 
Se inició hace más de 4 años con un préstamo particular que le sirvió para adquirir su ingredientes y hasta el momento lo viene realizando con el apoyo de su hija, quien atiende a los clientes. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja y lo concurrido de la zona donde está ubicada. Se decido a empezar con su negocio debido a que sufrió un accidente fluvial donde perdió la embarcación que usaba como herramienta de trabajo, brindando servicio de transporte fluvial, y viendo la necesidad de contar con ingresos para mantener a su familia. 
Por tanto, ahora viendo los buenos resultados que esta teniendo, desea continuar y mantener su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, Esta muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de su comida, buscando precios más cómodos ya que los precios están que suben, de esa manera contar con una margen de ganancias razonable.
texts.en:
Daysi, thirty-seven, is a hardworking woman with a great desire to succeed.  She's pleasant and happy, too.  She lives with her partner, Wilder, who is a teacher and father of her three children, Wendy, 18, Neyer, 16, and Gary, 2, all of whom she loves dearly.  They live comfortably together in their own house that they worked very hard to buy.  In the mornings Daysi sells meals like juanes [seasoned rice wrapped in a green bijao leaf], chicken soup, soft drinks, etc.  She has a stand set up in front of a business where lots of local teachers pass by and she provides them with great service starting very early.

Daysi started out more than four years ago with a private loan that allowed her to get her ingredients and so far she has worked with the support of her daughter, who serves customers.  Daysi feels her business is sufficiently profitable because it provides healthy profits and a busy location.  She decided to start her business because she had an accident on the river in which she lost the boat she used for her transportation service and she needed to have income to support the family.  So now, given the good results she's getting, she wants to keep and maintain her business.  

This will be Daysi's second loan with MFP.  She's very glad to know that she'll get financial support because it will make her feel secure in moving ahead with her business.  She plans to invest the 1500 soles in ingredients for meals.  Prices are going up so she'll look for better prices to increase  profit margin.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for food preparation.

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en: Ruslan is 27 years old and he is married.  He is involved in agriculture, selling milk products at the bazaar.  He started his own business 5 years ago. Now he wants to obtain a loan of 800 AZN to buy one cow.  He wants to increase his business in milk production.

loans.use: To buy one cow.

loans.name: Chernor

texts.en:
This is 32 year-old Chernor.  He is single and has 1 child who is 5 years old.  He has no additional dependents that live with him.  In 2005, Chernor established his CD, DVD, cassette and radio business.  He began his business because just after he sat for the GCE' O level exams, he wanted to further his education, but there was no one to support him financially as his parents were poor.   So he decided to assist his colleagues in doing business with the aim of raising fund to further his education, but unfortunately, he came to have more interest in business and finally decided to stay in it. 

Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about LE 1,500,000 every month from this business.  He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,500,000.  Chernor has already received and successfully repaid his second loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy 20 Catton CD plates at SLL 100,000 and 15 Catton DVD cassette at SLL 150, 000 and the balance will be used for transport.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 800,000.  In the future, Chernor plans to expand his business to a higher level.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy  20 Catton CD plates at SLL 100,000 and 15 Catton DVD cassette at SLL150, 000 and the balance will be used for transport.

loans.name: Suban

texts.en:
Suban is 49 years old and married to Abdi.  Together they have three children.  She operates a mobile boutique and has been in the business for the past 21 years.  She gets a monthly income of KES 20,000 from the business.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET customer.  This is her first term loan and she will use the loan amount to purchase stocks of clothes for her business.  Her hope is to own a permanent premises to do her business.

loans.use: Add stocks of clothes for her business.

loans.name: Dzidjogan

texts.fr:
Djidjozan est un homme âgé de 33 ans. Il est marié å un tresseuse. Il a 01 enfant. 
Djidjozan travaille comme magasinier et en même temps revendeur de cartes  de recharges depuis 2007. Il vend avec deux personnes dans une boutique. Il s’approvisionne chez les grossistes de carte de recharges.
Djidjozan a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des cartes de recharges.  Il veut prendre soin de sa famille avec les profits réalisés.
texts.en:
Djidjozan is 33 years old. He is married to a hair braider and has one child. He has been working as a warehouseman, and selling prepaid phone cards, since 2007. He gets his phone cards from wholesalers and sells them in a shop, with two other people.

Djidjozan has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy prepaid phone cards. He wants to use the profits he will earn to take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy prepaid phone cards.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Fatmata. She is married to a business man and has no children. She has two dependents: her mother and father. In 2005, Fatmata established her business selling slippers. After high school, she wanted to pursue a higher education, but her parents could not afford to pay the tuition. She decided to help one of her aunts with her business until she could raise enough money to continue her education. After some years she raised some capital, but after consulting her aunt about her plight, she advised her to establish her own business instead of going back to school. Since she had some business experience, she decided to take her aunt's advice and open her own shop. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL to buy four cartons of assorted children’s slippers (450,000 SLL), three cartons of ladies' sandals (650,000 SLL), and two cartons of ladies' slippers (550,000 SLL). The balance of the loan will be used for transportation. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 700,000 SLL. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy sandals and slippers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has practiced farming in Nakuru town for the last three years. She is 38 years old and married to Stephen. They have two children. Besides farming, she also has dairy cows which enable her to earn more income from the milk sales.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to open a dairy shop and be able to supply and sell milk and milk products from her farm to her customers.

In the future, Mary hopes to expand both her faming and milk businesses and become one of the best farmers in Nakuru town.

loans.use: To open a dairy shop

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr:
Yaovi est une femme âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée å un  informaticien et a 02 enfants.
Yaovi travaille comme revendeuse de jus (citron, bissap ananas  depuis 2009. Elle vend seule à domicile et s’approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé. 
Yaovi a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du bissap, citron sucre…. Pour la préparation du jus. Elle veut voir sa famille s’épanouir et aider son mari dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en:
Yaovi is 35 years old. She is married to a computer specialist and has 2 children. She has been selling fruit juice (lemon, bissap - made from dried hibiscus flower - and pineapple) since 2009. She works alone and sells door to door. She gets her supplies at the Lomé Grand Market.

Yaovi has requested her 2nd loan from WAGES so that she can buy ingredients with which to make fruit juice, like bissap, lemon and sugar. She would like to support her husband with the household expenses and watch her family blossom.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for fruit juice.

loans.name: Jamiyla

texts.ru: Жамийле 35 лет, замужем и воспитывает пятерых детей школьного возраста. В поисках источника финансирования, Жамийла начала свой бизнес в животноводстве. Благодаря упорному труду Жамийлы, на сегодня в ее хозяйстве имеется две  дойные коровы, и сорок овец, что позволяет получать в месяц около 2,000 сом (KGS) от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов.  Также , Жамийла обрабатывает 0,76 га орошаемой земли с фасолью, что позволяет также иметь доход в сезон.   Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жамийла обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров. Доходы Жамийла планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Jamiyla is 35 years old, married and raising five school-age children.  In search of a financial source, she started her own business in animal husbandry.  Thanks to her persistent work, Jamiyla's business currently has two dairy cows and forty sheep, which allows her to earn about 2,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and meat products.  She also grows beans on 0.76 hectares of irrigated land, which allows her to have an income during the season as well.  In order to further develop her business, Jamiyla requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy dairy cows.  She plans to invest the earnings into a continued increase of livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Suydumkan

texts.ru: Суйдумкан 51 год, замужем и имеет шестерых детей. В поисках источника финансирования после распада Советского Союза, Суйдумкан начала свой бизнес в полеводстве. Благодаря упорному труду Суйдумкан, на сегодня в ее хозяйстве имеется 2,45 га орошаемой земли, где она выращивает фасоль и картофель.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Суйдумкан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян фасоли и минерального удобрения. Доходы Суйдумкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Suydumkan is 51 years old, married and has six children.  In search of a financial source after the breakup of the Soviet Union, she started her own farming business.  Thanks to her persistent work, Suydumkan's business currently has 2.45 hectares of irrigated land, where she grows beans and potatoes.  In order to further develop her business, Suydumkan requested a loan in the sum of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy beans seeds and mineral fertilizers.  She plans to invest the earnings into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Akossiwa est une femme âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur de pièces auto et a 04 enfants.
Akossiwa travaille comme revendeuse de sucre, farine de blé et sachets depuis 1998. Elle vend à ses clients dans un marché de la place et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Elle vend seule et sa difficulté principale est la concurrence sur le marché. 
Akossiwa a requis son second  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises(sucre, farine de blé, sachets) afin de bien répondre à la demande de la clientèle.  Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité avec les profits réalisés.
Dans les prochaines années, Akossiwa voudrait voir son activité prospérer et avoir une famille bien heureuse.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is 45 years old. She is married to an auto parts dealer and has 4 children. Akossiwa has been selling sugar, wheat flour and small plastic bags since 1998. She sells to customers at her local market and gets her supplies in Lomé. She works alone and her main challenge is dealing with the competition at the market.

Akossiwa has requested her 2nd loan from WAGES in order to restock on sugar, wheat flour and small plastic bags, so that she can meet customer demand. She would like to reinvest her profits in her business. In the coming years, Akossiwa would like to see her business prosper and to have a very happy family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, wheat flour and small plastic bags.

loans.name: Gabriella

texts.fr:
Gabriella est une femme âgé(e) de 29 ans. Elle est mariée å un  entrepreneur. Elle a 01 enfant. Gabriella travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2000. Elle vend à domicile et achète les marchandises au Grand Marché.
Gabriella a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sucres, du lait de la sardine…. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité afin d’avoir plus de profits
texts.en:
Gabriella, age 29, is married to an entrepreneur. She has one child, and has been working as a reseller of food staples since 2000.

She sells at her home and purchases her supplies at the Grand Market. She's seeking her second loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy sugar, milk, sardines, etc.

She wants to reinvest in her business in order to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, sardines, etc.

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr:
Edoh est un homme âgé de 28 ans. Il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants
Edoh travaille comme revendeur et réparateur d’appareils portables depuis 2010. Il vend seul dans un quartier de la place et achète les marchandises à LOME.
Edoh a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des appareils portables et des accessoires. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité afin de mieux préparer sa future vie maritale.
texts.en:
Edoh, age 28, is unmarried and without children. He's been working as a reseller and repairman of mobile phones since 2010. He sells on his own in one  neighborhood of the town where he lives, and purchases his supplies in Lomé. 

Edoh is seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy mobile phones and accessories. He wants to reinvest in his business in order to better prepare his future married life.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнуре 40 лет, замужем и имеет  четверых детей. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, в 2003 году Айнура начала свой бизнес в животноводстве с суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Айнуры, на сегодня в ее хозяйстве имеется одна дойная корова и четыре овцы, что позволяет получать примерно 10,000 сом с продажи молочных и мясных продуктов.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айнура обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух дойных коров и овец. Доходы Айнура планирует вложить в оплату контракта на учебу для своей дочери.
texts.en: Ainura is 40 years old, married and has four children. In search of a financial source for her family, she started her own animal husbandry business in 2003 with a sum of 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her persistent work, Ainura's business currently has one dairy cow and four sheep and yields about 10,000 som from sales of milk and meat products. In order to further develop her business, Ainura requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy two dairy cows and sheep. She plans to invest the earnings into paying for her daughter's education contract.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr:
DÉDÉ est une femme âgé(e) de 49 ans. Elle est mariée à un mécanicien et a  04enfants.
DÉDÉ travaille comme revendeuse de matériaux de construction  depuis 1992. Une personne l’aide dans son activité et sa difficulté est la concurrence sur le marché. Elle s’approvisionne au Grand marché de Lomé et à Accra et vend à Lomé.
DÉDÉ a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des matériaux de construction. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et voir sa famille s’épanouir.
texts.en:
Dédé, age 49, is married to a mechanic and has four children. She's been working as a reseller of construction supplies since 1992. Another person helps her with her business.

She gets her supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé and in Accra, and sells in Lomé. Dédé is seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to purchase construction supplies. She wants to reinvest in her business and see her family blossom.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Aijan

texts.ru:
Айжан  33 года, растит дочку 4-х лет. В поисках источника дохода для своей маленькой семьи, в 2011 году Айжан начала свой бизнес в торговле фруктами на центральном рынке города Токмок.   Стартовав с суммой в 2,000 сом (KGS), Айжан сумела развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в сумме 10,000 сом.   
В целях расширения ассортимента товаров, Айжан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы Айжан планирует вложить в ремонт своей квартиры, а в будущем - мечтает открыть свой собственный магазин.
texts.en: Aijan is 33 years old and raising a four-year-old daughter. In search of an income source for her small family, she started her own business in selling fruit at the central market of the city of Tokmok in 2011.  Having started with a sum of 2,000 som (KGS), Aijan was able to develop her business to have a monthly income of 10,000 som.  In order to expand the product selection, Aijan requested a loan in the sum of 35,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company. She plans to invest the earnings into repairing her apartment and dreams of opening her own store in the future.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of products

loans.name: Venera

texts.ru: Венере 38лет, замужем, воспитывает четверых детей. В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Венера начала свой бизнес в торговле продуктами питания с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS).  Взяв в аренду торговое место, Венера приложила все усилия для развития бизнеса и добилась успехов –ее ежемесячный доход составляет около 5,000 сом . На сегодняшний день, ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, поэтому Венера обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS). Закуп товаров позволит ей расширить ассортимент, увеличить количество клиентов и повысить продажи.
texts.en: Venera is 38 years old, married, and raising four children. While trying to find a source of income for her family, Venera started her own business selling groceries with an initial sum of 5,000 som (KGS). Having rented the space for her store, Venera made every effort to develop her business and achieved success - her monthly income now amounts to roughly 5,000 som. Presently, the assortment of her products is not very wide, and so Venera has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS). Stocking additional goods will allow her to expand the range of her store's products, increase the number of customers, and improve sales.

loans.use: to broaden the assortment of goods in her store

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto, trabaja como chofer propietario en un sindicato de transporte urbano de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento completo de su vehiculo ya que este es el único ingreso que tiene para mantener a su familia.
Alberto, es viudo, tiene cuatro hijos con los cuales vive en la zona San Antonio ubicado en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez que trabaja  junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Alberto works as an independent driver and is a member of an urban transportation union in the city of La Paz. The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for complete maintenance of his vehicle since it is the only source of income by which he is able to support his family. Alberto is a widower and has four children. They live in the District of San Antonio of the city of La Paz.

This is the second time he has worked with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Arroyo Syry Group

texts.es:
El comite lleva por nombre Arroyo Syry, ellas han asumido el compromiso de  mantener unido el grupo, trabajando siempre bajo un marco de respeto  mutuo, las mismas actualmente se encuentran en el  cuarto ciclo con buena calificación, el grupo queda integrada por  15 mujeres que invierten en sus actividades con el fin de elevar su nivel de vida.
Luz es una de estas mujeres, ella se dedica a la costura en general, y nos cuenta que siempre está con mucho trabajo, gracias a que la mayoría de sus vecinos siempre le acercan trabajos para que haga. Por medio de este trabajo ella puede ayudar a su familia, dándoles lo que necesitan para una vida mejor y sin privaciones.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, encajes, botones, cierres y demás insumos que necesita para poder seguir trabajando, de modo que pueda seguir cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes. Ella al igual que sus compañeras está muy agradecida con kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
The committee known as Arroyo Syry has made a commitment to stay united, always working under a framework of mutual respect. Currently they are in the 4th cycle with good standing. The group is composed of 15 women that invest in their work with the goal of elevating their standard of living.
Luz is one of these women. She sews for a living and tell us that she always has a lot of work, thanks to the majority of her neighbors always bringing her work for her to do. By means of this work she is able to help her family, giving them what they need for a better life and without deprivation.
She is requesting a loan to buy cloth, thread, lace, buttons, zippers, and other supplies that she needs to be able to continue working in a way that she can continue complying with the demands of her clients. She, like her companions, is very grateful to kiva and the Paraguayan foundation.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, lace, buttons, zippers and other supplies.

loans.name: Ysapy Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del comité Ysapy  es un grupo muy constante y trata siempre de mejorar son personas muy entusiastas. Son mujeres jefas de familia que siempre se esfuerzan al máximo para poder darle lo mejor a sus familias. Su objetivo es trabajar juntas y de esa forma poder ayudarse las unas a las otras para poder salir adelante.
Yolanda es la presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de jeans de marcas y tambien de calzados,y comenta que tiene muy buena clientela ya que sus productos son muy apreciados por la buena calidad que tienen. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita la ayuda de la fundacion paraguaya y de kiva para la compra de jeans, con lo cual podrá tener más productos en stock para poder ofrecer a sus clientes. El grupo está agradecido por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
The women who belong to the Ysapy committee are a very persevering group who are always trying to improve themselves.  They are a very enthusiastic group.  They are all heads of families who work as hard as they can to provide their families with the best in life.  Their aim is to work together so that they can help each other to make progress.

Yolanda is the group's president.  Her business is selling brand jeans and also footwear.  She says that she has a very good customer base because her products are very highly valued for their good quality.  Thanks to her hard work and commitment, she has managed to do well and help her family.

Yolanda is requesting the help of Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva to buy jeans.  This will mean she will have more products in stock to offer her customers.  The group is grateful for the opportunity that they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy jeans to sell

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel, de 44 años de edad, es u hombre trabajador y dedicado, además de ser amable y cordial tiene las ganas de ser un empresario en calzado. Es conviviente con Narjil quien es ama de casa y madre de sus 3 hijos Dais de 18, Dayana de 15 y Luz de 14 años de edad. Juntos viven en la comodidad de su propia casa que lograron comprar con el apoyo mutuo. La actividad que realiza Miguel es la renovación de calzados, oficio que aprendió mientras trabajaba en una empresa de confecciones de calzados en otra ciudad, haciendo cursos y talleres de capacitación. Su actividad la viene realizando en un pequeño espacio alquilado en la entrada de una tienda de productos de calzados, donde atiende de manera rápida y amable a sus clientes, siendo muy solicitado.
Se inicio hace 3 años con un capital propio comprando una maquina de coser calzados, y hasta el momento lo viene realizando solo.
Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja, además viendo la oportunidad de generarse ingresos económicos ya que en esa zona era escaso ese servicio.
Antes de empezar con su negocio, tenía dificultades económicas ya que se había quedado sin empleo, además de gustarle el trabajo buscó alternativas para poder sostener a su familia.
Por tanto, ahora viendo las ganancias y los buenos resultados que está teniendo desea continuar so negocio y en el futuro abrir un taller de confecciones de calzados. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de materiales para la renovación de calzados  como pegamentos, hilos, otros, también de materiales para la confección como suelas, cueros y otros, buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Miguel, 44, is a hardworking and dedicated man, in addition to being kind and cordial.  He wants to have a shoemaking business.  He lives with Narjil, a housewife and the mother of their three children: Dais, 18, Dayana, 15, and Luz, 14.  Together they live in the comfort of their own home, which they managed to buy through mutual support. 

The work Miguel does is shoe repair, a job he learned by taking classes and training workshops while he was working in a shoemaking business in another city.  He does his work in a small rented space at the entrance to a shoe store, where he gives his customers quick and friendly service and is very much in demand.  He began three years ago with his own capital, buying a sewing machine for shoemaking, and has worked alone up to the present.  He considers his business quite profitable because of the profits it yields him.  He also saw the opportunity to generate income for himself, because this service was scarce in that area.

Before starting his business he had financial problems because he was unemployed.  Besides liking the work, he looked for alternatives to be able to support his family.  Consequently, seeing the profits and the good results he is having now, he wants to continue his business and in the future open a shoemaking workshop.

This will be his second loan with the MFP institution, for which he hopes for your collaboration so he can continue with his goals.

With the requested loan of 3000 PEN he will invest in buying materials to repair shoes, such as glue, thread, and others, as well as shoemaking materials such as soles, leather, and others.  He will look for low prices for buying in quantity.

loans.use: to buy soles, leather, thread, and glue.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La señora Virginia  se dedica a el comercio de artículos del hogar (electrodomésticos, sabanas, copas, focos y otras mercaderías) hace diez años que se dedica a esta actividad, ofrece sus productos a distintos sectores, ya sea oficina e incluso en los mercados otorgando sus productos a crédito como al contado, los cuales los compra en la ciudad de Oruro y posteriormente entrega la mercadería a clientes que le hacen pedido en la ciudad de Cochabamba, vive actualmente con su esposo en domicilio de su propiedad, solicita el crédito para compra de mercadería como electrodomésticos y sabanas ya que le hicieron un pedido importante y así de esta manera poder incrementar su capital de trabajo y de esta manera  incrementar sus ventas y obtener mas ganancias, la Sra. Virginia se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señora Virginia has sold home items (home electronics, sheets, glasses, light bulbs, and other items) for ten years. She offers her products to a wide variety of customers, whether in offices and even in markets, on credit or for cash. She buys her products in the city of Oruro and later delivers the merchandise to customers who have ordered from her in the city of Cochabamba. She currently lives with her husband in their own home. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of merchandise such as home electronics and sheets, since she has an important order to fill. This will allow her to increase her working capital and thus increase her sales and make more income. Virginia is happy and grateful to the institution for this support.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances and sheets

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
Amir is from Iraq. He is 32 years old and married.  Amir has been the owner of a store since 2005, selling electrical and household items.  He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation.  He is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $1,500 loan to pay his annual rent and to add inventory.  He is aiming to increase his profits which will offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To pay rent and buy more inventory for his store.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca  is 45 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has  five children  ages 29 to 19; three  of them are in school and live at home. The oldest ones are working  and living on their own. For the past fifteen   years she has been selling  dried peppers   in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase  more  dried peppers  for her business. She plans  to become a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase  more  dried peppers  for her business

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun was born in 1985 in Armavir city. But for already eight years now, he and his family have lived in Yerevan. Harutyun is not married and he lives in an apartment of his near relations with his retiree mother, brother and his jobless sister-in-law. 

For more than five years Harutyun has been engaged in commerce. He rents a stall where he sells mixed products, such as various wires, pipes, wire rope, etc. Harutyun buys his merchandise from wholesale markets once a month. Also, he sells skewers that his brother makes.  

Thanks to his business Harutyun is able to provide for his family. This is his second loan from Nor Horizon and now he needs a $1,800 loan to buy water valves, pitchforks and other products to resell.

loans.use: to buy water valves, pitchforks and other products to resell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is 36 years old and lives in Buchanan, Liberia.  She is married and has four children between 3 and 13 years old.  They are in school and live at home.  For the past ten years, she has been selling palm oil in the local market.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business.  She plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: purchase more palm oil to sell at the local market.

loans.name: Nurbubu

texts.ru:
Нурбубу 48 лет, вдова, имеет 6 детей. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Нурбубу занимается животноводством и полеводством.  Начатое еще в период Советского Союза с 20,000 сом хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 1,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. На данный момент в хозяйстве Нурбубу  имеется две коровы, две лошади и десять овец, заготовлено 1,5 тонны пшеницы, 800 кг ячменя. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нурбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух лошадей. Доходы Нурбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Nurbubu is 48 years old, a widow and has six children. To provide an income source for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry and farming.  This business, started during the time of the Soviet Union with 20,000 som, today yields about 1,000 som (KGS) per month.  Currently, Nurbubu's business has two cows, two horses and ten sheep, and has a stock of 1.5 tons of wheat and 800 kilograms of barley.  In order to further develop her business, Nurbubu requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy two horses. She plans to invest the profits into a continued increase of livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase horses

loans.name: Buusayra

texts.ru: Буусайре 49 лет, вдова, имеет 4 детей. Буусайра на протяжении 19 лет занимается  животноводством, начав этот  бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Буусайры на сегодняшний день насчитывается 2 коровы, 2 теленка, 32 овцы и 8 коз, принося около 6,000 сом ежемесячно. Также Буусайра ежегодно обрабатывает  0,5  га земли,  где выращивает кукурузу и  картофель. В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Буусайра обратилась в Компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и овец. Доходы Буусайра планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья.
texts.en: Buusayra is 49 years old, a widow and has four children. She has been involved in animal husbandry for 19 years, after starting this business with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Buusayra's persistent work, her business has two cows, two calves, 32 sheep and eight goats today, and yields about 6,000 som monthly.  She also regularly works on 0.5 hectares of land, where she grows corn and potatoes.  In order to further develop her business, Buusayra requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy calves and sheep. She plans to invest the profits into a continued increase of livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is 57 years old and a single mother of four. She operates a mobile shop and has been in the business for the past 30 years. She gets an income of KES 30,000 from the business.

She was introduced to KADET LTD  by a field officer and this is her first loan. She will use the loan amount to start up her business in permanent premises.

Her hope is to have a well-established boutique in the area.

loans.use: To set up permanent premises  for her mobile shop.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald has practiced farming in Olkalou  town for the last 12 years. He is 47 years old, married to Mary, and they have three school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET  LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to pay for water installation in his farm and purchase potato seedlings

In future, Gerald hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Olkalou area.

loans.use: to pay for water installation in his farm and purchase potato seedlings

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Yambio, South Sudan.  She sells clothes and has been in business for three years.  She is 30 years old, married, and has four children who are all still in school. 

Susan heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her third loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 1,500 SDG in order to purchase clothes.  She will use the extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anarbu

texts.ru: Анарбу 46 лет, замужем, имеет 8 детей – 4 сына и 4 дочки. Анарбу на протяжении 19 лет занимается  животноводством, начав этот  бизнес с суммы в 8,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Анарбу на сегодняшний день насчитывается 5 коров, 15 овец,5 ягнят и 5 коз, принося около 5,000 сом ежемесячно с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Анарбу обратилась в Компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и овец. Доходы Анарбу  планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья.
texts.en: Anarbu is 46 years old, married and has eight children - four sons and four daughters. She has been involved in animal husbandry for 19 years, after starting this business with a sum of 8,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Anarbu's persistent work, her business has five cows, fifteen sheep, five lambs and five goats today, and yields about 5,000 som monthly from sales of milk and milk products.  In order to further develop her business, Anarbu requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy calves and sheep. She plans to invest the profits into a continued increase of livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Geraldine Odett

texts.en:
Geraldine belongs to a village bank called “Señor de Accha.” The bank is located in Pisac, a district of Calca province in the Cusco department. Geraldine is 20 years old and single. She earns a living by selling souvenirs and artisan products at the local handicrafts market, which is very popular among tourists heading to Macchu Picchu. Geraldine’s stand sells a variety of unique and colorful crafts, including alpaca knits and woven textiles, some of which are made by local indigenous groups.

Geraldine is requesting a loan in order to buy handicrafts for her stand. She hopes to expand her business with the loan and is committed to repaying her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase handicrafts for a souvenir stand.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha is 35 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has three children, ages 4 to 17 years old, all of whom are in school and live at home.  

For the past eight years Oretha has been involved in the cook shop (restaurant) business in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, Vita (a juice drink), onions, and pepper for her business. Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, Vita, onions, and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Filomeno

texts.es:
Filomeno, se dedica a la producción de leche junto a toda su familia, también
trabaja como profesor de secundaria en el área rural de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un par de vacas lecheras para producir mas leche y tener mejores ingresos para mantener a su familia.
Filomeno, es casado y tiene tres hijos con los cuales vive en Pucarani, la misma se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Filomeno works producing milk together with his entire family.  He also works as teacher at a secondary school in the rural area of La Paz city.

The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of a pair of dairy cows to produce more milk and to earn improved income to support his family.

Filomeno is married with three children.  He lives with them in Pucarani, which is located in the city of La Paz.

This is the third time that he has worked with IMPRO and his second time with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a pair of dairy cows to increase his milk production and improve his income.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 58-year-old man from Migori, western Kenya, and is married to Monicah. They have seven children aged between 9 and 25 years.

Wilson operates a livestock selling business and has done this kind of business for the last seven years. He makes a monthly income of KES 20,000. He is taking his fourth loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy cattle and goats for sale. He will use the profits to pay the loan.

His dream is to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy cattle and goats for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres Rumbo Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan es un hombre de 60 años y tiene 06 hijos. Vive en el distrito de Puente Piedra.  Se desempeña como maestro de obras en el rubro de la construcción civil, oficio que realiza por más de 15 años; entre sus funciones podemos mencionar la colocación de pisos, cerámicos, acabados de construcción, trabajos de pintura, entre otros; cuando las obras son grandes contrata personal. Su trabajo es el único sustento de sus hijos, con este ha logrado darles estudios y mejorar su calidad de vida.
El préstamo será utilizado para renovar sus herramientas deterioradas (comprar herramientas nuevas); también, para comprar un taladro con el cual podrá realizar trabajos más especializados e incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Cabe destacar que sus herramientas de trabajo son indispensables para el oficio que ejerce.
Juan en un futuro cercano quisiera tener un negocio propio; por tal motivo quiere ahorrar. Él es el presidente del grupo “MUJERES RUMBO AL PROGRESO” que está formado por 09 socios. En la fotografía es el tercero de la Izquierda.
texts.en:
Juan is a very hardworking man.  He is 60 years old and separated, and has six children.

He lives in the area of Puente Piedra, Lima, Peru.  He works in civil construction.  He is a master builder, something he has been doing for more than 15 years.  He puts in floors, tiles, construction finishes, etc.  He also does paint jobs.  When the jobs are bigger he hires personnel.  His job is his means of support for his family.  With his job he has been able to give his family an education and a better quality of life.

With his new loan he wants to buy some tools that are not deteriorated and a new drill, something indispensable in his work.  He would like to have his own business in the future, for which he wants to save.

Juan is the president of the Mujeres Rumbo al Progreso group, which is made up of nine members.  Juan is the third one from the left.

loans.use: to buy new tools and a drill.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel es un padre de familia muy responsable que tiene 39 años de edad, tiene casa propia en la que vive junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos, la casa en la que vive esta ubicada en una zona rural, perteneciente al distrito de Morrope a una hora aproximadamente de la provincia de Chiclayo.
El caserío es un lugar pequeño que cuenta con unas 50 familias aproximadamente, pero que goza de los servicios básicos como el agua potable y luz eléctrica.


José Manuel tiene como actividad económica principal el dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, actividad que realiza un aproximado de 4 años. Adicionalmente también se genera otros ingresos comercializando aves de corral, ambos negocios están ubicados estratégicamente en su domicilio, experiencia que aprendió de sus padres, ah dicha actividad se viene dedicando un aproximado de 5 años, y es que con el apoyo de su esposa eh hijos ha hecho de que José Manuel emprenda en nuevos objetivos.

José Manuel ha solicitado un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1500 Nuevos Soles los cuales invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción para darle los acabados que necesita su casa y a la vez para surtir su bodega necesita comprar mas abarrotes con los que mantendrá satisfecha a su clientela.

José Manuel ha demostrado ser muy responsable, pues no solo con su familia si no que también con los vecinos de su caserío según ellos manifiesta.
texts.en:
José Manuel is a very responsible father and is 39 years old. He has his own house and lives along with his wife and 4 children. The house they live in is located in a rural area. It is in the district of Morrope about an hour from the province of Chiclayo. 
The village is a small place that has about 50 families, but it enjoys basic services such as drinking water and electric lighting. 
José Manuel works selling groceries and staple goods and he has been doing this for about 4 years. He also generates income by selling poultry. Both businesses are strategically located in his home - something that he learned from his parents. He has been doing this last work for about 5 years.  The support of his wife and children has motivated José Manuel to take on new goals. 
José Manuel has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternative for $575 to buy construction materials for the finishing touches that his house needs as well as to supply his store by buying groceries that will keep his customers satisfied. 
José Manuel has shown himself to be very responsible, not just to his family but also to his neighbors in the village.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and staple goods.

loans.name: Asinzo

texts.en:
Asinzo is a 40-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has two children, ages 20 and 12. Both of them go to school. 

Asinzo runs a food store business and has been in the business for six years. She has one employee. 

Asinzo heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients and outreach and promotion done by the loan officers. She is taking a loan of 1,500 SDG to purchase more food items like Safa milk (a milk brand name), Pepsi drinks, water, Blue Band products (a grocery brand name), and many other items. In addition to this business, Asinzo has her houses for rent as another source of income.

In five years time, Asinzo hopes for increments in her business size and to have a good store.

Her major challenges include wholesalers’ price differences in the market day to day.

Asinzo says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support, especially for women, for helping them with capital to start up a small-scale business.

loans.use: to purchase more food items like Safa milk, Pepsi drinks, water, Blue Band products, and many other items.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 26 years old and married. He lives with four family members, two of whom work.

Maher has been an owner of a car blacksmithing workshop since 2001. He has more than ten years experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $1,800 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his workshop.

loans.name: Frunze

texts.en:
Frunze, who is 65 years old, lives in Geghamavan village, an area of Sevan, with his wife and his son. His son works as an electrician and Frunze’s wife is housewife.
 
Frunze graduated from Yerevan Polytechnic Institute in the chemical industry department and for many years, he worked as a foreman in different companies. Since 2002, Frunze and his wife have been engaged in farming. They grow potatoes and breed cows, sheep, pigs and chickens. Part of the agricultural produce they use for their family’s needs and the other part they sell to resellers. Thanks to farming, Frunze solves the major part of his family’s needs, as his son’s salary is small. 

This is Frunze’s second loan from Nor Horizon and now he is seeking for $1,300 to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
El señor Celso es de la ciudad de Itá, tiene 39 años de edad, está casado con la señora Norma, vive a escasa distancia del centro de la ciudad de Itá, tienen 3 hijos aun menores de edad.
Celso presta servicios como taxista en una parada que se encuentra en un lugar estratégicamente bien ubicado en la ciudad de Itá, tiene clientes formados desde hace más de 6 años, cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposa quien posee un copetín hace 3 años en el cual vende empanadas, sándwiches, sopas y bebidas como cerveza, gaseosa, jugos, también vende helados y golosinas.
El préstamo que el señor Celso solicita es para mantenimiento general de su automóvil, el cual es el elemento esencial de su trabajo. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo por parte de fundación paraguaya y kiva.
texts.en:
Celso is from the city of Ita. He is 39 years old and married to Norma. He lives a short distance from the center of Ita. They have 3 children who are still minors. 

Celso is a taxi driver who works from a stop that is in a strategic location well placed in the city of Ita. He has clients that he’s served from over 6 years. He has the economic support of his wife who’s had a fast food counter for 3 years from which she sells empanadas, sandwiches, soups, and drinks like beers, sodas, and juices, and she also sells ice cream and cookies. 

The loan that Celso is asking for is for the general maintenance of his car which is the essential element of his work. He is thankful for the opportunity that he’s received from the Fundacion Paraguaya and from Kiva.

loans.use: to do taxi maintenance.

loans.name: Dhahabu

texts.en: Dhahabu is a 38-year-old divorced woman. She has six children ranging from 5 to 14 years old. She describes herself to be a decisive woman. She operates a retail store where she sells water, clothing materials, etc. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located at a viable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of water. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more water and clothing materials. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: to restock her retail store with items such as water, clothing materials, etc

loans.name: Ndeye Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye Fatou est une femme divorcée de 31 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Elle s’active depuis plusieurs années dans le secteur de la couture. En meme temps elle s’adonne au commerce et a l’aviculture depuis un an. Elle a choisi ses activités par opportunité en vue d’exploiter l’espace disponible chez lui et d’améliorer le niveau de ses revenus. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus ce sont les flux financiers  que génèrent  ses activités. Elle est membre du guichet  de l’U-IMCEC de sa zone d’habitation depuis juillet  2007. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de poussins et d’aliments  de volaille. Cet investissement lui permettra d’augmenter ses ventes de poulets pendant les fêtes  de pâques prochaines.
texts.en:
Ndeye Fatou is 31 years old, divorced and lives in Senegal. She has worked in the sewing sector for several years and, a year ago, also started working in aviculture and sales. She started up her businesses because she saw the opportunity to use some available space at her place and increase her revenues. She is especially interested in the cash flow generated by her various business activities.

Ndeye Fatou has been a member of her local UIMCEC branch since July 2007. She is requesting a loan of 150 000 francs to buy chicks and chicken feed. This investment in her business will allow her to increase her sales of chickens during the upcoming Easter holidays.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa, a 33-year-old married mother of four children ranging in age from 7 to 17 and all in school, lives in Buchanan where for  the past 20  years she has been selling rice, oil, and pepper in the local market. Now requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, and pepper, Theresa plans to buy a piece of land and build her house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more  oil, rice, and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Abdou Fataï Olayidé

texts.fr: Abdou Fataï Olayidé est âgée de 46 ans et vit au Bénin. Abdou Fataï Olayidé a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire et  a appris le métier de mécanicien. Parallèlement à cette activité, Abdou Fataï Olayidé vend des pièces de rechange ; ce qui lui procure des revenus l'aidant à subvenir à ses besoins. Abdou Fataï Olayidé est marié à Raya. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés. En dehors de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants à leur charge. Abdou Fataï Olayidé vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Il y a environs trente et un ans que Abdou Fataï Olayidé exerce le métier de mécanicien. Abdou Fataï Olayidé s’approvisionne au Nigeria et parfois au Benin. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Abdou Fataï Olayidé sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux crédits reçus antérieurement par Abdou Fataï Olayidé ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Abdou Fataï Olayidé is 46 years old and lives in Benin. He attended primary school and quit to learn the trade of mechanic. He also sells spare parts as a sideline, which allows him to support himself. He is married to a woman named Raya. The couple have six children, all in school. They also have two other dependent children. Abdou Fataï Olayidé lives with his wife and children, and the couple handle together the various household expenses. 

Abdou Fataï Olayidé has been a mechanic for about 31 years. He gets his supplies in Nigeria, sometimes in Benin. In order to meet the needs of a growing customer base, he is seeking a third loan from ALIDé. Both previous loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.fr: Claudine est âgée de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Claudine a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Claudine est mariée à un certain Séverin. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Claudine  vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Il y a près de sept ans que Claudine vend des produits pétroliers (huila à moteur, etc.) et des palettes dans une ville du Benin. Claudine s’approvisionne au Benin. Pour répondre efficacement aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Claudine sollicite pour une cinquième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les quatre crédits reçus antérieurement par Claudine ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Claudine is 38 years old and lives in Benin. Claudine left school at the primary level. She is married to Séverin and the couple have 3 dependent children, who all go to school. Claudine lives together with her husband and children, and the couple both take care of the various household expenses.

Claudine has been selling petroleum products (motor oil, etc.) and pallets in a town in Benin for nearly 7 years. She gets her supplies in the country. To be able to effectively meet the growing needs of her customers, she is requesting a 5th loan from ALIDé. Claudine has correctly repaid her four previous loans.

loans.use: to buy some cans of motor oil and some pallets.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ SEÑOR PASION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; ella tiene 34 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas,a la vez la socia es docente del nivel primario del colegio nacional de Urubamba, la socia es una persona bien alegre y optimista y de esta forma la socia saca a su familia adelante. La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de alimento como pasto,maíz entre otros mas para a sus animales y también para la compra de mas animales. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the communal bank “Senor Pasion.” The bank is location in the Urubamba district, in the Urubamba province and the department of Cusco. 

The borrower is Luz Marina. She is 34 years old and in a common law marriage, and she has 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business raising small animals like guinea pigs and hens.  Right now she is a teacher in the first year of the national college of Urubamba. She is a joyful and optimistic person, and in this way she’s gotten her family ahead. She is asking for a loan to buy food for her animals like grass, corn, etc. as well as for the purchase of more animals. 

She is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the term of her agreement.

loans.use: to buy food for her animals like grass, corn, etc. and to buy more animals.

loans.name: Rashidatu

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Rashidatu, a single mother of a 10-year-old child. In 2002, Rashidatu established her drinks and provisions business. Having lost her dad just after she graduated from high school and with her mother having no source of income to help her pursue further studies, Rashidatu was left with no option but to go into business. Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about Le. 1,500,000 every month.

Rashidatu is requesting a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy 10 crates of stout @ Le. 85,000, 20 crates of beer @ Le. 45,000, 20 crates of maltina @ Le. 34,000 and 30 bottles of mayonnaise @ Le. 17,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 900,000. In the future, Rashidatu plans to expand the business and also hopes to see her son educated to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy 10 crates of stout @ Le. 85,000, 20 crates of beer @ Le. 45,000, 20 crates of maltina @ Le. 34,000 and 30 bottles of mayonnaise @ Le. 17,000.

loans.name: Saanou

texts.fr: Monsieur Saanou  est un homme marié de 47 ans qui habite au Sénégal. Il est père de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 11 et 17 ans. Il évolue dans le secteur du commerce et gère une quincaillerie depuis 4 ans. Il a choisi cette activité après la faillite de la société dans laquelle il était employé. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEc depuis 2 ans et 7 mois. Il a déjà remboursé 2 prêts antérieurs. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’articles de quincaillerie a   revendre. Son objectif est de renouveler le stock de la quincaillerie et démarrer  la vente de briques.
texts.en:
Saanou is a married 47-year-old who lives in Senegal. He is the father of 3 children aged between 11 and 17. He works in the commercial sector and has been running a hardware store for 4 years. He chose this line of work after the company he worked for went bankrupt.

Saanou has been a member of a UIMCEC branch for 2 years and 7 months. He has already repaid 2 previous loans. He is now requesting a loan of 500 000 francs to buy hardware products for resale. He aims to renew his hardware inventory and start selling bricks.

loans.use: to buy hardware products for resale.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru:
Назгул 39 лет, замужем, имеет троих детей -  школьников. Муж работает в преподавателем в Ошском Государственном Универстите на Факультете Экономики. 
 В поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, 16 лет назад Назгул начала свой бизнес в торговле мыломоющими товарами  на рынке со стартовой  суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Назгул сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  15,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назгул обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 117,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента.  Доходы от кредита Назгул планирует вложить в  расширение торгового места, а летом- - отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Nazgul is 39 years old, married and has three school-age children.  Her husband works as a teacher in the Economics Department of the Osh State University.  In search of an additional source of income for her family, Nazgul started her own business in sales of cleaning solutions at the market with an initial sum of 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her persistence and hard work, she was able to develop her business to have a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Nazgul requested a loan in the sum of 117,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to expand her merchandise selection.  She plans to invest the profits into an expansion of her retail space, and repairs of her house in the summer.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Martha Maria

texts.es: Doña Martha habitante de Nueva Guinea, se desempeña como Responsable Administrativa de una Gasolinera, actividad que ha llevado a cabo durante 5 años y es la que conforma su principal fuente de ingreso para el bienestar de su familia, requiere de su primer financiamiento con AFODENIC para invertirlo en enverjado de su casa de habitacion, esto le garantizara vivir en mejores condiciones y mayor seguridad en conjunto con su familia, referencias en su localidad lo consideran como una persona responsable, de buenas culturas y ademas progresiva, espera ser beneficiada con este financiamiento para poder asegurar su vivienda.
texts.en: Martha lives in Neuva Guinea. She works as the Administrative Manager at a gas station, a job that she’s had for 5 years and that provides the principal source of income to support her family. She needs her first loan from AFODENIC to invest in the gating on her home. This will ensure better conditions and more security for her family. Those in her community consider her to be a responsible person, well brought up and also forward thinking. She hopes to be a beneficiary of this loan in order to be able to secure her home.

loans.use: to put gates on her home.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, is married, and has three children.

Ali has owned a workshop since 2001, repairing and fixing cars. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to purchase a car testing machine. He aims to gain more profit to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a car testing machine.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is a 53-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family. Her husband works as a Barangay official, while she has operated a sari-sari store business for 17 years, selling items such as vinegar, soy sauce, softdrinks and toiletries, earning 12000 PHP per month.

Working hard to earn more and help improve her family's living conditions, Cristita is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and toiletries. She hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and toiletries.

loans.name: Kaiyrkul

texts.ru: Кайыркул 58 лет, замужем, воспитывает двух внуков. Основная деятельность семьи Кайыркул – это откорм и перепродажа скота.  Начатое еще в 1993 году со  стартовой суммой в 5,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство сегодня приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.   В данный момент, в хозяйстве Кайыркул две дойные коровы, пять овец и одна лошадь. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Кайыркул обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Это позволит ей увеличить своей хозяйство и приумножить поголовье скота, сделав, таким образом по ее мнению, наилучшее капиталовложение.
texts.en: Kaiyrkul is 58 years old, married and raising two grandsons. Her family's primary business is fattening up and reselling livestock.  This business, started in 1993 with an initial sum of 5,000 som (KGS), today yields about 10,000 som (KGS) per month.  Currently, Kaiyrkul's business has two dairy cows, five sheep and one horse.  In order to further increase livestock headcount, Kaiyrkul requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy sheep. This would allow her to expand her business and increase livestock headcount; thus, making the best capital investment, in her opinion.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Odinamo

texts.ru: Одинамо жительница города Куляб. Ей 24 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее дети маленькие. Она занимается торговлей и приготовлением блюд для продажи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для покупки продуктов питания для торговли и приготовления блюд.
texts.en: Odinamo is a resident of the city of Kulob.  She is 24 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are little.  She is involved in selling and preparing food for sale.  Odinamo has been in this business for six years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase food products for sale and preparation of dishes.

loans.use: to buy food products for sale and preparation of dishes

loans.name: Nasra

texts.en:
Nasra is 24 years old and married to Jamal. Together they have three children. She operates a beauty salon and has been in the business for the past 7 years. She earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) from the business.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET customer. This is her first loan and she will use the loan amount to purchase beauty products, hair relaxers, and hair weaves.

In the future, she hopes to own the best salon in the area.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products, hair relaxers, and hair weaves.

loans.name: Deris

texts.es: Deris tienen una miscelánea donde vende mercancía variada y también promociona productos varios mediante guías especializadas.  Deris es una joven de 21 años, que después de terminar el bachillerato y ante la imposibilidad de conseguir empleo,  decidió vender mercancia mediante catálogos, gradualmente cuando su negocio empezó a crecer, se organizó en un pequeño local, propiedad de su hermana y lo surtió con otras mercancías que empezó a exhibir en vitrinas, con lo que le fue le fue muy bien. Ella trabaja con el apoyo de su madre, quien le ayuda a atender el negocio de la miscelánea,  mientras se dedica a repartir productos y a cobrar. Actualmente el surtido de Deris es de ropa y accesorios, pero ella planea ampliar la gama de artículos con útiles escolares, pues ha hecho una preventa y tiene encargos. Deris ha logrado capitalizar su negocio poco a poco, pero invirtiendo todo lo que se gana en él y esto es lo que planea seguir haciendo, para continuar su crecimiento. Actualmente  acude a su credikiva para lograr un nuevo capital de trabajo, comprar mercancía en descuento y en mayor volumen y lograr aumentar sus  utilidades,  mejorando el tiempo de respuesta de los pedidos que hacen sus clientes. Su mayor sueño es tener un gran almacén en la plaza de Puerto Colombia, municipio donde habita,  ubicado a orillas del Mar Caribe y del que ella disfruta su naturaleza, su tradicion y su gente.
texts.en: Deris has a variety store where she sells varied merchandise and also sells products through specialized catalogues.Deris is a young 21-year-old. After finishing her bachelor's degree and finding it impossible to get a job, she decided to sell merchandise through a catalogue. Gradually, when her business started to grow, she put together a small store (which belongs to her sister) and stocked it with other merchandise which she began displaying in display cases. This has gone very well for her. Her mother helps her by working in the store while Deris delivers products. Deris currently has clothing and accessories in stock, but she plans to expand her stock with school supplies; she has done a pre-sale and has orders. Deris has been able to invest in her business bit by bit, but only through investing all of her income in it. She plans to continue doing so in order to continue expanding her business. She has turned to Kiva in order to gain new working capital. She will buy a large quantity of merchandise at a discount and expand her stock. This will improve her order response time. Her greatest dream is to have a large store in the plaza of Puerto Colombia, the municipality where she lives. Puerto Colombia is located on the shores of the Caribbean, and Deris enjoys the nature, traditions, and the people.

loans.use: to invest in school supplies.

loans.name: Igbal

texts.ru: Igbal vladeet malenkim produktovim magazinom. On jenat, emu 25 let i u nego odin malenkiy rebenok. On prodayet ejednevnie potrebitelskie tovari. Nachinal svoe delo Igbal s nebolshogo kapitala v sumee 200 AZN. Vpervie on obratilsa v “VF Azercredit” za kreditom v 700 AZN dla togo chtobi kupit raznovidnie tovari i nachat rasshirat sovy biznes. Segodna on planiruet rasshirit svoy magazin i kupit novie tovari na prodaju i dla etogo dela on xochet vzat 1000 AZN. Igbal trudolubiviy molodoy chelovek.
texts.en: Igbal owns a small food store.  He is 25 years old, married and has one small child.  He sells essential grocery products.  Igbal started this business with a small capital of 200 AZN.  He first requested a loan in the sum of 700 AZN from "VF Azercredit" to purchase various merchandise and started to expand his business.  Today, he plans to expand his store and buy new products for sale, and wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 1000 AZN for this purpose.  Igbal is a hardworking young person.

loans.use: to expand his store and buy new products for sale

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
San Juan es el grupo formado por 17 mujeres de la ciudad de Itá. Ellas son personas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, que se han unido con el objetivo de trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo ayudarse las unas a las otras. Actualmente se encuentran en el 5to. ciclo y su meta es poder llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
Rosalina es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comestibles de todo tipo, comenta que le va muy bien debido a que tiene muy buena sazón y sus comidas son muy solicitadas por sus clientes. Su meta es poder tener un local, en el cual podrá ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, condimentos, verduras, panificados y demás insumos necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos que vende.
texts.en:
San Juan is a group made up of 17 women from the city of Itá. They are very hard-working and enterprising women who have joined together with the goal of working together and helping each other. They are currently in their fifth cycle, and their goal is to reach the highest level of the program.
Rosalina is one of the group members. She makes and sells all kinds of food. She tells us that this is going very well for her because her food is delicious and in high demand. Her goal is to have a storefront in order to offer her customers greater comfort.
She is requesting a loan for the purchase of meat, condiments, vegetables, pastries and other necessary ingredients for making her food.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, pastries, and other items.
